loans.name: Naomi Nduta

texts.en:
Naomi Nduta is a 46-year-old business lady in Voi who makes detergents. She is a married mother of three. She has been making detergents and selling them for the past two years successfully.

This is Naomi’s first loan from KADET. She plans to purchase detergent chemicals and empty bottles for packaging. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase detergent chemicals and empty bottles for packaging.

loans.name: Luis' Group

texts.en:
Miguel and his both sons Luis and Marcos families live in Oaxaca, México in a small community called El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec. In El Paraíso, they just got access to the electric grid early 2012, however the service is extremely unreliable. They continue to rely on candles when the lights go out, which they mention can last up to 8 days whenever it rains due to their geographical conditions. They believe a solar system will have great value through savings on their electricity costs and will eliminate the need for the use of candles in their homes. 

All of the Rojas families work in the field, cultivating beans and corn. They work all together in faraway farms, and they sometimes have to leave their families several days in a row. When this happens, the women and the children of the family are left alone, and when the light are out, they feel they are more vulnerable.  A loan for a solar home system will not only improve security conditions for all their families, it will allow Rojas families to have 4 additional hours of quality lighting to work and for their children to study.

loans.use: Rojas families each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access in their homes and provide for their families better security conditions

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 50 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Carina is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Carina has been in this business for 3 year and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren sells encebollado, a popular Ecuadorian dish made with albacore and yucca. He learned to make this while working with a family member who was in the same business. After learning the trade well he decided to start his own operation and bought himself a tricycle cart so that he may sell his product.

Business has gone well for him and his wife who helps him. They hope that with this loan they can buy an additional tricycle cart so that he can hire a family member to sell for him. They have 4 children, all of which are still in school.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Purchase fish at wholesale prices and a new tricycle cart

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Mrs. Marcela S. Quispe and her husband Mr. Ruben Mendoza Monje, live in their house in the Villa Nuevo Potosi neighborhood on a hillside to the West of La Paz, together with their three minor children, who are still dependent on their parents. Mrs. S. works on her own account buying vegetables from producers and later selling them from her streetside stand in a residential neighborhood in La Paz, while her husband works in public transportation. Mrs. Marcela S. lives in a small dwelling on her property which was built in 2006, and has only three rooms (kitchen, dining room and two bedrooms), which needs a bathroom. The loan she is requesting is intended for the construction of such a family bathroom, (toilet, wash basin and shower), with which the quality of their live will be substantially improved, along with the families health. She has been helped by loans in five previous occasions which were used for the purchase of merchandise, and her record demonstrates her regular payments of her obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Dwight Davis, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marcela Sánchez Quispe y su esposo el señor Rubén Mendoza Monje, viven en su casa en la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, junto a sus tres hijos los cuales son menores de edad y aun dependientes de sus padres. La señora Sánchez trabaja por cuenta propia, comprando legumbres adquiridas desde los productores y que luego vende en la zona residencial de La Paz, en un puesto de venta en la calle, y su esposo trabaja en el transporte publico. La señora Marcela vive en una pequeña vivienda de su propiedad construida el año 2006 y que solo cuenta con tres dependencias (cocina-comedor y dos dormitorios), por lo que se hace necesaria la construcción de un baño. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de un baño familiar (inodoro, lavamanos y ducha) con lo que mejoraran sustancialmente su calidad de vida, así como las condiciones de higiene de la familia. La señora anteriormente ya fue beneficiada por créditos en cinco ocasiones anteriores para la compra de mercadería, y su historial muestra regularidad en el cumplimiento del pago de sus obligaciones.

loans.use: Refacción de vivienda

loans.name: Rabeya

texts.en:
Rabeya B. of 29 years old (ID-03-G), wife of Mr. Sarfuddin Ahmed of 39 years, is a member of Shapla Mohila Somity since 2002. She is a very active member of the Somity. She has three children –one girl of 11, one boy of 08 and another boy is of 04 years of age. Her husband is a lower employee of a Transport Agency with very low salary which is not enough to afford the family expenses. 

She inherits a small piece of land from her grandfather-in-law. She decides to construct small rooms for renting out. She takes a loan of US$ 750 and starts construction of the house, but can not complete the house for renting. She needs US $ 1,200 to purchase wooden doors, sands, cement, nails, C. I Sheets etc. to complete the house construction. She is of opinion that she has no risk in taking and refunding loan. She is in need of US $ 1,200

loans.use: House (C.I. Sheet Shed) Construction for renting

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga has requested a loan to help open a second vending location for her clothing business. Divorced and the mother of a six-year-old son, she is a motivated, hard-working entrepreneur who has been building her business over the last year and a half. Olga’s plan is to open a second location where she would work and hire an employee to staff her current location. She recognizes the value of expanding and hopes to increase her total income.

Olga has benefited from the help of her friends who are vendors in the market and also from the financial services provided by Nadiya Ukraine. She has been a great loan client, having never been late with a payment. We are glad for another opportunity to assist with Olga’s business and excited to see how it continues to develop in the future.

loans.use: Purchase second vending location

loans.name: Santica

texts.en: Santica, 28, sells jewelery for a living. Three times a week, she walks around the streets of her town, selling her merchandise. From time to time, people also go to her house to buy products.  Santica started her small business two and a half years ago as a way to support her three sons and two daughters. A year ago, she separated from her husband and is now her family's sole means of support.  She would like to expand her business by acquiring new products to sell.  This will help her increase her income and better support herself and her five children.  She is requesting a loan of $250 to make this possible.

loans.use: To purchase new products to sell

loans.name: Faviana Hermelinda

texts.es:
Sra. Faviana belongs to the Las Rosas de Yungay ("The Roses of Yungay") group. Her business is located in Yungay in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100), to be repaid in 4 installments, Faviana will buy more kinds of fruit so that she can offer a wider variety to her customers. Her goal is to increase her purchases so that she can take advantage of wholesale prices.

Faviana, 31, is partnered and has 2 children. She's excited to belong the Las Rosas de Yungay group. This is her first loan and her hope is to go on working and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La Señora Faviana pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay, su negocio esta ubicado en la Localidad de Yungay, Provincia de Yungay, Departamento de Ancash.

Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 ($ 100.) el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mas frutas para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. Tiene por objetivo aumentar sus productos y realizar la venta de los mismo al por mayor.

Ella tiene31 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, está muy entusiasmada de pertenecer a un grupo mientras tanto de Manuela Ramos, éste es su primer préstamo, su deseo es continuar trabajando para poder hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of fruit.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa is a hard-working mother with six children who opened a grocery store several years ago to help support her family.  Her children also contribute to the family's income by working when and wherever they can.  Epenesa is applying for a new loan to expand her business, which brings in about $112 a day. She hopes to use the extra income made possible by the loan to renovate her house.

loans.use: To restock her grocery store

loans.name: Eudeslinda

texts.es:
Eudeslinda devotes herself to the production of fruit on her farmlands: for this reason she remains as long as possible on her lands, dedicating herself to the care and fertilisation of her fields: with all this effort it is possible to obtain a good harvest and sell the products, with the aim of offering her two children an education and personal development appropriate to their age. This hard work also prompts her to think of opening a grocery store in her house and thus providing a larger share of income for the family’s kitty.

However this will require a larger investment, and so with this object in mind she is asking for your help in order to obtain the amount asked for to invest in the purchase of a larger quantity of manure and fertilizer. We hope to count on you, and appeal to your collaborative spirit.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Eudeslinda, se dedica a L. producción D. frutas en sus tierras D. cultivo, por esa razón permanece el mayor tiempo posible en este lugar dedicándose al cuidado y abonando sus terrenos; todo este esfuerzo para poder obtener una buena cosecha y venta D. sus productos con el fin D. ofrecer a sus dos hijos una educación y desarrollo acorD. a su edad. El esfuerzo también está apuntado a abrir una bodega en su casita y proporcionar mayores ingresos a su canasta familiar.

Sin embargo esto requiere D. mayor inversión; con este objetivo en mente solicita vuestro apoyo a fin D. obtener L. cantidad que solicita para invertirlos en L. compra D. mayor cantidad D. abonos y fertilizantes.Esperamos contar con usted apelando a su alma colaboradora.

loans.use: Purhase a larger quantity of manure and fertilizer in order to improve the products from his fields.

loans.name: Wiliemina

texts.en:
Wiliemina E., age 32, is married and has two children (ages 16 and 15). She owns a kiosk and a sarong sales business which she started 10 years ago. Her kiosk is open from 7 am to 6 pm daily, allowing her to earn a monthly profit of around US$70.

In the past, Wiliemina has taken out one previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania in order to improve her kiosk. She now hopes to receive a new loan to expand both of her businesses.

loans.use: Improvement of a kiosk and purchase of sarongs for sale

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica F. F. runs a stand selling fruits and vegetables at Market Huequito in the neighborhood of Comercio in Tarapoto, San Martin. She rents the space in the market where she sells a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables from all over the tropical region of San Martin.  

Angelica is 43, married and has one young child.  She was raised by an adopted family, and was not treated the same as the other relatives. She was not given many opportunities and had to work hard to survive. Angelica waited to have children until her financial situation improved, so that her children would not suffer and would have more opportunities than she did.

A member of the community bank Manos Unidas, Angelica is requesting a loan of s/ 3000 (US$1,050) to be repaid in 6 months. She plans to purchase higher-quality produce for sale, and, in the future, save enough to be able to buy a house and send her son to University.

loans.use: Purchase of high-quality produce

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa is 35 years old and the father of one child. He works and lives with his family in the town of Saida in southern Lebanon. Mustafa makes a living repairing, painting and selling cars. He has applied for his sixth loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to buy cars to work on and then resell.

loans.use: to buy cars to repair and then resell

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.en:
Rafoat R. is 38 years old. She is married, and she has 3 children. Her husband is unemployed at the present time, which is why she is the only one who is currently earning money to support their family. Rafoat and her husband are raising their children with love and are trying to ensure that their kids have everything they need as they grow up.  
Rafoat has been running her business already for 7 years. She sells fabrics, which are supplied from Dubai, United Arabian Emirates, and Kyrgyzstan, for the national dresses. The national dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and are a very important item for the dowry of any girl. Rafoat has trading spaces in three local markets. Because she is always very polite and has good taste in clothes, she has developed a dedicated and loyal client base in each of her three sales locations. 
Rafoat is trying to develop a wider range of goods to meet the ever-changing demands of her customers and to satisfy the needs of her clients who have different levels of income. Currently Rafoat is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 to be repaid over a term of 6 months to order a new stock of fabrics from Dubai. She would like to thank everybody who made the decision to support her and promises to pay the loan back within the 6-month term.

loans.use: To diversify her product line by purchasing new fabrics to better accommodate her clients

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
Jhon works as a taxi driver and is on the payroll of the Trufi 88 of the Eduardo Avaroa union. This is the income he uses to support his young son and wife; he also helps his elderly parents. He lives in his parents' house in the Pasankeri zone of La Paz.

The loan will be used to pay for treatment for his mother's kidney problem. She does not have insurance and his father does not have enough money to cover the costs of treatment.

This is the first load Jhon has requested in Impro, and he has been approved. This loan is directly linked to our social outreach vision for the less fortunate.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer.

Jhon trabaja como transportista publico es asalariado en el Trufi 88 del sindicato Eduardo Avaroa, es su fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo y esposa; también ayuda a su padres que son de la tercera edad, vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la Zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para el tratamiento de Salud de su madre ya que padece un malestar en los riñones y no tiene ni seguro médico ni su pafre no tiene el suficiente dinero para cubrir el tratamiento.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Jhon. Este préstamo está directamente vinculado a nuestra visión social de ayuda a los más pobres.

loans.use:
To cover the treatment costs for his mother's kidney problem

costos de tratamiento de un problema en los riñones de su señora madre.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru:
Zebo U. lives in the city of Yavan. She is an experienced tailor. She has been working as a tailor for the past 12 years. She is 47 years old and has 6 children. Her husband is currently away earning money for the family and therefore Zebo and her children are living on their own. She works from home. There is a large demand for her services. She tries to do her best to meet the demand. She would like to better the quality of service she provides. For this she would like to purchase a sewing machine with a serger function. For this purpose she would like to obtain a credit. She plans to return the money within an 8 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Юнусова Зебо жительница города Яван. Портниха со стажем. Работает швеей уже 12 лет. Ее возраст 47 лет и унее шестеро детей. Живет с ними одна , так как муж уехал на заработки. Работает на дому . Спрос на ее услуги очень большой. Она старается успеть обшить всех клиентов. Но Зебо очень ответственная и поэтому она хочет улучшить качество обслуживания. Для этого ей необходимо купить швейную машинку , которая делает оверлог. Поэтому она планирует получить кредит , погашать который сможет в течение 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Allanazar

texts.ru: Алаеров Алланазар житель района Хуросон.Возраст 53 года, женат , имеет 7 детей. Образование среднее. Клиент более 15 лет занимается куплей продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Он покупает молодых бычков на местном рынке , откармливает их в течении 45 дней и продает по более выгодной ему цене. Этот вид бизнеса помогает ему содержать его  большую семью.В данный моменнт Алланазар хочет купить 2 бычков.Поэтому он решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Allanazar A. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 53 years old, is married and has 7 children. Allanazar has a high school education. For over 15 years he has been purchasing and reselling livestock. He purchases young calves at the local market, fattens them over 45 days and sells them for a profit. This business helps Allanazar to support his large family. Allanazar would like to purchase two calves and has decided to take out a 12 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A., known as Vic, is 31 years old and a divorced wife with a kid who is currently in school. She says selling lingerie, jewelry and slippers, especially for women, is very profitable and therefore has been selling ladies' lingerie, slippers, jewelry and clothes through door-to-door sales for five years to support herself and her kid. With the loan, Vic wants to buy bales of lingerie, slippers, clothes and jewelry to increase her inventory and sales for a good income. She believes this loan would help her save more money to rent a shop to house her goods

She is a member of the group called Together. Members of the group agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan. Victoria does not sell on group meeting days and her photo was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bales of lingerie, jewelry, slippers etc.

loans.name: Vun

texts.en: Mrs. Vun M. lives in Ty Boun village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She makes fish paste from different kinds of fish, and sells it, as it is a popular dish of Cambodian people. Since her current business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish to make more fish paste, and be able to satisfy her customers’ demand. Her husband, Mr. Chea Chengly, is a motorbike driver. Mrs. Vun M. is 29 years old and the mother of three children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fish to make more fish paste.

loans.name: Teng

texts.en: Mrs. Teng Y. lives in Prey Takhab Village in Takeo Province. She is a 55-year-old widow with three children who are all employed in a garment factory. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn her living. Although Teng and her children have multiple businesses, they still cannot afford to buy tile and cement to make a tile floor for her house. She hopes to provide her household with better conditions with this loan.

loans.use: Teng would like to buy tile and cement to make a tile floor for her house.

loans.name: Mr. Sun Sout Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people who live in Phum Soupy Village in Kampong Chhnang Province have formed a group and have requested a village bank loan. They will use the loan for different purposes.

Mr. S. S. is the village bank loan president, and he is a vet who makes a small income to support the family. Aside from this business, he breeds pigs. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so Mr. S. S. decided to ask for a loan to buy three more pigs for breeding. His wife, Mrs. El Sum, is a housewife who cooks the delicious food for the family. Mr. S. S. is 28 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study because they are two and four years old. All of the members of the group are present in the picture, except for two at the back who are blocked.

All of the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy three more pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Kholiyar

texts.en:
Kholiyar C. is 37 years old. He and his wife (pictured here) have five children. Kholiyar has a middle special education. His specialization is engineering, but he went into agriculture because his salary was too small to feed his family and pay for his children’s education. Kholiyar works hard to cultivate his crops, such as potatoes, carrots, onions, and other vegetables. He works from early morning till late at night, hoping to have a rich harvest. Kholiyar sells his produce in the market where it is always in high demand due to its good quality. He also raises cattle. His work fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and grow his business. Kholiyar has a large and friendly family who are all always trying to help each other. Today Kholiyar requests a loan of 2500 Somoni (US $725) for the term of 9 months to buy fertilizer and also calves. Let's help Kholiyar as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets (including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizer and calves

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hoàng Thị Bình  năm nay 26 tuổi. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con nhỏ tại Thanh Hóa.  Chị Bình tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Hiện tại chị  đang làm may tại xưởng may công nghiệp còn chồng chị buôn bán hàng rong và nuôi cá giống tại nhà. Với mức thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định hơn. Thời gian tới gia đình chị đang có kế hoạch đầu tư mua máy khoan cắt bê tông để phụcvụ nhu cầu của bà con địa phương  vì thế chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000đ.
texts.en:
Ms. Hoàng Thị Bình is 26 years old. She lives in Thanh Hoa with her husband and young child. Ms. Bình joined TYM Fund in 2005. She is currently working as a seamstress at a sewing factory, while her husband raises fish and peddles miscellaneous goods. With a monthly income of 3,500,000 VND, her family's life continues to improve each day. In the near future, because her family plans to invest in a cement cutter to meet the demands of the local community she hopes to borrow 6,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase machinery construction activities

loans.name: Qorimakis Group

texts.es:
Este banco se denomina  “QORIMAKIS”, nombre quechua; que etimológicamente significa, Qori oro y Makis significa manos; la traducción vendría hacer “manos de oro”; Este grupo conformado por 13 miembros, están situados en la zona sur  de la ciudad del Cusco.

Los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades, 04 de ellos son artesanos, trabajan con arcilla, madera, cuero, y otros elementos, otros 03 socios son comerciantes minoristas ellos compran y venden papas en el mercado central, otros 02 se dedican a la compra de ropa al por mayor en la capital y la traen a Cusco a vender, otros 02 socios tiene su pequeña librería y comprarán útiles escolares para vender en su barrio, en 02 semanas más se iniciarán la labores escolares en los diferentes colegios de Perú,  dentro de los pequeños negocios en los que invertirán estos socios están los pagos de las matrículas y otros gastos personales.

Los socios agradecen el apoyo prestado mediante este medio y se comprometen a pagar las cuotas y el total de la deuda en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
This bank is called "QORIMAKIS", a Quechuan name, which etymologically speaking, comes from "Gold" (Qori) and Hands (Makis): so the name translates as "Golden Hands". This group consists of 13 members, from the southern area of the town of Cusco. The members work in different areas. Four are artisans working with clay, wood, leather and other materials. Another three members are retail merchants who buy and sell potatoes in the central market. Another two members work buying clothes wholesale in the capital and bringing them to Cusco to sell. Another two members have a small stationary shop and buy school equipment to sell in their area: in two more weeks' time the school term will start in Peru's different schools. The small businesses in which these members have invested provide the money to pay school fees and other personal expenses. The members are very grateful for the support lent through this means and promise to promptly repay the entire loan within the agreed time.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for artesanal activities,clothes to sell and general school materials.

loans.name: Gbemisola

texts.en:
Gbemisola is single parent with four children. She sells provisions and cosmetics.

She has been borrowing from LAPO to support her business for the past three years. Life is a little better than when she was not borrowing from LAPO.

Gbemisola has been in this business for the past 10 years and she lives in Agege, here in Lagos. Gbemisola is 49 years old and she is soliciting for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provision and cosmetics to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: Purchase more provisions and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Gertrude Muwanguzi‘S Group

texts.en:
Gertrude is 39 years of age, married, and the mother of 6 children aged between 3 and 10 years. All of her children go to school. She owns a six room house where she lives with thirteen people and takes care of three additional family members whose parents can't look after them. She does not have access to electricity or piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Gertrude designs bridal wear and other fashions according to the customers' wishes in Kabowa–Ndeeba, one of the city suburbs. This is how she earns a living. She buys materials from Kampala City, while other customers bring in their own material and she charges them labour. She uses public transport to and from shopping. Gertrude receives about 3 customers a day and sells to all categories of people, but mainly women and on a retail basis. Gertrude works seven days a week. She has done this business for six years now. Gertrude is faced with the challenge of increases in the price of materials and seasonality (where customers can’t come in any day or time). Her husband goes to pay her loan, so that she can remain in business. This is her 8th loan since she joined MCDT and she has been with MCDT for 3 years, working with the same group mates. One of the group members, Mary, wants to use this loan to buy more materials for her business. She aspires of owning a permanent plot for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for resale.

loans.name: Yasmeen Rasheed Masih Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji is the wife of R. M.. They have lived in a city named Lahore in Pakistan for the past eight years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. She is the mother of two kids, one son and one daughter. Both of her kids go to school. Yasmeen baji operates a business sewing clothes. She does this work to pay off her kids' school fees. Her husband sells fruit from a cart by making a loud voice in different communities. Yasmeen baji is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her husband’s business.

She is the leader of this group of three other women from her locality. Sonia baji wants a loan to buy a lathe machine. Humaira baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Ailas baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to bolster her little business

loans.name: Encarnaciona Jovina

texts.es:
Encarnación es socia del Bancomunal Paz y Desarrollo
Encarnación es casada tiene  53 años, dos hijos de 30 y 24 años que trabajan
Encarnación cuando se caso su esposo ya tenia su carpintería, elle decidió trabajar junto a el, ella se encarga de las compras, la  especialidad de su carpintería es sillas de madera, tiene local propio.   
Desde que Encarnación esta en Finca, le enseñaron ahorrar  y ganamos los fines de ciclo. le gusta reunirse con sus amigas. del Bancomunal.
Encarnación necesita  1400 soles, para la compra de madera, caoba, cola, lija.
El sueño de Encarnación es tener una mueble de muebles.
texts.en:
Encarnación is a member of the communal bank called "Paz y Desarrollo" (Peace and Development). Encarnación is married, is 53 years old, has two kids, 30 and 40 years old that both work. Encarnación's husband has a carpinter shop and when she married him she started working with him. She was put in charge of buying materials. They own the space that they run the carpinter shop out of. Since Encarnación has been in Finca they have taught her how to save money and run the business better. She likes to get together with her friends from the communal bank. Encarnación needs a loan of $475 (1,400 Soles) to buy mahogony wood, glue and sandpaper. Encarnación's dream is to have her own furniture store.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mahogony wood, glue and sandpaper.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married 34-year-old woman, a mother of six children (ages 3-17 years), and a self-professed “fish monger.” She sells dried fish, (“Obambo” and “Bude” fish, in the Luo language) in the Kisumu area. Pamela buys her dried fish near Lake Victoria and carries the load on her head as she sells her products door-to-door.

Pamela will use the loan to buy more stocks of dried fish. She wants to have a successful business in order to educate her six children.

loans.use: dried fish

loans.name: Evertz José

texts.es:
El señor Evertz R. se dedica a atender su pequeña pulpería que posee en su localidad en el municipio de Telica donde ofrece todo tipo de productos los cuales son ofertados a sus clientes que a diario le visitan para hacer sus compras.

Actualmente, el señor Evertz ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para realizar la compra de sus productos y así ofertarlos a sus clientes. Él espera que su crédito le sea brindado para suplir su pulpería.
texts.en:
Mr. Evertz R. is dedicated to his small grocery shop which is located in the municipality of Telica, where he offers all kinds of products to clients who visit him in a daily basis to do their shopping. Mr. Evertz has gone to Ceprodel to request a loan that will be invested in the purchase of more products to offer to his customers. He hopes to get the loan to keep the business going.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Самебой

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Самебой мужчина  59 лет, занимается откормом и продажей мелкого скота. Он работает арендатором в колхозе. Для закупа несколько голов баранов Самебой хочет получить повторный очередной кредит. Самебой доволен кредитованием, потому что его семейное положение улучшилось и прибыль увеличилась.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 30years old she is single with no children and she is living independently. Life she said is a bit challenge but she tries hard to overcome most of them. She is currently into sale of earrings and necklace made with silver, copper, and gold brands and she sells them through hawking through the market. She takes stock of goods from Kumasi and retail to her customers. She requests the loan to buy earrings and to upgrade her stock. She takes delivery of goods from Kumasi. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy assorted earrings and necklace in bulk.

loans.name: Eve

texts.en:
Eve T. (0) is a 29 year-old woman living in the town of Leloto-Leauvaa.  She is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To make a living, Eve owns & operates a business raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting cocoa for sale.  Eve has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 250 tala WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Eve joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Eve is now requesting a new loan of 1000 tala WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by her from SPBD.  Eve plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
S. Shuhrat is a young guy who wishes to improve his business to be able to support his family and offer them a better quality of life. Four years ago, Shuhrat started selling car spare parts. His business has grown little by little; he now offers a variety of products. His starting capital was $1000 US from his savings. Today, Shuhrat has been working with IMON International for more than a year, and feels very satisfied with the support offered to him, because it has allowed him to increase his business, satisfy the needs of his customers and support his family.

Shuhrat applied for a loan of $2400 US in order to purchase new goods for his store. He wants to develop his business and increase his income to save money and create a better life for his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for cars

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase soil additives and fertilizer

loans.name: Liliose

texts.en:
Liliose K. is 32 years old and is divorced with three children aged between 9 to 12 years. Liliose and her family live in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Recognizing the need to make a living for herself, Liliose started her business of making dresses and decorations just one year ago. Her business is open from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Liliose is now requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of adding to her working capital and purchasing more and better quality materials at better prices and in greater quantities in order to attract new customers and earn more profit.

Through accessing this loan, if her expansion plans are successful, Liliose will be able to continue her life as a self-employed woman with a successful enterprise. The savings from additional profits that are not reinvested in her business will allow her to take even better care of her three children.

loans.use: To buy more and better quality materials

loans.name: Arslan

texts.en:
Arslan M. is 45 years old, and she lives with her husband and children in Khovd province in western Mongolia. She has five sons and one daughter. Her oldest son lives and works in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city; her two middle sons live with their father in the countryside; and her two youngest sons and daughter are students at local schools.

M. operates a small boot-making and boot-repair business in her town. She makes durable boots, which she trades with herders in the surrounding countryside. As many herders do not have cash to purchase new boots, she trades her products for a variety of dairy products and animals. She then sells these dairy products at the local market in her town for a profit. Her husband and two of her sons live and raise the animals they acquire in the countryside. The family uses the animals for meat and furs.

M. started her business in 2008 yet she has quickly found success. Indeed, her business has enabled her to maintain both of her family's homes and to ensure that her family has a high standard of living. M. is a very hard-working, sociable, and business-minded person. She always looks for ways to increase her earnings and to improve her business. For instance, she explains that, last summer, she experimented by starting a retail grocery business, which was quite profitable. She notes that she will continue to produce boots in the hope that one of her children can start a grocery business in the future. In this way, she is trying to do many things in order to provide for her children. M. is requesting a loan in the amount of 500,000 tugrug (approximately $375 USD) to purchase materials such as felt boots, leather, and rubber for her boot-making business.

XacBank was founded in 2001 and listed its first Kiva loan in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but it also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale, and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the maturity of their loans. This practice not only allows borrowers to realize a financial gain, but also encourages them to save money.

loans.use: To expand and improve her boot-making business by purchasing materials such as felt boots, leather, and rubber

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila J. sells fresh vegetables in the market. She is requesting a loan in order to buy other goods to offer for sale, such as salt, sugar, and rice. Laila is 40 years old and is divorced. She has four children, all of whom attend school. With the profits she expects from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to live in with her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy other goods to offer for sale, such as salt, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. The demand for her groceries is high in her community. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

Grace lives in Warri, Delta State. She is a hardworking woman, married with children. With this business, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 170,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe Benkadi  de l’association Dièlegnan sont essentiellement des femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne  47ans,  7 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Ouayerma II, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles. 
Le prêt précédent fut correctement remboursé, sans aucune difficulté. 
Elles font la vente  de tapis, de vêtements  pour enfants, du bois de chauffe, des produits de beauté, des produits pharmaceutiques naturels etc. .  
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, un chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 6 tapis de format  moyen et 4 douzaines de vêtements pour enfants. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants.
Elles vendent au marhé de Ouayerma II de façon fixe,  de façon ambulante dans la ville et à domicile, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionne demander plus de capitaux pour aménager leur point de vente et mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkadi group, part of the Dièlegnan association, are primarily married women. They are of an average age of 47 and have an average of 7 children. They generally live in polygamous families in Ouayerma II, one of the districts of Sikasso, the third largest administrative region in Mali. This is the second project that they have undertaken with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation in order to meet their customers' needs; their first loan was repaid successfully. They sell rugs, children's clothes, firewood, beauty products, natural pharmaceutical products, etc. With their new loan they intend to buy a cartload of firewood, 6 mid-sized rugs and 4 dozen lots of children's clothes. They source their products from the Sikasso town market and neighbouring villages. They sell their goods from market stalls at Ouayerma II and through mobile sales in town and at home. Sales are cash- and sometimes credit-based, and their customer base is made up of both men and women. The women envisage generating an average monthly profit of 20,500 FCFA; some of this would be saved or spent on family needs, and the rest would be reinvested in the business. They aim to ask for more funds in order to equip their store and to satisfy the demands of their customers.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various items

loans.name: Lucinda Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Lucinda, inicia su ciclo 13  con  19 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. cereales, leña, verduras, calzados, panes, golosinas, cosméticos, abarrotes en general, comida, combustibles, materiales D. construcción.

Como es el caso D. L. señora Leonora que es conviviente, tiene 45 años y 6 hijos, Leonora venD. fruta D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado central, actividad que realiza D. lunes a viernes, mientras que los días sábados viaja a L. feria en donD. compra cereales que venD. en el mercado D. abastos.

Mientras que Elsa es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Elsa junto a su esposo tienen una tienda D. calzados en un local alquilado, sus productos los adquiere en L. ciudad D. Lima y Trujillo.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 750 soles  haciendo un total D. 9,900 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. frutas, cereales, calzados, arroz, azucar, aceite, leche, carne, golosinas y cosméticos.

Los sueños D. las socias son construir su casa, tener local propio, que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
El Banco Comunal Lucinda begins its 13 season with 19 female members. The members all have different businesses, such as the sale of cereals, firewood, vegetables, footwear, bread, lollies, cosmetics, general grociers, food, fuel, and construction materials. For example, señora Leonora lives with her partner, is 45 years old and has 6 children. She sells fruit in the central market, an activity which she does from Monday to Friday, and on Saturdays she travels to the market where she buys cereals that she sells in the wholesale food market. Elsa lives with her partner, is 28 years old and has 2 children. Together with her husband Elsa has a shoe shop in a rented place. She aquires her products in the cities of Lima and Trujillo. The members need different loan amounts, such as 300 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles, making a total of 9,900 soles in loans from the Banco Comunal. The loans will be invested in the purchase of fruit, cereals, shoes, rice, sugar, oil, millk, meat, lollies and cosmetics. The dreams of the members are to build their houses, own their own houses, that their children become professionals and that they improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of fruit, cereals, shoes, rice, sugar, oil, milk, meat, lollies and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sabenty Enterprise Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Sabenty Enterprise' group from the northern city of Makeni in Sierra Leone. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each from SMT/Kiva. This will be their very first loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, earn more profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of borrowers is Zainab K., in the middle of the photo. The 35-year-old is married to a driver and they have 3 children – 2 in primary school and one in secondary school. For 2 years now, Zainab has been selling firewood. With her share of this loan, she will buy more firewood to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy firewood to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Bolale

texts.en:
Bolale lives in Lagos State where she sells loaves of bread and drinks at retail prices to her customers. With over twenty years of experience in sales, she is very willing to expand her business. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.

Bolale has five children: three males and two females. She is 50 years old and married. Although she is advanced in age, she is energetic and optimistic about the future of her business and that of her family. She hopes to make more profits that will enable her to purchase a plot of land where she can build her own house.

Bolale hopes for a loan of NGN 160,000 to purchase more loaves of bread and drinks to sell. She says thank you in anticipation to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread and drinks to sell

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is 55 years of age, married, and has seven children between the ages of 16 and 38. Three of her children go to school. The rest are working small jobs in Kampala city. 

The family owns and lives in a four-room house where Asiya stays with four people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but has no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day. Asiya's greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for children and grand children, medication, feeding the family and rent.

Asiya sells yellow bananas and roasted bananas in Kitawuluzi. She buys bananas from Owino market and so incurs little transport costs to and from shopping. She receives an average of forty customers a day. Asiya has operated this business for over thirty years. Her main challenges are defaulters and the rainy season, because she works from a very open place and on a retail basis only. She sells to all categories of people.

She has been with MCDT for over nine years, now servicing her eighteenth loan and working all this time with the same group mates. Asiya wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas and a charcoal stove. She is hoping to see her business grow bigger and would like to own a dairy in the future.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and a charcoal stove

loans.name: Vedith

texts.es:
La Sra.Vedith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, del Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 45 años y es madre de 03 hijos,  02 que aun depende de ella y está estudiando. La Socia presenta estudios de Secundaria Completa.

Vedith, tiene por actividad la venta de pollos a la brasa, ubicada en su misma casa un local  amplio y  acondicionado y nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, donde sus principales clientes son amigos del barrio, moradores, vecinos y tiene muy buena acogida, sus venta lo realiza a partir de las 6:30 pm, es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como pollos en javas; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, verduras y parte del dinero lo invertirá en comprar utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención y a sus clientes. 

Se siente contenta y llena de vida, por su trabajo realizado, su sueño es seguir creciendo y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio, tanto a ella como a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante y formar su negocio.
texts.en:
La Sra.Vedith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, del Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 45 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que aun depende de ella y está estudiando. La Socia presenta estudios de Secundaria Completa. Vedith, tiene por actividad la venta de pollos a la brasa, ubicada en su misma casa un local amplio y acondicionado y nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, donde sus principales clientes son amigos del barrio, moradores, vecinos y tiene muy buena acogida, sus venta lo realiza a partir de las 6:30 pm, es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como pollos en javas; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, verduras y parte del dinero lo invertirá en comprar utensilios para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención y a sus clientes. Se siente contenta y llena de vida, por su trabajo realizado, su sueño es seguir creciendo y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir en iniciar su negocio, tanto a ella como a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante y formar su negocio.

Translated from Spanish by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos.

loans.name: Toktosunova Aysha`s Group

texts.ru:
Айша, 48, замужем. У нее двое детей оба находятся на заработках: дочь в Москве, работает продавщицей. А сын работает в Бишкеке на кирпичном заводе. Они оба регулярно отправляют деньги своим родителям. Айша вместе с супругом занимаются выращиванием риса, подсолнуха и пшеницы. Кредит запрашивается для закупа одной коровы для последующего производства молока.

Кенжехан 49 лет. Она вдова, ее единственный сын работает водителем в сельской администрации. Сама же клиент занимается полеводством, в основном выращивает подсолнух и пшеницу. На кредит она планирует закупить 150 кг семена, 150 кг удобрений и 100 лт солярки. 

Меринса, 53, вдова. У нее трое детей.  Старший сын работает в Бишкеке и ежемесячно отсылает домой около 150 долларов. Остальные двое учатся в школе. Меринса занимается животноводством.Кредит запрашивается для закуп одной коровы. 

Бурулбу проживает вместе со своей семьей в селе Мырзаки. Ее супруг работает в местной школе, а сын работает в России. Клиент выращивает сельхозпродукции на своем земельном наделе. Этим бизнесом она занимается с 2001 года. Кредит запрашивается для закупа дополнительных 0.5 га земельного надела, чтобы увеличить площадь посевных. 
  
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Aysha is 48 years old and married. She has two children, who both work. The daughter works as a salesperson in Moscow, and the son works at a brick factory in Bishkek. Both of them regularly send money to their parents. Aysha and her husband are involved in growing rice, sunflower and wheat. Aysha is requesting the loan for the purchase of one cow for subsequent milk production. Kenjehan is 49 years old. She is a widow. Her only son works as a driver at the village administration office. Kenjehan is involved in farming and primarily grows sunflower and wheat. She wants to use the loan to buy 150 kg of seeds, 150 kg of fertilizers and 100 liters of diesel fuel. Merinsa is 53 years old, a widow. She has three children. The oldest son works in Bishkek and sends home about 150 dollars monthly. The other two children attend school. Merinsa is involved in animal husbandry. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of one cow. Burulbu lives with her family in the village of Myrzaki. Her husband works at a local school, and son works in Russia. Burulbu grows agricultural crops on her plot of land. She has been involved in this business since 2001. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of additional 0.5 hectares of land in order to increase the sowing area.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna B. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est célibataire et mère de 02 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banv Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU depuis 5 ans et demi et a eu l'expérience de 11 prêts au sein de son groupe. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine, elle va acheter une dizaine de moutons qu'elle embouchera pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les écouler au niveau des différents marchés hebdomadaire de sa localité. Son objectif est de subvenir aux différents besoins de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
Sokhna B. is 40 years old, married and the mother of two children under her care. She has been a member of the KEUR NGALGOU “Banc Villageois” loan group for 5 ½ years and has benefited from 11 loans within the group. She fattens sheep, and will buy ten sheep to be fattened for at least five months before they are resold in the area’s weekly markets. She aims to meet the various needs of her children.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her activity selling livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nelya

texts.en:
Nelya is married with a grown daughter. She used to work at the Pavlograd mechanical factory. However, her salary was held back most of the time while the work itself was very hard. Therefore, Nelya resigned and launched her small enterprise in the central city market. Today she is an entrepreneur who sells a variety of retail items. Nelya owns 3 vending locations and sells plastic bags, napkins, tissues, toilet paper, etc. Nelya has been in this business for 12 years. She is an experienced market vendor who has gained loyal clientele. Currently, she has 50,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her net profit amounts to 4,000 - 7,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Nelya is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional plastic bags in bulk for further retail sale in her kiosks. This business is the main source of income for Nelya's family. It sustains Nelya's family as well as her daughter and granddaughter who currently live with her. Nelya has an outstanding credit history with no loan delinquencies. We believe the current loan will also be repaid on time.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Mrs. S., aged 30, owns and operates a handicraft business making and selling rattan cupboards. She sells rattan that her husband weaves or she orders from other weavers who live in the village. She and her husband also take time to sell retail by using their horse-drawn cart as transport. It takes a week to sell all their rattan. S. has received orders from her customers but she lacks the capital to satisfy her customers' needs. For this reason, S. has decided to request a loan to purchase a larger amount of raw materials so she can weave many sets of rattan cupboards to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.use: To purchase larger amount of raw materials

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda A. is a widow who lives in Prk. Mahida-eton, Brgy. Sampinit, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fish-vending  business.  

Nilda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nilda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 12th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use to purchase fishing nets so that she can continue to save for her future, and for pumpboat repair and maintenance. Nilda A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchase new fishing nets and for boat repair and maintenance

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila, de 23 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Leonardo de 25 años y sus 2 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Todos los días, desde muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja cultivando papa y alverja, el cuidado que les proporciona será muy importante para que las ganancias que obtenga sea buena, siendo comercializados en el mercado de Tarma, lugar donde mejor le pagan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, puesto que ve los resultados de su arduo trabajo que puso sobre sus campos. Lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantas de las plagas que afectan la producción. En adelante, sembrará en la totalidad de espacio que tiene en el campo para así incrementar sus ganancias. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Lucila is 23 years old and a simple, hardworking woman. She lives in her own home along with her 25 year old husband Leonardo, and two young children who are the motive for all her efforts. Every day from early in the morning she works growing potatoes and beans. The earnings that she receives from her crops are good as she sells them in the Tarma market where they pay her well. What she likes most about her work is harvesting as she can see the results of her hard work in the fields. She has been doing this activity for the past 6 years and considers the most difficult part is guarding her plants from the diseases that affect production. In the future, she will plant the entire space that she has in the countryside in order to increase her earnings. This is the third loan she has had with MFP and this assistance has helped her greatly in the progress of her work. In her communal group she is well loved by the rest of her companions as she is very loyal to them. With the thousand Nuevos soles that she is soliciting, she will purchase fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy materials for kitchen project.

loans.name: Kilengo Ole

texts.en:
Kilengo has been rearing cattle to sell in Naivasha town for the last three years. He is 24 years old, is married to Matayian Ene Kipino, and they have three children.

Kilengo was introduced to KADET by his friend and has no history with any other microfinance institute, this being his first loan. He plans to use the money to buy more cattle which he will add to his herd and later sell to his customers.

Naivasha is a place well known for its nyama choma zone. Nyama choma is a Kiswahili phrase that actually means open barbecue (meat roasting), and many people go to this place during the holiday seasons to roast beef and goat. So this business of buying and selling of animals is very common in this region.

Kilengo hopes to have a big ranch where he will raise his animals and sell them to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Sroun

texts.en:
Sroun S., 31, is married and lives with her three children in Takeo province. She is a professional silk weaver, making approximately US$2 each day. Her husband buys and sells cows and the family is also supported by his US$5 income each day.

Sroun S. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 for her husband to use to buy and sell more cows.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy and sell more cows

loans.name: Dunyamali

texts.ru:
Dunyamali S. 27 let. On ne jenat i jivet v Fuzuli regione vmeste s semyoy. Dunyamali zakonchiv shkolu postupil v universitet a potom vernuvshis iz armii nachal rabotat. 

Dunyamali uje 2 qoda kak rabotayet v etom biznesse prodaji straitelnix materialov. Dunyamali etomu biznessu nauchilsya u svoyeqo dyadi kotoriy posovetoval emu zanatsya etim biznessom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit stroyitelniye materiali dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en:
Dunyamali S. is 27 years old. He is not married and lives in the Fuzuli region together with his family. After finishing school, Dunyamali was accepted to a university and then started to work, after returning from the army. Dunyamali has been working in the business of selling construction materials for 2 years. He learned this business from his uncle, who advised him to get involved in this business. He currently needs 2000 AZN in order to buy construction materials for resale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Mrs. Saom Bo Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The eleven people who make up this village bank loan live in Chen village in Takeo province. Mrs. Saom B. is 41 years old, and was selected to be the village bank president by the other members.  Each will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

She and her husband, Mr. P. YoU., are farmers who own a one hectare plot of land on which they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. He is also a motor taxi driver. Her problem is that her field contains infertile soil. So, to improve production, Mrs. Saom B. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and with the rest of the loan she will hire a plowing machine and pay for farming laborers. 

She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a laborer, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are attending school. The day of the loan disbursement Mrs. Saom B. was busy working in the field. Her husband, Mr. P. YoU., received the loan for her.  In the photo above is Mrs. Saom B.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is currently in the business of selling fish, onions, cooking oil and sugar and is requesting a loan to stock more cooking oil and onions to sell. Mary is 34 years old and married to a policeman. She has 5 children, three of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock more cooking oil and onions to sell

loans.name: Colon

texts.es:
Colon de 38 años, tiene una panadería, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar caracterizado porque la mayor parte de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Un amigo le enseño a preparar pan para que el tenga la oportunidad de mantener con una mejor economía a su familia, con el tiempo el pudo comprar hornos y harina para tener una producción de panes mas alta. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 05h30am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. Cada pan lo vende a $ 0.08, Su esposa le ayuda con la preparación de panes y otros dulces que hacen para vender en la panadería.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina, manteca, azúcar para su negocio. En el futuro quiere seguir con su panadería pero agrandarla mas y poder construir su casa con otro piso para sus cuatro hijos de 13, 10, 6 y 4 años.
texts.en:
Colon is 38 years old and owns a bakery.  He lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil (a place which is noted for the fact that most of its inhabitants are informal shopkeepers).

A friend taught him how to to make bread so that he would have the opportunity to better provide for his family.  Over time, he was able to buy ovens and flour in order to produce more bread.  He currently works from 5.30am to 11.00pm every day of the week.  He sells each loaf of bread for $0.08.  His wife helps him make the bread and other pastries which they sell in the bakery.

With his loan he would like to buy flour, butter and sugar for his business.  In the future he wishes to continue with his bakery but also expand it and be able to add another level to his house for his four children who are 13, 10, 6 and 4 years old.

loans.use: Flour, butter, sugar

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 34 years old and married with four children.  She owns and runs Pegra Auto Spares for a living.  She started the business six years ago.  She uses her income to support the family and educate her children.  She is a hardworking lady who hopes to expand her business into wholesale.  She has requested 60,000 Kes to buy spare parts to supply at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Janifa

texts.en:
Janifa K. is currently in the business of selling cartons of salt, bags of beans and soda in a shop. She is requesting a loan to stock more crates of soda and bags of beans to sell.

Janifa is 33 years old and is married with a husband who is a business man. She has five children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more crates of soda and bags of beans to sell.

loans.name: Alba Trinidad

texts.es:
Alba Trinidad Z. E. tiene 58 años. Es soltera, vive con un biznieto y con los nietos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL BATAN se encuentra ubicada 90 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla esta conformado por 21 socios que se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Alba se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz desde hace mucho tiempo. Compra sus productos en el Cantón Bucay y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es que toda su familia tenga buena salud.

Le gusta hacer la limpieza en la casa.
texts.en:
Alba Trinidad Z. E., 58, is single.  She lives with a great-grandson and with her grandchildren in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  She has four children.

Members of the El Batan communal bank, located 90 minutes from the Chillanes office, which is part of Chillanes canton.  The bank has 21 members who are short cycle crop, like cocoa beans, manioc and maize, farmers.  They have been in this line of work for a long time.

Alba has been a cocoa bean, manioc and maize farmer for a long time.  He buys his products in Bucay canton and sells them in the Chillanes market.
She is asking for funds to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his cocoa bean crop.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet her needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  

Her dream is that her entire family has good health.

She enjoys housecleaning.

loans.use: For farming supplies and fertilizers for cocoa bean crops.

loans.name: Factory Youth Development Association Group

texts.en: T. Zainabu has a retail shop in Butogota Upper that sells sugar, drinks and salt. She is 25 years old, married and has 2 children above 4-years-old.  Her customers are mostly local people and travelers. She makes 200,000 UGX in monthly profits and gets an extra income from farming. She is very hard working and needs the loan to buy more stock for her shop since there is a ready market for the festive season and the seasons to follow.

loans.use: To restock her retail shop.

loans.name: Las Mayas Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Las Mayas” (traducido del idioma aymara podriamos decir "las primeras")iniciará el ciclo número cuatro en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por diez integrantes, la banca comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva compuesta por una presidenta, una tesorera y una secretaria de actas.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: comerciante y venta de comida, comerciante y costura de chompas, venta de calzados, tejidos de chompas, ferretería, comerciante de CD´s, venta de pollos a la Broster, venta de papas fritas, tejido de centros (ropa interior  que usan las señoras por debajo de la pollera, en número de tres o cuatro), venta de comida.

La señorita  Lucia, secretaria de actas de la banca comunal, indica que forma parte de la B.C. “Las Mayas”  cuatro ciclos.  Actualmente soltera, no tiene planificado formar familia por ahora.   Su  negocio es el tejido a máquina y a mano, chompas y mantas.   Comenzó tejiendo chompas hace tres años y hace cuatro meses que teje mantas, habilidades que aprendió de su hermana.

Las ventas son realizadas de manera ambulante en la zona 16 de julio, en las ferias de los días jueves y domingo.

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta hablar, reir y compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en: The “Las Mayas” group (translated from the Aymara language, "the first ones") is starting its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana office. It is made up of ten members. The community bank is directed by a board made up of a president, treasurer and a secretary. The members' businesses are varied: food sales, sewing sweaters, selling shoes, knitting sweaters, hardware, selling CD's, selling Broster chicken, selling french fries, knitting centros (underwear that women wear under skirts), and food sales. Lucia, the community bank secretary, says that she has been a member of the Las Mayas community bank for four cycles. She is currently single and does not currently have any plans to start a family. Her business is weaving sweaters and blankets by hand and with a machine. She started weaving sweaters three years ago and she has been weaving blankets for four months. She learned these skills from her sister. She makes these sales on the street in the 16 de Julio zone, in the Thursday and Sunday markets. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes talking, laughing and sharing with her friends.

loans.use: the purchase of wool

loans.name: Hector Arturo
