texts.es: El Sr. Arturo solicito el crédito, porque la casa donde vive al lado de su familia en una de las habitaciones, se le trasmina el agua cuando llueve y tienen 2 niños pequeños y eso hace que la humedad los pueda enfermar al paso del tiempo, además de que es una casa que ya tiene muchos años de construida y el techo necesita reparación urgente, es por eso que el Sr. Arturo se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia y el de sus hijos pequeños, porque en caso de no arreglar el techo que les esta ocasionando problemas con esta época de frío, el teme que sus hijos se le enfermen y después va a ser mas el gasto de llevarlos al doctor, por esta razón, e se ha propuesto arreglar el techo de su casa, y así estar mas tranquilo en esta temporada de invierno, y también considera que estarán mas protegidos de la humedad.
texts.en:
Mr. Arturo is requesting this loan because the house where he lives with his family has a room whose roof leaks when it rains. He has 2 small children, and the dampness could make them sick. Furthermore, it is a very old house and the roof is in urgent need of repair. For this reason, Arturo is worried about his family's well-being, especially his two small children. He worries about what will happen if he does not fix the roof, as it is causing them problems in this cold season. He is afraid that his children will get sick and it will cost a lot to bring them to the doctor. 

For this reason, he has proposed to fix his house's roof, and thus feel more calm during this winter season. They will also be more protected from the dampness.

loans.use: waterproofing and interior and exterior roof improvements

loans.name: Nilton

texts.es: Nilton C. tiene 32 años, nacido en el distrito de San Francisco convive con Maribel Segarra de 28 años y tienen dos hijos kathy de 08 años  y kelly de 03 años de edad;  viven en su casa propia, en la comunidad de Carmen pampa anexo del Distrito de Ayna San Francisco. Nilton, es el sostén de su familia; desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, desde entonces se convirtió en campesino, actualmente cuenta 05 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de palillo, cacao, hojas de coca y barbasco; que son plantas originarias de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Viene trabajando 12 años en sus propias tierras, y aún disfruta mucho su trabajo, siendo la cosecha la actividad que más le gusta, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Sin embargo lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos y hojas de coca. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este su cuarto crédito de Nilton con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro crédito con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal. Con los tres nuevos soles solicitados, comprará fertilizantes e insecticidas para cuidar sus plantaciones y así obtener buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Nilton C. is 32 years old and was born in the district of San Francisco. He lives with Maribel Segarra, who is 28 years old, and they have two children, Kathy, 8, and Kelly, 3. They live in their own house in the community of Carmen Pampa in the district of Ayna San Francisco. Nilton is the provider for his family.

Ever since he was a young boy his parents taught him to work on the farm and since then he has become a farm laborer. He currently has 5 hectares of land that he uses to grow cocoa, turmeric, and coca, plants native to the jungle of the Apurimac River Valley. He has been working on his own land for 12 years and still enjoys his work very much. His favorite part is harvesting, when he feels that the months of hard work are rewarded by the quality of his produce. However, the most challenging aspect of his job is transporting his products from the farm to the city of San Francisco, where they offer the best prices for his grains and coca leaves. In the future he desires to buy more land to increase his crops. This is Nilton's fourth loan with MFP, he knows that if he repays it on time, he will be able to ask for another loan with greater confidence and without causing problems for his community bank. He will use the money to buy fertilizers and insecticides to care for his land and obtain better crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides to care for his fields.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard S. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 39 years old. Richard is single. To make a living, Richard owns & operates a business venture in the transportation sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport in the local community. Richard has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Richard joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richard has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair the existing vehicle for better service. Richard is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Richard from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is an ambitious married man living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been working in the transportation sector for five years and his major challenge is motor vehicle breakdown. Charles needs the loan to purchase a new taxi.

loans.use: Purchase of a taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Edith Aurora

texts.es: La Sra. Edith, tiene como actividad la venta de juguetes y regalos, en el mercado de Ciudad Satélite, el destino del crédito en esta oportunidad es para la compra de mercadería ""compra de juguetes"" para el día del niño, día celebrado en toda Bolivia el 12 de Abril, donde se acostumbra a regalar juguetes a los niños. La familia de la cliente esta compuesta por su esposo y su pequeña hija, el esposo el   Sr. Ángel trabaja como fotógrafo profesional en la misma ciudad atendiendo todo tipo de acontecimientos sociales, es una familia relativamente joven muy responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Edith works selling toys and gifts in the Satelite City market. The purpose of this loan is to purchase merchandise, namely toys, for Children's Day, which is celebrated throughout Bolivia on April 12. It is traditional to give children toys. Her family includes her husband and her young daughter. Her husband, Angel, works as a professional photographer in the same city, attending all kinds of social events. They are a young family, but very responsible and with a great desire to get ahead, to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise, toys for children's day

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace B. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 26 years old. Mary Grace is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Grace owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing pedicure & manicure services to local community members. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Mary Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed like nail polish and brushes. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed like nail polish and brushes.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Olga lidia Vaquerizo Pérez, vive en unión libre con el señor  Mariano Aguilar Vázquez, con quien procreo  cinco  hijos  que están estudiando y son: Jerónimo  de veinti tres años estudia en la universidad, Gladis Mariana de trece años en  segundo de secundaria y los dos más pequeños son Pedro y Pablo  de cinco años de edad.
     Ella se dedica a la actividad de  compra y venta de pollos de granja, para luego venderlo aliñado y en pie, así como también  compra sandalia para salir a venderlo en las comunidades cercanas de su localidad, para que mejor sea sus ingresos dedicándose a sus dos negocios.
     Por su propia  creatividad decidió poner este tipo de negocio  para que pueda apoyarse ya que con o que trabaja su esposo es muy  poco y hay bese que les alcanza para cubrir otros gastos generados, por esos es el motivo de solicitar el préstamo  y trabajarlo.
     Para ella es importante que la apoyen con el préstamo ya que es una base  de cómo poder surtir mejor su  actividad para que sus clientes  estén agusto con la atención que brinda.
     Su más grande desea  es que su préstamo le ayude mucho a mejorar su calidad de trabajo y día   con día  crezca   y así apoyar  sus hijos que están estudiando.
texts.en:
Olga Lidia Vaquerizo Pérez lives in a common law union with Mr. Mariano Aguilar Vázquez.  She had five children with him who are in school.  They are: Jeronimo, 23 and going to the university, Gladis Mariana, 13, in 8th grade and the two youngest, Pedro and Pablo, are 5 years old.

She buys free range chickens that she later sells either butchered or live.  She also buys sandals to sell in the communities near her location to improve her income by doing both businesses.

It was her own creativity that led her into this type of business to support herself because what her husband earns is very little and sometimes isn’t enough to cover all the expenses they generate and this is why she’s asked for the loan to manage.

It’s important for her to have the support from the loan because it’s a base from which to better stock her business so that her customers will be pleased with the attention she gives them.

Her greatest wish is that the loan helps her to improve the quality of her work so that it will grow daily and she can continue to support her children who are still in school.

loans.use: to buy chickens and to buy sandals.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y tiene 04 hijos (3 independientes).  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, el préstamo inicial fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que utilizó en la compra de soga para luego venderlas en las ferias de Ilave, también se dedica a la crianza de vacas y chanchos.
Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, con lo que comprará un paquete de soga.
Paralelamente se dedica a la chacra de papa, habas, cebadas, trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y sobre todo mejorar sus ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta de Manuela Ramos es la facilidad del préstamo y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the “Chijuyo Copapujo” communal bank located in Ilave district, El Collao Province, Puno Department.  She is 55 years old, married and has four children (3 are independent).  She did not attend school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  Her initial, 500 new sol, loan was used to buy rope to later sell in Ilave’s markets; she also raises cows and pigs.

She will ask for a new 500 new sol loan that she’ll use to buy a package of rope.

In a parallel way she farms potatoes, broad beans and barley with her husband.

Her dream is to improve her business and, above all, improve her income.

What she likes about Manuela Ramos is the ease of getting loans and what she earns on her savings.

loans.use: to buy packages of rope.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo, de 23 años, es un joven padre de familia muy amable, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposa Mariela de 17 años y su querido hijo Ken de 2 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Gustavo es la compra y venta de pescado, su constante animo de superación ha hecho que incursione en este negocio y poco a poco se ha hecho muy conocido, ya que él vende el pescado más fresco del mercado y es un vendedor muy alegre, que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes. Espera tener en el futuro un pequeño frigorífico donde pueda vender pescados sin temor a que se malogren con el calor del sol. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido y espera poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es un socio muy querido, por la alegría que pone en el grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, hará arreglar su congeladora, ya que con el paso de los años ha ido fallando, asimismo comprará más pescado para tener más mercadería para vender.
texts.en: Gustavo is 23 years old and is a young father.  He is very friendly and lives at his parents’ house with his 17-year-old wife Mariela and their 2-year-old son Ken, for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life.  Gustavo works buying and selling fish.  His constant motivation to excel led him to enter this business and he has made himself very well-known over time, as he sells the freshest fish at the market and is a pleasant salesman who always greets his customers with a smile.  He has been in this business for four years and what he likes most about his work is chatting with his customers.  In the future, he hopes to have a small refrigerator so that he can sell his fish without having to worry about it going bad from the heat of the sun.  This will be his second loan with MFP and he is very happy to have been granted it.  He plans to make all of his payments on time.  He is very well-liked within his communal bank because of the cheerfulness he brings.  With the 1,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, he will fix his freezer as it does not work as well due to its age.  In addition, he will buy more fish so that he will have more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to fix his freezer and buy more fish.

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Chanthol (in the photo) has been a silk weaver for more than 30 years. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for more than eight years. She also supplements her income with a new business, raising pigs at home. She hopes to continue her pig farming, so she is asking for another loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to buy more piglets and feed for pigs. 
The couple lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990 and have four children-three sons and one daughter.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed for pigs.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is from the village of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 53 years old. Nenita is married and a mother of one adult-aged child. To make a living, Nenita has a small market at home. She sells assorted items like different types of food, food ingredients, medicine, laundry soap and refreshments. She has been engaged in this business for five years. She earns approximately PHP 5,600 per month. Nenita requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional stocks of refreshments to sell. Nenita has been member of GDMPC for three months. Nenita hopes to expand her business and gain more profit.

loans.use: to purchase additional refreshments to sell.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto de 61 años. Luis es un hombre increíble y ejemplar ya que ha trabajado y sigue trabajando duramente para ayudar un poco con la economía de su hogar y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. El posee una pequeña pulpería en donde ofrecen diferentes productos de primera necesidad. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos aumentar su inventario. Ha decidido solicitar este crédito para comprar aceite, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, sal, café y de más artículos para tener todo lo que el cliente solicita.
texts.en: Luis Alberto, 61, is an incredible, exemplary man who has worked hard and continues working to contribute to the household economy and give his family a better lifestyle.  He has a small grocery store where he sells different basic needs products.  His goal is to increase his inventory to improve the quality of life for his loved ones.  He decided to request a loan to buy oil, rice, sugar, beans, salt, coffee and more items so he can offer customers anything they want.

loans.use: To buy oil, rice, sugar, beans, salt and coffee.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline has operated a cosmetic shop business for the past six years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passers-by. She also does farming which provides a secondary source of income. Angeline faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesale distributor of cosmetics in the future. 

Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She and her husband have one school-aged child and live a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan she has requested, Angeline wants to purchase bundles of body lotions and hair products. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of body lotions and hair products to offer for sale

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
La señora  Dorotea tiene treinta y ocho años de edad  se dedica a la elaboración de trajes  típicos desde hace tres años.
Tiene la cantidad de un hijo de seis años de edad , la  luz de sus ojos y por quien trabaja para  ayudarle en sus estudios. 
Esta  muy contenta  por que le va muy bien en su negocio todavía  no cuenta con  un local ,pero sus clientes  van a su casa cuando ella no sale a vender esta muy contenta ya que sus clientes le gusta la  ropa que les elabora.
También se dedica a componer  ropa le gusta mucho lo que es la costura  ya que lo hace  muy bien  y sus clientes  se sienten a gusto con la ropa que ella le hace.
Pidió el  préstamo para comprar hilo cierres y una maquina nueva  por que la que tiene en ocasiones  no le sirve.
Uno de sus sueños es  poner su local de sastrería   y dar  clases de costura ya que es un buen negocio.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Dorotea is thirty-eight years old and she has been making traditional garments for three years.

She has a six-year old son and he is the light in her eyes and she works to support him in his studies. 

She is very happy because her business is doing very well even though she doesn't have a store space yet. But her clients come to her house and she doesn’t need to go out to make her sales. He is very happy because her clients love the garments she crafts.

She also makes clothing alterations and repairs. she loves anything that is sewing especially because she is able to do it so well. Her clients feel comfortable with the clothing that she makes.

She requested a loan to purchase threads, zippers, and a new sewing machine. The sewing machine she has sometimes does not work.

One of her dreams is to set up a tailoring shop and to give sewing classes, which is a very good business.

She is thankful to Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) for the support that she has received to move forward and to attain her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make traditional garments and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Rwenshama  Boda Boda Association B Group

texts.en:
Abert, aged 49, feels that he is worth his salt in his shoe sales business. He says that the inside lane of continued and future success is what his mind is set on now. He is worth his salt based on the fact that he has brought hard work to bear on his transactions. And it shows in the beehive activity at his shoe stall as clients flock either to try on the many pairs of shoes he has on offer or just to catch a glimpse. 

Abert is a humorous, focused, God-fearing and good-natured dad to four cheerful kids who are all in school at present. He says he has been in this business for 13 years now. He operates in Rukungiri, in the West of Uganda.

Abert proudly speaks of how he has been able to extricate his family from its below the breadline existence with earnings from this business. This business he says was brought into existence with savings from his maiden business - farming. He says this business generates him monthly sales income to the tune of 200,000 Ugandan shillings. He intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more pairs of shoes to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more pairs of shoes to resell

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos de 53 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Monsefú que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Santos desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento ideal para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus obligaciones familiares.  También alquila tierras de cultivo donde siembra maiz y una vez que coseche podrá obtener otro ingreso para su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la abono para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo y compra de alimento balanceado , con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales y producto podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Santos es una persona que con esfuerzo y trabajo a sabido sacar a sus hijos adelante y poderle brindar otras oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
53-year-old Santos lives with his wife and children in his own home which does not have basic services and is located in the rural part of Monsefú district, in Chiclayo province.  The people in this area farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

For some years, Santos has been raising and selling sheep.  His animal pen is located behind his home and it is both suitable and spacious.  He feeds his animals balanced feed and natural fodder so that they achieve an ideal level of growth and he is able to sell them in the different markets in his area.  This makes him good profits with which he covers his family's expenses.  He also rents farmland where he grows corn.  When he harvests his corn, he is able to make additional income for his household.

Santos has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy manure with which to improve his farmland.  He will also buy balanced animal feed.  He will use the profits he makes from selling his animals and crops to repay his loan and also enjoy a better quality of life.  Santos is someone who, through his effort and hard work, has known how to get his children ahead in life and provide them with opportunities.

loans.use: to buy manure to improve his farmland and to buy feed for his animals

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Rosylne is 41 years old and married to James  and she supports a family of four children, age 16, 14, 12, and 10 years.

She runs a grocery shop and she has been in business for 10 years and right now her monthly income is KES 10,000.She is borrowing a loan of KES 15,000, with which she plans to add stock to the business.

She plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to repay the loan. This is the second loan, and she successfully paid the previous loan well and good time. Her dreams are to expand her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To add stock to her grocery store.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia integrante del Banco comunal “Persa Rodoviario” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vende ropa deportiva para niños, damas y varones. Trabaja en éste negocio desde hace 9 años y el local lo arrienda en el persa de la ciudad de Talca. Preferentemente vende ropa de temporada y exclusiva, por lo que le ha ido muy bien en su negocio. 
Su horario es durante todo el día, de lunes a domingo. 
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en diferentes locales y distribuidoras. También los proveedores se encargan de ofrecerle mercadería en su propio local. 
Su clientela la conserva desde sus inicios, por lo tanto también es fija.
Con el crédito comprará buzos deportivos para niños, mujer y hombre, además de pantalones poleras, short y calzas.
Sus metas son acrecentar su negocio y abastecerlo de mercadería, ya que si le va bien, tendrá un mejor ingreso económico para proporcionarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Claudia vive junto a sus dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad. Claudia distribuye sus horarios para acomodarlos con su trabajo y el cuidado de sus hijos. 
Sus sueños son costear los estudios de sus hijos, para que sean profesionales. Además se encuentra realizando todos los trámites para postular y obtener su casa propia. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios entregados por Fondo Esperanza, disfruta y se siente cómoda de la compañía, fiato, lealtad y compromiso del grupo al cual pertenece. Respecto a las capacitaciones realizadas en las reuniones ha aprendido a distribuir mejor su negocio. 
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the Persa Rodoviario Communal Bank in the city of Talca.  She works in commerce, specifically selling sportswear for children, women, and men.  She has been working in this business for nine years and she rents a space in the market in the city of Talca.  She prefers to sell seasonal and exclusive clothing, which is why her business has gone well for her.  Her work schedule is all day, Monday through Sunday.  She buys her merchandise in different places and from different distributors in the city of Santiago.  The suppliers also offer her merchandise in her own place.  Her clientele has been with her since the beginning, so it is also established.

With the loan she will buy sportswear for children, women, and men, as well as pants, shirts, shorts, and leggings.

Her goals are to increase her business and supply it with merchandise, since if it goes well for her she will have a better income to give her family a better quality of life.

Claudia lives with her two children, ages 6 and 3.  Claudia arranges her schedule to accommodate her work with the care of her children.

Her dream is to pay for her children's education so they will be professionals.  She also is taking all the necessary steps to apply to get her own house.
 
Claudia is very happy and grateful for the services offered by Fondo Esperanza.  She enjoys and feels comfortable with the company, credit, loyalty, and commitment of the group she belongs to.  With regard to the training given in the meetings, she has learned how to better distribute her business.

Talca is in the Maule region, located in the central part of the country. It is the administrative, economic, and cultural center of the region, being the most important city in the Central Valley of Chile. There is a curious allusion to Talca in Chile, the expression "Talca, Paris, and London." Among the many myths about the matter, some say that it derives from something an English person once said, "Talca looks like London" [Spanish "parece" 'looks like' and "París" 'Paris' sound alike] because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city in the winter season, similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy sportswear for children, women, and men, as well as pants, shirts, shorts, and leggings.

loans.name: Piv

texts.en:
Agriculture is one of the major business sectors for the Cambodian people, one of whom is Mrs. Piv, 33, who resides in Kompong Speu province. Mrs. Piv is married and has one child who is not yet enrolled in school and is living under her care. 

Mrs. Piv's husband also helps her grow their rice crop. They typically earn around $2.5 US per day to cover household expenses but this main income is not enough for the whole family. Mrs. Piv wants to expand her business and gain more profit to improve her living conditions. Therefore, Mrs. Piv wants to receive a loan in the sum of $600 from HKL and Kiva. She wants to use it to buy a cow for farming as well as for breeding for calves. With the increase in income, Mrs. Piv wishes to send her child to school and fix some parts of her house.

loans.use: to buy a cow for farming as well as for breeding for calves.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene used her fouth loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for planting. She harvested and sold the produce and it was very profitable. She then repaid the loan well and in good time. 

This being her fifth loan, Irene plans to buy more fertilizer and seedlings and become the best farmer in the area.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 46-year-old Aminata from Kissy in eastern area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of 10 years and 27 years. In 2006, Aminata established her general merchandise business. She began her business because she wanted to enhance her independence and to assist her husband in covering the household expenses.  She also earns income from hair dressing.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more soft drinks and Star beers. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her educate her children. In the future, Aminata plans to own another shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of soft drinks and Star beers.

loans.name: Amua B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Amua B Group in Western Kenya!  Annet is the facilitator of the Amua B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Annet takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Annet had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Annet was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Annet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Annet will ensure food security and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Amua B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the above photograph, Annet is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Issam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single and lives with three family members, two of whom work.

Issam has owned a barber shop since 1997.  He offers hair cuts, shaving and trimming beards. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer need and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to repair and fix his shop’s floor and to make an outdoor ceiling.  He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring positive growth.

loans.use: to repair and fix his shop’s floor and to make an outdoor ceiling.

loans.name: Quy

texts.en: Quy is 37 years old. She is a member of An Tap cluster in SEDA. She has two children. One of them is married. She grows rice and also makes rice noodles to sell. She has had this job for 3 years. She has a monthly income of about 5.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 8.288.000 VND and repaid that loan punctually. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9.632.000 VND to buy rice to make rice noodles.

loans.use: to buy rice to make rice noodles

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 41 years old and married with four children aged 6 to 15. All of the children are currently in school. She works as a tailor and sells clothes in a store she has run for 17 years. Beatrice would like a loan to buy fabric, thread, and needles to make more clothing. Any profits will be used to pay the school fees for her children. She dreams of running a big sewing workshop where she can employ other women.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Loida requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

Loida has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Loida would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 37 años de edad, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora vive en la ciudad de nazca, famoso Nazca,  Perú. La ciudad es famosa por la legendaria Líneas de Nazca, una serie de antiguos, inmenso e inexplicable geoglifos grabados en el desierto que rodea la ciudad, generalmente atribuidos a la cultura Nazca, que habitaron en la región de 300 a 800 AD. Como tal, la ciudad atrae a una cantidad considerable de turismo. Pero Nazca también es conocida por su gente trabajadora, que han conservado a pesar de los frecuentes terremotos, tsunamis, y un alto nivel de pobreza en la región, es madre, tiene 4 hijos cuyas edades comprenden entre 17, 15, 12 y 3 años, los tres mayores cursan actualmente educación secundaria y el menor aun no va a la escuela pero es muy travieso, ella dice que le saca canas verdes.

 Marleny  se dedica actualmente a su negocio, el cual consiste en la venta de Desayunos, bebidas y raspadillas (hielo desmenuzado al cual se le añade jarabes de dulce a base de frutas), le dedica a su negocio 8 horas diarias, y en un día puede ganar hasta S/.50 y en un día muy bueno puede ganar hasta S/. 100, 	ella  se animo a tener este tipo de negocio porque quería trabajar en su domicilio para poder estar al pendiente de sus hijos en especial del más pequeño. 	

Marleny está muy agradecida por el apoyo otorgado por los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a esta ayuda ella podrá comprar insumos (abarrotes,verduras, etc) para agregar a su negocio la venta de comida en las noches, con esta mejora ella podrá obtener mayores ingresos y tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer, y más clientes, con esta mejora ella tendrá mejores ingresos y podrá ahorrar y cumplir su gran sueño:”Tener su propio local”.
texts.en:
Marleny is 37 years old. She is a very hard-working woman who lives in the famous city of Nazca, Peru. This city is famous for the legendary Nazca Lines, a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable hieroglyphics carved into the desert which surrounds the city. They are generally attributed to the people of the Nazca culture, who inhabited the region from 300 to 800 AD. Because of this, the city attracts a large number of tourists. However, Nazca is also known for its hard-working people, who have survived in spite of frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high poverty rate in the region. Marleny is a mother with 4 children, aged 17, 15, 12 and 3. The three older children are currently in secondary school, and the youngest does not go to school yet, but he is very mischievous; she says that "le saca canas verdes" [he gives her green hairs instead of gray hairs].

Marleny is currently running a business selling breakfasts, beverages and raspadillas (shaved ice with added sweet fruit-based syrups). She works at her business 8 hours each day, and in one day she might make 50 Peruvian soles, or on a very good day up to 100 soles. She was inspired to open this type of business because she wanted to work at home, so she could watch over her children, especially the youngest. 

Marleny is very grateful for the support provided by the Kiva lenders, since thanks to this help, she will be able to buy supplies (groceries, vegetables, etc.) to expand her business by offering food in the evenings. With this improvement, she will be able to obtain a better income, offer a greater variety of products, and attract more customers. With this she will have better earnings and be able to save up to fulfill her great dream: having her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy supplies (groceries, vegetables).

loans.name: Valentín's Group

texts.en: Ramiro, Valentín and Justina live in Cerro Niño, a community that is 2 hours by a dusty road away from the nearest commercial center (where the picture was taken). The households in this region do not have energy access and they rely on ocote wood (a type of wood with a lot of resin that burns easily but causes lots of hazardous fumes)  to light their households. This does not allow these families to have an adequate environment for any activities in their household, besides being a health, safety and environmental hazard. Justina for example, consumes more than 8 pieces of ocote each week for lighting. Once a week she has to go to the woods to cut down trees to collect ocote for cooking and lighting, and she dedicates up to six hours in this activity, including carrying the heavy load back home. She is very excited on acquiring a solar home system and not having to inhale the smoke caused by her current lighting sources.

loans.use: Ramiro, Valentín and Justina to buy a reliable solar home system and stop depending on ocote-pine for lighting.

location.town: Cerro Niño, Santos Reyes Nopala, Oaxaca

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda works hard to support her family. Glenda is married with two children and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Glenda requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell to her stall.

Glenda has been in this business for 1 year now, and also earns additional income from general store.

In the future, Glenda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell to her stall

loans.name: Test

texts.en: ka sIuenOn manGayu 26 qñaM nig CaRsþIEdlmanbþI nig mankUn. Kat;mankUnRbustUcmñak; nig kUnRsImñak;EdlsBVéf¶enH nag)ancUlsalaeronehIy. ka sIuenOn rksIudusxat;Rkck nig Büa)al)ateCIg ehIyKat;GacrkR)ak;kéRm)an cMnYn 2>5 duløarkñúgmYyéf¶ cMENkÉbþI rbs;Kat;CaGñkebIkbrenAkñúgRkumh‘unmYyehIy TTYl)anR)ak;ExcMnYn 100 duløarkñúg mYyEx. ka sIuenOn )anesñIsMux©IcMnYn 1000 duløar edIm,ITij tUbtUc mYyenA kñúgpSarEdlKat;GaceFVIkardus xat;Rkck nig Büa)al)ateCIg .Kat;mankareCOCak;fakarebIktUbenHGac[Kat;manGtifiCnkan; EteRcIneLIg nig GacrkmanR)ak;kéRmciBa©wmRKYsar. enAéf¶GnaKt; Kat;cg;ebIksalabeRgonbNþHú bNþalBImuxviC¢aenH EdlKat;nigbgðat;dl;Gñkd¾éTeGaydwgBIviFIedIm,IeFVIkardusxat;Rkck nig karBüa)al)ateCIgenH.

loans.use: eRbIR)as;km©IsMrab;³TijtUbenAkñúgpSar

texts.en: W. is 26 years old and is married with one child, aged 7. She sells kerosene and sometimes sells a small amount of rice (13kg per day). Her husband, Kholidin, is a fisherman who goes to the sea once a week depending on the weather. She really hopes to have a larger loan to buy more kerosene.

loans.use: Purchase kerosene to expand her business

loans.name: Julius Masika

texts.en:
Julius' business involves repairing bicycles which are the main mode of transport in his community. He started in 1991, when he realized there was an unmet demand for the service. He also sells repair parts for bicycles. He has not undertaken any formal training concerning this but he learnt through observation. His customers are mainly people from his community.

Through his business, Julius has been able to open a canteen, where he sells manufactured goods retail. With a loan from PEMCI, he wishes to purchase more bicycle repair parts and also increase the stock of his canteen.

Julius' businesses have enabled him to educate his seven children. He has developed his farm and most of all he has been of much help in the transport sector by bringing bicycle repair services to the local community.

loans.use: Purchase bike repair parts and increase the stock of his canteen

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en: Aurelia G. had been cooking for 4 years before the demands of caring for her husband and children forced her to stop. Now, her husband has left her, and she has restarted (over a year ago) the business of cooking specialty fried dishes to order. During the day, in addition to cooking,  she has to take care of her 4 children (fifteen on down to four years old). However, because she lacks help, she must leave the children on their own, at home, when she travels to deliver her orders (every afternoon). Aurelia needs this loan to build her business and save enough money to move out of her current home. She was very upset when we went to her current house, because she doesn’t like to show how humble it is. It is difficult to get to her house; there is a ravine one must cross in order to get there, and the bridge that crosses it is not safe. (This writer, for one, was afraid to cross!) The polluted waters that run under the bridge attest to Aurelia’s desire to move, but she can’t afford anything else. In fact she lives here because she cannot sell it; no one wants to come close to the foul smelling river. The kids are now so used to it, that they can’t smell it any more. Nor do they seem to get sick, despite the multitude of mosquito and other ticks that bite them daily while they sleep.  When we told Aurelia she would be getting a loan, she wept out of joy in having her prayers answered!

loans.use: Buy raw materials to cook foodstuffs

location.town: Santa Rosa Community of Villas Lindas

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir has a business selling audio and video equipment at a busy market in Nikopol, Ukraine. He loves music and brings cheer to others with his products. Vladimir is a sharp business man who always tries to keep updated products that will be in demand with his customers. Business growth is one of his biggest goals for the future.

Vladimir has requested a loan to increase his available working capital. This will allow him to purchase new inventory and continue his business development while serving many grateful customers.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. Him N. , ages 49, is a mother of six children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband are brokers, buying and reselling yams to wholesalers and earning together on average around $7 each day.  One of her children is a construction worker; another one is a mechanic and the rest are enrolled in school. Mrs. Him N. hopes to use this loan to invest in her business which is slightly increasing day by day.

loans.use: To invest in her business by purchasing more yams.

loans.name: Maletina

texts.en: In Samoa, people of all ages love pancakes, and they eat them not just for breakfast, but at any time of the day. This is the reason why Maletina decided to open a pancake stall. She knew that she could earn money making pancakes to sell not just at the village school, but also in many other places. Malteina makes about $24 a day, but hopes that the loan she is applying for will allow her to expand her business and generate the income she needs to improve her home.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her pancake business and for home improvement

loans.name: Teofila's Group

texts.en:
Lorenza, Fortunata, and Teofila have been members of the community bank Señor D. Huanca for 4, 4, and 12 months. Teofila is currently the president of her bank.

Lorenza is 52 years old. She is married and has 11 children, 4 of whom live with her. Lorenza sells fruits at the different markets around the region. From the markets she buys grains, cheese, young animals, and other products which she sells in Ayacucho. On the other hand, Fortunata is 42 years old. She is a single mother and has one son. Fortunata has a grocery store in the small town of Rosaspata in the Vinchos district. Teofila is 40 years old. She is married and has seven children. For the past two years Teofila has sold vegetables in the Grau market of Ayacucho. Before that she traveled to different markets buying and selling products, but this business was not making a profit.

Lorenza, Fortunata, and Teofila need loans of 600, 400, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying beans, barley, cheese, onions, carrots, corn, chili pepper, lemon, sugar, rice and tuna, which is a local fruit that comes from a cactus.

In their community bank they have learned to be punctual and responsible, how to care about hygiene, and about good nutrition. Lorenza, Fortunata, and Teofila dream of building a house, having more capital for their businesses, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Lorenza, Fortunata, and Teofila need loans of 600, 400, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying beans, barley, cheese, onions, carrots, corn, chili pepper, lemon, sugar, rice and tuna, which is a local fruit that comes from a cactus.

loans.name: Kyabagu Central C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hajjati S.. She is currently in the business of operating a hardware shop and is requesting a loan to add stock. Hajjati is 48 years old and is a widow. She has 2 children aged 20 and 29 and both work. Each week, Hajjati makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a commercial house. Hajjati has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more goods and the loan was paid back on time.

Hajjati is joined in her small group by Jalia M., Sarah N., Lydia N., and Hadija Kibuuka. Jalia M. has a business running a retail shop and wants to purchase more shop items. Sarah N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to boost business. Lydia N. operates a retail shop business and wants to add more capital to the business. Hadija Kibuuka is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to buy more chicks.

loans.use: To purchase more items for hardware shop

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia is a farmer and her performance is admirable for the big courage that she puts to her work. In spite of having two very small children, this does not limit her work and an example of this is to see her with her young child in her arms choosing the useful potatoes seeds for the next farming season for her land. The intense cold weather hitting her city and the lack of a fumigation tool notably limits the development of her work. Precisely for these urgent needs she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Cecilia, es agricultora y su desempeño en ella es admirable por el gran ánimo que le pone a su labor; a pesar de tener dos hijos muy pequeños no limita su trabajo y muestra de ello es verla con su hijo en brazos escogiendo las semillas de papas útiles para el próximo sembrío en sus terrenos,.El inmenso frío que azota su ciudad y la falta de una herramienta fumigadota limitan notablemente el desarrollo de su labor y precisamente a esta urgente necesidad atiende su pedido.

loans.use: Buy a fumigation tool

loans.name: Sadeta

texts.en: Sadeta is a 57-year-old woman from the town of Derventa. She is married and her husband has a full-time job. His monthly salary is 500 KM (about US$ 400). They have one child and he is a student. This is her first loan and Sadeta will use it for buying new printer and other computer equipment. She wants to improve working conditions for her son and herself so that she can translate, write and print seminar and diploma papers in a better way. Sadeta provides additional money for her family by doing this work.

loans.use: For buying new printer

loans.name: Hursheda

texts.ru:
Hursheda V. lives in Shahrinav region. She is 22 years old and single. She has a small shop where she sells cell phone cards and accepts payments from cell phone users . She has been in this business for a year. Currently, she needs to pay the rent for her shop several months ahead. But she doesn’t have enough money to do so. She plans to use the loan to pay her rent, thereby allowing her to stay in business. She plans to pay her loan back in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Вохидова Хуршеда живет в районе Шахринау. Возраст 22 года. Не замужем. Имеет свой небольшой диллерский центр, где продает сим карты и принимает оплату на телефонную связь. Занимается этим видом бизнеса 1 год. Но в данный момент ей нужно оплатить арендную плату за помещение за несколько месяцев вперед. Но на это у нее не хватает денег. Она планирует получить кредит , оплатить аренду и остаться при деле. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: To pay rent

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel is a humble 37-year-old mother. She left her hometown of Pusi more than 11 years ago along with her husband and children with the hope of finding better living conditions. They currently live in the city of Juliaca, and with the little money they took with them, they have constructed their home where they currently shelter their loving children.

Soon after arriving in this city, she started weaving beautiful skirts, pants and ponchos for women and children, which she sells as a peddler in the San José market of that city. Her hard-working husband, Felix, offers transportation services in his tricycle. As exemplary and responsible dedicated parents, they have been offering an education to their loving children, but especially to Edwar, their youngest, who due to life circumstances was born with a serious illness and is the chief motivator of their efforts and immeasurable desire to progress with their noble work and without losing hope of seeing their children in the path to a bright future.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva volunteer.

Ysabel, es una humilde madre de 37 años de edad, hace más de 11 años salió de su pueblo natal, Pusi, junto a su esposo y sus hijos con la esperanza de buscar mejores oportunidades de vida.Actualmente radican en la ciudad de Juliaca, con el poco dinero que llevaban en las manos han construido su vivienda, lugar donde actualmente cobijan a sus amorosos hijos.

Doña Ysabel inmediatamente después de llegar a esta ciudad se dedicó a tejer hermosas enaguas, pantalones, chompas para damas y niños que vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado San José de dicha ciudad.En tanto, su laborioso esposo Félix, trabaja brindando servicios de movilidad en su triciclo, ambos como ejemplares padres responsables y dedicados vienen brindándoles educación a sus 3 queridos hijos y sobre todo a Edwar el menor de sus niños, quien por cuestiones de la vida nació con una grave enfermedad y es el principal motivo de su esfuerzo e innumerables ganas de seguir adelante con su noble labor y sin perder la esperanza de ver a sus hijos encaminados hacia un buen porvenir.

loans.use: Purchase capital to increase the variety of products they offer.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermos is a 56 year old father of 7 children who are now grown with families of thier own. He has worked transporting passengers for a long time, and owns tow cycle-cars which he uses to pay for the domestic expenses. His wife, Mart, works selling candies. Guillermo is requestiong this loan to repair one of his cycle-cars which is not running well. To do this, he will need to purchase some parts. Also, he would like to begin selling home baked goods which he has learned to make, having now become a master baker. Lets support this father who has shown a desire to progress. With your help, he will be able to meet his goal in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermo tiene 56 años y es padre de 7 hijos, los mismos que ya tienen su propia familia, él se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace mucho tiempo, es propietario de dos motocarros con cuya ganancia sustenta los gastos de su hogar, su pareja, la señora Martha, se dedica a la venta de dulces.El préstamo que solicita Guillermo es para reparar uno de sus motocarros que se encuentra en mal estado, para el cual hay que comprar algunos repuestos; también, mientras no maneja el motocarro, quiere dedicarse a la venta de panes caseros ya que aprendió a prepararlos y es maestro panadero. Apoyemos a este padre que demuestra sus ganas de seguir adelante, con tu ayuda él podrá cumplir su propósito en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: To repair his cycle-car in order to keep working and to begin selling homemade bakery products.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia I. is 40-years old and married with seven children. She lives in Ubiaja, Edo State, Nigeria. She runs a restaurant where she sells drinks and cooked foods. Felicia has been in this business since 1986. She is requesting a loan for $875 to buy a larger supply of drinks to sell in her restaurant. She says thank you.

loans.use: To supply her restaurant with more drinks

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Махмудова Нигина жительница района Вахш.Возраст 38 лет, замужем , имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее.Клиентка занимается выращиванием пшеницы,помогает ей ее большая и дружная семья.В данный момент они готовятся к очередному посеву пшеницы.Для чего ей нужны деньги ,что бы купить качественные семена пшеницы.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nigina M. lives in the Vakhsh region. She is 38 years old, is married and has 5 children. Nigina has a high school education. She grows wheat and her large and united family helps her. At the moment, Nigina is getting ready for the next wheat planting. She needs to borrow money to purchase quality seeds. Nigina plans to pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat seeds

loans.name: Amewossina

texts.fr: Amewossina A. est âgé de 52 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Il est depuis  des années à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce  crédit augmenter son fond de roulement pouvant lui permettre de renouveler dans la mesure du possible son stock de marchandises étant un particulier commerçant d’alimentation générale. Les gains issus de son activité permettront à monsieur Amewossina de  réaliser plus de bénéfice et  de faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amewossina A. is 52 years old, married and the father of three school-aged children. He has lived in Lomé, the Togolese capital, for a number of years. Being in the grocery business, with this loan he hopes to increase his working capital, enabling him to restock his merchandise to the extent possible. The resulting from the business would enable Amewossina to make even more profit, meeting the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to increase his trade

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Mrs. Thea A. is a villager in Trapaing Chhouk village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. Because her field is infertile, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field to make er hcrop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Kon Phalkun, is a person who takes rice to husk.  Mrs. Thea A. is 35 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Theth

texts.en: Mr. Theth H., 29, is married and has two children, both of whom attend a local school. He lives in the Boeung Veng village in Kampong Cham Province, earning income as a rice farmer together with his wife, Mrs. Soern Sort. The rice plantation currently does not provide sufficient earnings, since the fertility of the soil is low. Mr. Theth H. is therefore asking for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field, thus hoping to increase the family's income and improve its living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for a rice field

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi: Chị Dương Thị T. năm nay 54 tuổi, chị tham  gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1992. Hiện tại chồng chị làm nghề sửa chữa điện tử tại nhà còn chị chăn nuôi gà ngan với tổng thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng đạt 4.000.000. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn  được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm ngan gà và thức ăn phục vụ chăn nuôi,
texts.en:
Mrs. Duong Thi T. is 54 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 1992. Currently her husband repairs electronic appliance at home, and she raises chickens and ducks with the family average monthly income of VND4,000,000. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND10,000,000 to buy more chickens and ducks and poultry foods.


Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising chickens and ducks

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en: M. Joyce, 50, is the chairperson of Kyosiga Women’s group in Kayunga, Uganda. She is married with 3 grown up children and cares for 8 grandchildren at home. She has a farming business, supplying fresh beans, potatoes, and cassava to schools.  Payments for her produce are usually made each week. She also sells ladies clothes, mostly underwear, to offices, hospitals, schools, and private homes as a side business. Over the years, she has been able to build a trusted customer base and in most cases she now just supplies her customers directly.   Joyce needs her portion of this group loan to buy more clothes for sale and seeds for cultivation.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario M. L., tiene 42 años, vive en   La Urb. Libertad, Distrito Trujillo,  provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Curso estudios de pedagogía, carrera que no culmino porque sus padres no la siguieron apoyando, a pesar de eso ejerció como profesora durante 11 años hasta que se caso. Tiene 03 hijos que dependen enteramente de ella.
Ella se dedica a la venta de animales menores, cuando se inicio tenia un gallo y una gallina, que al poco tiempo dieron muchas crías, negocio que ha decidido abandonar debido a que sus animales estaban muriendo, ahora esta empezando con la siembra de verduras en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Cielo II”, lo invirtió en la compra de  alimento balanceado para sus animales.
Con este crédito de 200 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos y hortalizas para sembrar sus verduras.
Rosario sueña con tener un minimarket en su domicilio y construir su casa.
Ella pertenece al vaso de leche de su sector.
texts.en:
Rosario M. L. is 42 and lives in La Libertad in the district of Trujillo, in the province of the same name, department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied to become a teacher but was unable to pursue this career as her parents did not support her in it. In spite of this, she worked as a teacher for 11 years until she married. She has three children who depend entirely on her. She sells small animals; when she started she had a rooster and a hen. With time, they gave her many chicks. She abandoned this enterprise because her animals kept dying. She is now starting to grow vegetables at home. With her first 300 soles loan which she received from her community bank, "Cielo II", she invested in balanced feed for her animals. With this 200 soles loan, which she will repay in four months, she will buy supplies and starter plants to start her vegetable garden. Rosario dreams of having a convenience store in her house and of building a home of her own. She belongs to her local "vaso de leche", a governmental programme to supply milk, milk substitutes, cereals and so on to low-income households.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and starter plants to start her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Mukhlis

texts.ru: Бозоров Мухлис проживает в высокогорном кишлаке Ворух. В прошлом он был заведующим большим магазином в своем кишлаке. Несколько лет назад этот магазин был разделен между несколькими предпринимателями и Мухлис арендовал небольшой участок данного магазина и начал заниматься собственным бизнесом. Ассортимент его товаров составляет как продукты питания, так и различные промышленные товары. Мухлис старается привозить только качественные товары и с минимальной наценкой. Это в свою очередь позволяет ему иметь постоянных клиентов. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает уже более года и показал себя с лучшей стороны. На новый займ собирается закупить продукты питания.
texts.en:
Mukhlis B. lives in the a mountainous village Voruh. In the past he used to be a manager of a large store in his village. A few years ago this store was divided among several businessmen and Mukhlis has rented out a small area of this store and started doing his business. Assortment of his goods includes food products and different kinds of household goods. Mukhlis tries to bring only high quality goods with a small mark up price. This allows him to have regular customers. He has been with MicroInvest for more than a year and has shown himself from a good side. He plans to use the new loan to buy foodstuffs.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Naimchon

texts.ru: Наимчон молодой парень и еще не женат. Он живет со своими родителями в небольшой деревне. После окончания школы он начал работать в колхозе. По выходным дням выходит на рынок и занимается там куплей продажей мелкого скота. Дома держит корову и бычков. За ними дома следит его мать (на фото). Молоко используют дома, излишки продают соседям. Наимчон пришел в МикроИнвест и подал заявку на займ. Собирается купить бычка.
texts.en:
Naimchon is a young man, not yet married. He lives with his parents in a small village. After leaving school, he started to work on a collective farm. On his days off, he goes to the market and works buying and selling cattle. At home, he keeps a cow and calves. They are cared for by his mother (in the photo). They use the milk at home and sell any surplus to neighbors. Naimchon has come to MicroInvest and applied for a loan. He is going to buy a calf.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace M. is 40 years old and married with six children aged 4 to 23, all school going. With her previous loan, Grace was able to buy more chickenfeed for her birds and, as a result, she was able to benefit when she sold healthy chickens at a high price. She has broiler chickens, some of which she has sold for Easter while others will be sold to her customers in Lugazi and Nkokonjeru.

Grace needs another loan for her layers, to help buy more feed for them while the repayments will be made as she sells her eggs weekly.

Grace is a member of Nkokonjeru group. She will be sharing this loan with other members of the group.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Sakaba Group

texts.en: Sakaba is the group leader of the Sakaba group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to progress her business. Sakaba wants to take a loan for her brother who has a car parts shop. Marvred wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. Karsheed wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store and wants to buy things needed for his shop. The are all very happy with this loan process.

loans.use: To buy car parts for her brother's shop

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra B. is a working mother. At 47, she manages to take care of the household chores and uses her cooking skill to bring income to help her husband provide their daily needs. Sandra is very much aware that with her 7 children, 6 of whom are in school, she needs to budget carefully to be able to cover educational expenses, household expenses, medication and savings. She wants to increase her profits therefore she needs additional capital of PHP 5,000 from the HSPFI micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase pork meat and other ingredients for her homemade longganisa

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Castulo Alfonso

texts.es: Castulo Alfonso, es casado de 56 años de edad, casado,  trabaja en el Super San Antonio desde hace 19 años con horario de 8 a 5 de la tarde todos los dias de la semana, ya que es socio del negocio que es familiar, cuenta con otros ingresos de servicio de taxi y por venta de leche. Esta solicitando su credito para la construccion de un porche de su casa de habitacion de 50 mts cuadrado, el costo total de la obra es mucho mayor que el credito solicitado, pero el asumira la diferencia.
texts.en:
Castulo Alfonso is married and is 56 years old. He has worked in the Super San Antonio for 19 years from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day of the week since he is a member of the family business. He gains other income from his taxi service and through selling milk. He is requesting his loan for the construction of a porch for his home that will be 50 meters square. The total cost of this work is much more than the loan he is requesting, but he will assume the difference.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a porch

loans.name: Kihara Mothers 1 Masika Elizabeth Group

texts.en: Mrs Elizabeth M. is 35 years old and married with five children, all of whom are in school. Elizabeth has been operating a clinic business for over eight years. She is using her loan to purchase clinical items, such as various drugs for the patients. She is an encouraging and hardworking lady whose future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase clinical items, such as drugs

loans.name: Karina Marilyn

texts.es:
La señora Karina Marilyn C. A. tiene 28 años de edad, viven en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 8 años de edad, quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
Karina se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y cerveza en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito compro cajas de cerveza y gaseosas.
Este crédito de 700 nuevos, lo invertirá en la compra de mas cajas de cerveza y gaseosas.
Karina sueña con tener una tienda en su domicilio con productos variados.
texts.en:
Karina Marilyn C. A. is 28 years old and lives in the district of Moche, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She has a fifth-grade education and is a mother of two children, ages 3 and 8, who depend on her. Karina makes a living selling soft drinks and beer out of her home. She used her first loan to purchase cases of the beverages. With the current loan of 700 PEN (approximately $250) she is requesting, she plans to invest in more cases of beer and soft drinks. Her dream is to run a general store out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more cases of beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes M. is married and has five dependents. She has received schooling through senior high school. Agnes sells fresh fish in Elmina, which she has done since 2004. Her husband is a tailor. Agnes uses her income to support her husband by paying school fees. Agnes will use the loan to purchase more fish for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to save and reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Koudjéga

texts.fr: Cet homme a appris le métier de maçon, mais il ne trouve pas souvent de chantier à construire pour subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de ses 02 enfants. Pour cette raison il s’est lancé  en 2008 dans son quartier Avépozo à Lomé dans l’élevage et la vente de porcs. Il est très connu et reçoit des clients venant même du Bénin, le pays voisin. Pour acheter de la nourriture à ses animaux, mais aussi acheter une moto pour ses déplacements vers sa clientèle, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES.
texts.en:
This man learned the trade of a mason, but he can't often find a construction site where he can earn enough to support his wife and two children. For this reason he began, in 2008, to raise and sell pigs in his district, Avépozo, in Lomé. He is well known and gets customers even from Benin, the neighboring country. To buy the feed for his animals, but also to buy a motorcycle for his trips to see his clientele, he is asking WAGES for a loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of pig feed and a motorcycle

loans.name: Leala

texts.en:
Leala L., a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Tulaele, is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Leala owns and operates a service-based business, providing general services to local community members. Leala has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 650 WST a month.

Leala (0) joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan from SPBD that was used to purchase equipment to improve her business, Leala is now requesting a new loan of 2500 WST which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Leala's fourth loan from SPBD. Leala plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba P. owns an accessories shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more earrings to sell.

Araba is 48 years old and is married to a carpenter. She has one child whom does not go to school. With the profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more earrings to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Mao Srun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of twelve people and they all live in Thnal Teaksen village in Kandal province. Mrs. Srey Mao S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a chicken breeder. In this poultry business, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to build the chicken cage. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Mrs. Srey Mao S. is 37 years old widow with two children, one of whom is a seller while another is attending the local school. 
Four members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To build the chicken cage.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar Armando G. A. reside en Zaragoza en el departamento de La Libertad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas de 10 y 6 años de edad. Oscar tiene años de experiencia  trabajando con hojalata la cual aprendió en empleos anteriores, pero ahora Oscar maneja su propio negocio con los conocimientos adquiridos y su experiencia, son ocho años al mando de su negocio el cual ha ido creciendo y ganando clientes poco a poco, en el taller de Oscar se elaboran todo tipo de utensilios elaborados en ese tipo de lamina, la demanda de sus productos ha ido creciendo notablemente en estos últimos meses razón por la cual solicita de un crédito para comprar materiales que necesita para la fabricación de un pedido.
texts.en:
Oscar Armando G. A. lives in Zaragoza in the department of La Libertad. He lives with his wife and two daughters, 10 and 6 years old respectively. Oscar has years of experience working with tin plate, which he learned from previous jobs. With his knowledge and experience Oscar now has 8 years running his own business which has been growing and gaining clients little by little. In his shop Oscar makes all kinds of products made with this material. The demand for his products has been growing in the last few months, so he applied for a loan in order to purchase the materials he will need to complete his orders.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material/metal

loans.name: Sirojiddin

texts.ru: Сироджиддин Бабаев проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 34 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Сироджиддин более 5 лет работает по своей специальности "учителем". Помимо этого он более 9 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для покупки скота и корма.
texts.en:
Sirojiddin Babev lives in Kurgan-Tube. He is 34 and married with three children. For over five years, Sirojiddin has been a teacher. In addition to this job, he has been raising livestock for over 9 years. He fattens and sells the livestock for a profit. Sirojiddin is requesting a loan to purchase animals and feed.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase feed and animals

loans.name: Ikisa

texts.en: Ikisa J. is currently in the business of selling beer and drinks like sodas, water, juice, etc. and is requesting a loan to purchase more crates of beer for sell. Ikisa is 50 years old and widowed. She has 3 children who no longer attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar and restaurant. BRAC About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more crates of beer for sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Hasan is 22 years old. In 2008, he decided to work as a teacher in order to earn enough money to live on, help his parents and pay his university fees. Hasan has applied for a loan to $500 to buy a laptop computer that will help him do his job and complete his studies.

loans.use: buy a laptop

loans.name: Bwavumpologoma Men And Women Group, Kayunga

texts.en:
N. Dumba is the leader of her group in Kayunga. She is a strong business lady with a business of selling produce. She buys the produce from the farmers in the villages, who have barely any means to transport their produce to the market. She also grows some of the produce herself, though what she has is never enough compared to what she needs for a single sale.

Whenever N. has a loan, even after having accumulated savings, she is able to buy in bulk, and at times buys a plantation from which she gets the food slowly, depending on her market, since the foods she deals in are all perishable.
