She has been able to buy herself a motorcycle, and she has cows and goats at home. Dumba needs a loan to help buy more produce for resale.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Miss Yan C., 29, is single and lives with her parents and brother in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Yan has been a silk weaver for five years – a skill she learned from her aunt. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Yan is applying for her first loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Tedy Benedicta

texts.es:
La señora Tedy es integrante  del Banco Comunal Creciendo para el Futuro desde hace dos ciclo,  este banco se reúne en la ciudad de Portoviejo en la costa ecuatoriana, ella posee una tienda desde hace un año en la cual expende productos de primera necesidad, agua, gas,  entre otros, su negocio  está ubicado en su domicilio en el Parque Forestal a las afueras de Portoviejo compartiendo con su esposo su único compañero ya que sus  hijos son  casados y viven independientes

A sus 54 años nuestra socia está muy motivada por seguir en su negocio y con este nuevo préstamo podrá incrementar en su tienda con arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal y más víveres en general para dar un mejor servicio a su exigente clientela.
texts.en:
Tedy has been a member of the Creciendo para el Futuro communal bank for two loan cycles. This bank meets in the city of Portoviejo on the Ecuadorean coast. She has had a grocery store for the last year that stocks basic needs items, water, gas, etc. Her store is located in her home, which is Parque Forestal in Portoviejo's outskirts. Her only company is her husband because their children are all married and living independently. At the age of 54, Tedy is still very motivated to continue with her work and she will use this new funding to increase her stock with rice, sugar, cooking oil, salt, and other supplies in general to offer better service to her demanding customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, salt, etc.

loans.name: Amale

texts.en: Amale is a 47-year-old single woman living with her mother. She is the only one who takes care of her mother. She has been working as a farmer for the past 15 years. She learned this occupation from her father because her region specializes in this occupation. She cultivates all types of vegetables and she distributes her products to the market to be sold. Today, Amale is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase agriculturA. supplies such as seed, fertilizers and some tools to be prepared for the summer cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture supplies

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en: R. Bakhtiyor is 36 years old. Together with his wife, they have 3 children. Bakhtiyor is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 8 years. He bakes the national bread “lepeshka” at home. His wife helps him with his business. Having many customers, Bakhtiyor is selling the majority of his products just from his home. However, he is also running a trading place in the central local market for selling the ”lepeshka”. Now Bakhtiyor requests 4,000 Somoni. He is planning to purchase flour at wholesale as required for his business. Bakhtiyor is grateful to all for supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Este Señor se llama Carlos Olivas, tiene 54 años de edad, trabaja para una compañía donde se fabrican Rones, empresa en la cual tiene 26 años de laborar, él se desempeña como Blendificador, su núcleo familiar es de cuatro personas, incluyéndose él, sus hijos ya están cursando la escuela de secundaria. 

La esposa de don Carlos trabaja en su casa en un pequeño negocio que ellos decidieron establecer (Pulpería), en este sentido ella le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.  

En la mayoría de los créditos que se le han otorgado a este cliente han sido para el mejoramiento de vivienda. 

Es válido mencionar que este cliente ha sido responsable  con los créditos que le hemos otorgados.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos Olivas, 54, works for a company that makes rum, work that he's done for 26 years now. He is a Blender at the company. He is the head of a family of four. His children are in high school. His wife operates a small business--a corner shop--at home that the couple set up jointly and her earnings contribute to the family's income. Most of the loans that have been extended to Carlos have been used for housing repairs and improvements. It's important to mention that this client has been responsible with the loans that he's received.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for home construction.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta L. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old, widowed and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as bags and ready-to-wear items in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Julieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Judid

texts.es:
LA SRA. JUDID ESTA CASADA Y RADICA  EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO DISTANTE A 40 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, SU ACTIVIDAD ES LA VENTA DE PUERTAS Y MARCO DE CASA, SU ESPOSO TIENE COMO PROFESION CARPINTERO, EL REALIZA ELTRABAJO Y ELLA LOS COMERCIALIZA, NO TIENEN DOMICILIO PROPIO, POR LO TANTO TRABAJAN AMBOS PARA JUNTAR UN CAPITAL INICIAL PARA COMPARAR SU PROPIA CASA, TIENEN 3 HIJO LOS CUALES  ESTAN ESTUDIANDO PARA SACAR UNA PROFESION, POR LO QUE SE LE HACE DIFICIL EL DE JUNTAR EL DINERO, POR TAL MOTIVO TUVIERON QUE SOLICITAR FINANCIMIENTO PARA AUMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO, Y ASI CRECER ECONOMICAMENTE.

LA SRA. JUDID ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Ms. Judid is married and lives in the El Torno district, located about 40 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. She sells doors and door frames. Her husband is a carpenter. He makes the doors and frames and she sells them. They do not have their own home and for that reason, they both work in order to save for an initial capital to buy their own house. They have three children, all of whom are studying, which makes it difficult for them to save their money. As such, they had to seek a loan in order to increase their work capital y as a result, grow economically. Ms. Judid is a responsible and hard working person. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting her with credit.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn T., 42 years old, is a corn and rice farmer. She started farming in 1993.

Jocelyn has two children and her eldest child is 16 years old. Her income goes directly to her children. She labors so hard so that she will be able to buy food, clothing and other basic needs for her family.

Jocelyn is requesting a loan of Php 6,000. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies so that she will have a better harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Volodymir

texts.en:
Volodymir is married with a son and a daughter. He runs a small construction services business in his home town of Stryi. Volodymir offers high quality services quickly. Presently, construction is growing in Ukraine and this means high demand for the type of services Volodymir is offering. He has been working in this field for 12 years and he has gained a great deal of experience. 

Volodymir is seeking a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to increase his turnover capital and purchase additional construction supplies. He can be characterized as a determined and enterprising businessman who is always ready to invest maximum effort and energy into this venture. Volodymir is highly respected in his town as an entrepreneur of integrity. We believe he will repay the current loan without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To increase his turnover capital.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
As a mother, Iluminada’s biggest dreams are always for her children and family. She wants to provide her children with a decent life. In 2000, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She hoped to have access to capital for the maintenance of her businesses. Her previous loans from ASHI were carefully utilized as additional rolling working capital for her tricycle (three-wheeled-vehicle) transport business and for operating a passenger jeepney (a small bus). The businesses are a big help for the family in covering their expenses and allow them to set aside savings for the future. She is requesting a loan of PhP 45,000 to pay for a renewal of city plates (LTO-Land Transportation Office-registration) and purchase spare parts for the maintenance of their tricycle and jeepney. 

Iluminada hopes that her business will become successful someday. Along with the business success she is dreaming about, is the hope to see the graduation of her four children from college and to see them find a good job. She also dreams of having a store selling poultry feed someday to save for her family’s future. Iluminada wants to thank ASHI and Kiva lenders who are sponsoring this loan. That is one of the greatest opportunities for her to start reaching for her goals.

Iluminada C. comes from Antipolo, Rizal province, in the Philippines. She is a 43-year-old woman, married, and is the mother of four children. For her age, Iluminada is seen as strong and determined to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To pay for a renewal of city plate registration and purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycle & jeepney

loans.name: Minife

texts.en:
Minife M. is a 46-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating an oyster farming business. She lives in the Kanggapas zone of barangay Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her oyster farming business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,500. 

Minife is now borrowing PHP 14,000 so that she can buy materials that she needs to sustain her oyster farm such as oyster shells, bamboo and straps. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom.  Minife aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda es separada, vive con sus hijos en casa propia la zona Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Yolanda tiene un restaurante en la misma casa, a la vez hace trabajos de costura (es costurera); es así como obtiene sus ingresos que  mantienen su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de extractor de humo para la cocina de restaurante  como primera fase mejorando así las condiciones de este.
Esta es la séptima  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a single mother, who lives with her children in her house in Villa Copacabana in La Paz. Yolanda runs a restaurant from her home, and she also works as a seamstress. These jobs allow her to make the income necessary to maintain her household. The requested loan is for the construction of an exhaust fan in her kitchen restaurant. It is the first phase of her kitchen improvements. This is the seventh time Yolanda has asked for a loan. The socioeconomic analysis done graded Yolanda favorably, which allows her to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of exhaust fan for kitchen

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo en casa de su madre. Hace más de 6 años tiene una tienda, que se encuentra instalada en su casa, donde atiende todos los días, además su madre y su hermana la ayudan en el negocio. Además de vender productos de primera necesidad vende también remedios, objetos para regalo, golosinas  y útiles de escritorio, de esa manera amplia su mercado y complace además con la necesidad del cliente, sin necesidad de ir a la ciudad de conseguir alguno de éstos productos que ofrece. Durante este  tiempo ha visto la ventaja de tener un negocio propio porque tiene mayor afluencia de clientes y eso es la clave de su éxito, adicionalmente la buena atención que da a sus clientes también ayuda a mantener sus clientes. Por tal motivo desea abastecerse de mercadería, así como ampliar su tienda  para atraer a más clientela. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, utilizará en la compra de productos, golosinas y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Carmen is 35 years old and lives with her husband in her mother's home. She has been running a store from her home for more than 6 years. Her mother and sister also help her with the store. In addition to selling basic necessity items, she also sells medicine, gift items, candy and stationary. This has helped to broaden her market and meet her customers needs without having to go to the city to obtain any of the products that she offers. The experience of having her own business has made her realize its advantages because she has an abundance of customers and this is the key to success. Also, the good service that she gives her customers helps to maintain her clientele. For this reason she want to stock more merchandise in her store in order to attract more customers. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support as a result of always being very responsible with her payments. She is grateful to be a part of her communal bank because all the members are very responsible and there is solidarity among them. She is also grateful to the people who will make this loan possible as it will be very useful to the growth of her business. She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy candy, soda and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
M.   Flavia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Flavia has a business in raising poultry, which she has done for 8 years.         

To help expand her business, Flavia has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more chickens.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Flavia hopes to generate greater profits and have a good life.  In the future, Flavia hopes to own a house.   

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to raise

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion C. has successfully repaid her first Kiva loan! With the loan she financed and sustained her handicraft business, which has been in increasing demand. She is so thankful for your support and the opportunity to borrow money from Kiva. She is very happy that, with the loan, she has been able to provide satisfactory services without delay to her regular customers. She now wishes to access a larger loan to expand her handicraft business and earn more profits. Encarnacion thanks Kiva for providing her with the opportunity to increase her income. Your support is important to her family and they are very grateful.

Encarnacion joined Kiva partner ASHI to follow her dream of providing her family with a decent life. Prior to joining ASHI, Encarnacion had no access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams, but she got her first loan from ASHI and started her own business weaving sleeping mats using panan (a kind of palm) leaf. As she continued to get loans from ASHI and save some of her profits, she was able to grow her business. Now she makes other kinds of handicrafts, such as native bags from abaka (banana leaf) fiber, hats, placemats made from twigs, and other home decorations. Many souvenir shop owners visit Encarnacion's village to purchase her products. Other customers are tourists and Overseas Filipino Workers (OFW) wanting to buy presents for their colleagues abroad. Encarnacion has noticed that her monthly income has almost doubled since receiving her first loan, because she has attracted new customers with her additional inventory. 

Now she is seeking another Kiva loan of 28,000 PHP to maintain her business and purchase more of the raw materials needed for her handicrafts. With the support of ASHI and her Kiva partners, she is hopeful that her business will generate a steady income and improve her financial stability and the quliaty of life for her family, who currently live in poverty.

loans.use: to maintain her business and purchase more of the raw materials needed for her handicrafts

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic O., 43, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Flaviano O., a painter/maintenance man, and is the mother of three children. One of her children is already working while one is currently enrolled in college and the other is still in high school. By the grace of God, Marivic has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to send her youngest to college. This is the dream of most Filipino parents like Marivic, who herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.
Marivic is currently concentrating on her buying and selling business. She buys general merchandise from wholesalers and sells it piecemeal to make a little profit. Her products range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing, food supplements and other products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue to operate her business, Marivic is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP. She will be using the loan to expand her product inventory by purchasing more products and a greater variety. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Marivic dreams of being able to give her all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To expand her product inventory

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
Enhbayar D. is 24 years old and lives with his wife and one-year-old son in their own house in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife is currently unemployed and is taking care of their son. Enhbayar has been operating a wheel and tire repair center since 2007 and has found success with his business. With his earnings, he was able to build a car repair center in his yard in 2008. He has built a successful operation within a short period. 

In 2009, he also started a taxi service after purchasing a new car from his earnings. Since starting his business, not only has his business expanded but also his financial situation has improved. Today he has his own car, house, and garage. Enhbayar is a very modest man who says "All I want is to have my own repair service center." He is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase lubricant oils for machinery.

loans.use: To purchase lubricant oils for machinery

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina M. is married and smokes fish as well as frying them for sale at Abura. Amina serves her fish with 'Fante kenkey'. She has been educated up to the junior high level. Amina’s husband is a farmer. She will use the loan to buy more 'kenkey' and fry more fish for sale. She hopes to reinvest her profit back into her business.

loans.use: buy more 'kenkey' (fermented maize dough) and fry fish for sale

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
El jóven Armando tiene 22 años de edad es soltero y vive con su madre en la ciudad de Carapegua. 
    	Como proviene de una familia humilde y con ganas de salir adelante empezó a trabajar como empleado en una distribuidora de bebidas luego de 4 años de ahorrar  decidió emprender un pequeño negocio, que es un lavadero de vehículo a lado  de su casa, hoy en día  ya tiene una buena clientela formada.
 Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo ahora está ampliando su lavadero  y así mantener la buena clientela.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de equipos (aspiradora y otros que le hace  Falta).
texts.en:
Armando is a single, 22 year old young man.  He lives with his mother in the city of Carapegua.  As he comes from a humble family, and he has the desire to get ahead, he started working for a drink distributor.  

After four years of saving he decided to undertake a small business, a carwash on the side of his house.  He now has a good customer base.  Thanks to his work and effort he is now expanding his carwash.  That way he keeps good customers.

He is requesting the loan to buy equipment (vacuum cleaner and other equipment that he needs).

loans.use: Buy equipment for his carwash

loans.name: Marcelina Antonio

texts.pt:
Marcelina Antônio S. nasceu no Distrito de Massinga, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique casada e mãe de 2 filhos de 9 e 12 anos de idade, todos vão a Escola. Fez somente 3ª classe não continuou devido a guerra de desestabilização que assolou o pais durante 16 anos. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seus pais enviando algum valor monetário para as despesas de casa.

Saiu de Massinga para Maputo a procura de emprego e veio sozinha. Tem um negócio próprio de venda de vários produtos de consumo ha mais de 13 anos. Não tem empregados e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos e decidiu não continuar, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amiga que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produto (bolachas, doces, arroz, farinha, óleo, caldo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock.

O seu maior sonho é terminar a construção da sua casa. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro crédito para poder realizar seu sonho.
texts.en:
Marcelina Antônio S. was born in Massinga District, Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique.  She is married and has two children aged 9 and 12.  Both of them go to school.  Marcelina only completed third grade; she did not continue in school because of the civil war that ravaged the country for 16 years.  She lives in her own house with her family and supports her parents by sending them some money for household expenses.

Marcelina left Massinga to move to Maputo alone in search of a job.  For more than 13 years she has had her own business selling various consumer products.  She has no employees and earns around 4,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses.  Marcelina also manages to save some money in her bank account.

She has had loans from other banks and decided not to continue with them.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku.  Marcelina is asking for 12,000 meticais to buy products (crackers, sweets, rice, flour, oil, broth, etc.) to increase her inventory.

Her greatest dream is to finish building her house.  She is confident that she will pay ahead of time and ask for another loan so she can make her dream come true.

loans.use: Buy products (crackers, sweets, rice, flour, oil, broth and other items)

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Lhagvasuren M. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Uvs province, Mongolia. His older three children, ages 19, 21 and 22, all are university students and his younger two children attend a local high school. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Lhagvasuren operates a coal-selling business in his town with the help of his wife. He purchases coal directly from local mines and uses his large Russian truck to transport back to his town. His wife helps him sell the coal to various local businesses and individuals for use in heating. He has operated this business since 1994 and has gained much experience over the years. He has a large customer base with many loyal clients and hopes to purchase a larger truck in the future to keep up with growing demand. He sells five to six trucks of coal and earns around 400,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). He says, "I work hard to provide a good education for my all children." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase three trucks of coal and one truck of firewood to sell.

loans.use: To purchase three trucks of coal

loans.name: Jenri

texts.es: Jenri tiene 29 años, vive en casa de sus padres. Desde que era adolescente aprendió a conducir y hace más de 3 años empezó a trabajar en el transporte público, desde entonces maneja diariamente el vehículo de su padre, sin embargo su trabajo es dependiente ya que pertenece a una línea de transporte que recorrido lo cubre desde  su localidad hasta la zona urbana de la ciudad donde radica. Por tanto las ganancias que recibe le satisface y lo motiva a continuar trabajando. Es el crédito número 2 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en el pago del mantenimiento mecánico para su carro.
texts.en: Jenri, 29, lives with his parents. He learned to drive as a teenager and for the last 3 years he has worked in public transport, driving his father's vehicle every day. His work varies because he works for a transport company that covers routes from his town to the urban area around the city. He is satisfied with the money he makes and motivated to continue working. This is his second loan with MFP and he's very happy to know he has financial backing. He also enjoys being part of his loan group because all members are very responsible and supportive. He would like to thank those contributing to the loan he is requesting, which will be very useful in the development of his business. He will invest the loan in the payment of the mechanic maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.use: Pay for the mechanic maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres de nombre Santa Maria se conformó en la fecha 10 de julio del 2008 con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ya en el 9° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
 Ademas del trabajo independiente de cada una, también fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo,a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar economicamente  a sus familiares en especial. 
 Una historia muy conmovedora la de la Sra Angela C.   ella es una señora que esta en silla de ruega y  se dedica a hacer croche cuando comenzo con la Fundación ella no tenia silla de rueda y no podia salir por la incapacidad que tenia y gracias al   Credito y a sus compañeras de comite pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y su administracion.
Ella  nos comenta que mediante este credito pudo mejorar la economia de la familia  actualmente poseen ademas del ingreso de su trabajo un ingreso como humorista en la radio.
Actualmente solicita el préstamo para la compra de golosinas y minicarga ya que ademas de su croche quiere hacer otras actividades.
 Según la Sra Angela C. menciono que las actividades que realizan con la Fundacion Paraguaya es muy importante ya que pudimos desarrollar nuestras capacidades de trabajo, ademas de levantar nuestra autoestima como madres trabajoras.
texts.en:
The Santa Maria Women's Committee was set up on July 10th, 2008.  With a lot of hard work and care, they are now in their 9th loan cycle, working supportively together within the program.  As well as working independently, the group's members also work to make funds so that the group itself has some capital and they help each other to achieve their goals, their main goal being to work to support their families.

Angela C.'s is a very moving story.  She is a lady who is in a wheelchair and whose business is crocheting.  When she started working with Fundación Paraguaya she didn't have a wheelchair and she couldn't leave her house because of her disability.  Thanks to her loan and her fellow committee members she was able to greatly improve her business and her running of it.

Angela tells us that thanks to her loan she was able to improve her family's finances.  They currently have not only the income from her work but also an income made as a comedian on the radio.

Angela is requesting this loan to buy candy and cell phone credits because she would like to carry out other business activities as well as her crocheting.  Angela says that the activities that the women do with Fundación Paraguaya are very important since they have helped them to develop their working capacity and also lifted their self-esteem as working mothers.

loans.use: To buy candy and cell phone credits

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap C., 27 years old, and her husband, Mr. Viseth An, 31 years old, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2002 and have two children - one son and one daughter. The daughter is in school and the son is still young. 

Sopheap and Viseth are farmers. They also operate a weaving business when they are not farming. Sopheap is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, departamento D. Morazán, donD. vive con su esposo y tres hijos, se dedica a vender tamales, pescado, panes con pollo y sopa D. mondongo, tiene 35 años edad, ella venD. diversos productos saliendo a ofrecerlos casa por casa del lugar cercano a donD. vive, su estrategia es ofrecer cada día un producto distinto para que los clientes siempre le compren.
Ella desea invertir un préstamo en compra D. materiales para preparar los diferentes alimentos que venD., ya que constantemente debe comprar verduras, carnes, condimentos, maíz entre otros, ya que por su diversificación D. venta, también así es la diversificación D. materiales que necesita.
Su sueño es ver a sus hijos estudiar que tengan una opción D. mejorar sus condiciones D. vida en un futuro, para conseguir este sueño ella se esfuerza día con día trabajando y viendo la manera D. no perder los ánimos hasta lograr dicho sueño.
texts.en:
Rosa resides in San Francisco Gotero, Department of Morazán, with her husband and three children. She sells tamales, fish, bread with chicken, and tripe soup. Rosa is 35 years old and sells her various products at a place near her home. Her strategy is to offer a different product each day so that her customers will always buy them.

Rosa wants to invest this loan in the purchase of supplies needed to prepare the different dishes she sells. She constantly buys vegetables, meat, condiments, corn, and other ingredients. The supplies she needs are also diversified. Her dream is to see her children study so that they will have the option to improve their future living conditions. To continue with her dream, Rosa strives to work each day and not lose her motivation to make it come true.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, meat, condiments, corn, and other ingredients

loans.name: Aniccia Francisca

texts.es: Aniccia Francisca tiene 22 años. Ella es una joven con un gran espíritu emprendedor. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio. Ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y cada día lucha por salir adelante. Aniccia tuvo ciertos problemas porque no tenía  la experiencia necesaria para ofrecerle a sus clientes sus productos pero esto lo ha conseG. con el tiempo y así obtuvo mucho más clientes. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de calzado, ropa, perfumes entre otras cosas. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que el día de mañana sus hijos tengan un donde vivir.
texts.en: Aniccia Francisca is 22 years old. She is a young woman with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. She engages in running a general store. She has been engaging in this humble activity for more than 4 years. She is responsible for her 2 children and she fights every day to make ends meet. Anniccia has encountered some problems because she lacked the necessary experience to offer her products to her customers, but she has improved in time and has thus been able to gain more customers. The loan she is requesting will increase her working capital and will be used to buy shoes, clothes and perfumes among other things. Her wish is to make improvements to her house so that her children will have a place to live in the future.

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana C. is from the village of Sta. Filomena. She is 59 years old, married, and has nine adult-aged children.

Bibiana owns and operates a business raising pigs in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Bibiana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials for the renovation of her pig fence.

Bibiana is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets and feed. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Dehiya

texts.en: A. is currently in a business of selling wax, saddles and body lotions. She is 34 years old, married to a mechanic, has two children and all of them go to school. A. borrowed a loan to stock more wax, saddles and body lotions. In the future, she hopes to open a big shop with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more wax, saddles and body lotions.

loans.name: Silvio Miguel

texts.es:
El  Sr. Silvio Miguel S. L. es de la ciudad de San Estanislao (Santaní), del Barrio Republicano, tiene 33 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Felicia Dominguez de 20 años de edad, actualmente tienen 2 hijos, todos menores de  edad.
Se dedica en la producción y venta de productos lácteos (leche y queso), posee clientela bien formada, por ello tiene buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, es un señor muy trabajador, excelente cliente de la Fundación Paraguaya.
El cliente está queriendo comprar más vacas lecheras para mejor producción y venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Silvio Miguel S. L. is from the city of San Estanislao (nicknamed Santaní) and lives in the Republicano neighborhood. He is 33 years old and is married to Felicia Dominguez, who is 20 years old. They currently have two young children.

He works making and selling dairy products (milk and cheese) and he has a well-established clientele, which is why he earns a good income. He has good business and personal references and he is a hardworking man and an excellent client at Fundación Paraguaya.

He wants to purchase more dairy cows to improve his production and sales.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime nació en la ciudad de Cusco y tiene 23 años de edad. Actualmente, Jaime vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), él es una persona responsable que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es la dedicarse como albañil. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a  brindar servicio y le va excelente. Jaime tiene un pequeño familiar con su esposa Beatriz que consiste en llevar carne de  veces en cuando a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado. Jaime en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más carne. 

Jaime es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Jaime was born in Cusco and is 23 years old.  Currently Jaime lives in the Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Perú).  He is a responsible person who moves his family ahead.  His main economic activity is being a Bricklayer.  He’s worked at this job for four years and he does excellently well.

Jaime and his wife, Beatriz, have a small family business consisting in taking meat occasionally to the city of Puerto Maldonado.  On this occasion, Jaime needs a loan to buy more meat.

Jaime is a responsible person and a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Sumac Purisisun” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy more meat.

loans.name: Attiyeh

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has three children.

In 2005, Attiyeh opened his own shop to sell mobile phones and phone accessories. He has five years of experience in this field and he has a good reputation, He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to renovate his shop and enlarge it. He is aiming to expand his business so he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and enlarge it.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson wants a loan to buy beer and soda for his wholesale shop. The 32-year-old hails from the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda where he lives with six people in his three-roomed house. He got his start-up capital from his late father 10 years ago and his dream is to see his business grow into a soda and beer depot in the future. However, he faces the problem of high rent costs and desires to build his own commercial house. Wilson needs the loan to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: To buy beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Alcides de 38 años es el propietario del negocio “Tienda la económica al sur occidente de Barranquilla”. Nacido en el departamento de Santander, llegó hace 11 años a la ciudad y se dedicó al tradicional negocio de tienda, que tiene como objetivo satisfacer las demandas de las amas de casa, en lo relacionado con productos de la canasta familiar, ofrecidas en un sitio cercano a su vivienda.
Alcides en su negocio vende víveres, ranchos, licores, abarrotes, lácteos, carnes, dulces, refrescos y bebidas, que compra a diario, semanal o  mensualmente,  de acuerdo a como rote cada producto. Sus ventas son principalmente de contado y su negocio ocupa casi toda la vivienda, donde se encuentra en calidad de arrendatario. Su sueño y desafió es tener un carro propio que le facilite el transporte de la mercancía que compra. Así mismo su capital de trabajo es más pequeño que lo que requiere su mercado,  por eso está interesado en hacerlo crecer, se postula al primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará arroz, azúcar, granos, harinas, refrescos y lácteos en mayor volumen para ganar descuentos y mientras construye su sueño continua fortaleciendo su rentabilidad sobre las ventas para sostenerla en no menos de un 21%.
texts.en:
Alcides, 38, owns a business called “Tienda La Económica” in southwest Barranquilla.  He was born in Santander Department and arrived in the city 11 years ago and went into the traditional business of running a general store whose goal is to meet the needs of housewives related to the basic family grocery basket in a site near their homes.

In his store, Alcides sells foodstuffs, snacks, liquor, groceries, dairy products, meats, candy, soft drinks and beverages that he buys daily, weekly or monthly according to each product’s turnover rate.  His sales are primarily cash and his business takes up almost the entire dwelling which he rents.  His dream and challenge is to have a car of his own that will make transporting the goods he buys easier.  In addition, his working capital is a bit smaller than what his market requires so he’s interested in making it grow.

He is applying for his first Kiva/Fundación Mario Santo Domingo loan that he will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, flours, soft drinks and dairy products in larger volumes to receive discounts and while he builds his dream will continue strengthening his profit margin on sales to maintain it at no less than 21%.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, tiene la edad de 46 años, está casado y vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo que son sus mayores prioridades. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para la asistencia del su maíz y el frijol. El cuenta con el terreno ya sembrado de ambos cultivos y lo que quiere es poder asistirlo para así poder obtener mejores cosechas de los cultivos, aparte el terreno es apto para la buena explotación de estos cultivos. Quiere generar las ganancias para ir creciendo con el proyecto y así poderles dar a sus hijos un bienestar familiar de mejores condiciones en el futuro. También estas ganancias generar la tendrá para poderle seguir dando el estudio universitario a su hija mayor para que sea todo una profesional en su vida. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 46 years old and married.  He lives with his three children and his wife, and they are his greatest priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy supplies to help with his corn and beans.

He has land already planted with both crops.  He wants to be able to care for them in order to be able to get a better harvest from the crops.  The land is suitable for these crops.  He wants to generate income in order to keep growing with his plan.  That way he will be able to give his children better conditions in the future and familial well-being.

Also, with the income that is generated he will be able to continue giving his oldest daughter a university education.  This is so that she will be a complete professional in her live.

This is his first loan with FUDESCOSUR.  He has not had other loan with state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to care for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Socheata

texts.en:
Socheata sells fruit, while her husband is a chef. The couple has been married since 1997 and has two children: one son and one daughter. They live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Socheata’s husband hopes to supplement their income with a new business: driving a tuk tuk motorcycle taxi.  

Socheata is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a tuk tuk for her husband.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk tuk for her husband.

loans.name: Flordemie

texts.en:
Flordemie is married and has 2 children. She is 27 years old and lives in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Flordemie sells a variety of products to earn a living.  She has had her business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 6000 from this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14900 to purchase more products for her general store.  Flordemie has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: buy products for her store

loans.name: Martha Juvita

texts.es:
Martha Juvita es casada, tiene 3 hijos, el mayor esta fuera del pais y los 2 menores habitan con ella en su pequeña casa obtenida donde gracias a un proyecto habitacional; trabaja como fotografa junto a su familia. 

Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de  mejorar su casa, para construir un anexo para que su hijo tenga mas privacidad. 

Sueña en el futuro con poder seguir mejorando su casa y asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Martha Juvita is married and has three children.  Her eldest son is abroad and her two youngest live with her in her small home which she obtained through a housing project.  She works as a photographer.

Martha Juvita is requesting her second loan to improve her home.  She will build an extra room so that her son can have more privacy.  She dreams that she will be able to continue improving her home in the future and thereby provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Emmily

texts.en:
Emmily is married and has two children, age 9 and 5 years. 

She has been in farming for 10 years and is also employed as a teacher in Kitale, Western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, beans and bananas, which she sells to the local market.

Emmily has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the business will help her educate and feed her children. She hopes to establish a dairy breeding farm.

Emilly says treatment of animals is very costly to farmers. She remains hopeful the loan will be of help.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.es: La joven Bibiana tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, se dedica a vender juguetes para niños, por ejemplo pistolas de agua, celulares con dulces, espirales y tambien sabe hacer algodones de azucar y los sale a vender en las plazas de los municipios mas cercanos junto con los juguetes, tiene en su negocio poco tiempo lleva año y medio, lo empezo desde que dejo de estudiar en parte por falta de recursos y la otra parte por ella para que mejor empezara a trabajar, nos menciona que es un negocio en los que se vende por temporada ya que no siempre los niños les compran juguetes y algodones, quiere invertir su prestamo en hacer algodones y comprar mercancia de juguetes ya que este mes es precisamente un buen tiempo para vender, porque los niños estan de vacaciones y hay mucha gente paseando por el centro, y quiere dividirse junto con su hermano para que el se vaya a una plaza diferente y ella a otra plaza, una de las dificultades que tiene es que en su negocio no es un sueldo seguro y eso le desanima mucho ya que no sabe cuanto va a ganar a la semana, puede ser poco o no puede ser nada, es dependiendo y a ella le gustaria tener su negocio pero tambien trabajar, buscar un trabajo para poder salir adelante y de esa manera tener un sueldo seguro y empezar a comprar sus cosas, Bibiana vive en la comunidad de Barrio las peñas, que pertenece al municipio de el Oro,y como esta muy lejos del centro del municipio es otro obstaculo mas por el que pasa para poder salir a vender, si hay transporte pero son pocos y apesar de las circustancias la joven Bibiana sale a vender.
texts.en:
Young Bibiana is 23 years old, single and has no children.  She sells children’s toys like water pistols, candy filled cell phones and pinwheels.  She also knows how to make cotton candy and she goes out to sell it together with the toys to various squares in the nearest towns.  She’s been in business a short time; she’s been in business for a year and a half.  She started it when she left school partly due to lack of resources and partly because she wanted to start working.  She mentions that it’s a business with seasonal sales because children don’t always want to buy toys and cotton candy.

She wants to invest in a loan to make cotton candy and to buy toy merchandise because this month is precisely a good one for sales because the children are on vacation and there are lots of people passing through downtown and she wants to split up with her brother so that each of them can take a different square to sell in.

One of the difficulties she has is that her business doesn’t produce a secure income and that discourages her quite a bit because she never knows just how much she’s going to earn each week; it can be a little or it can be nothing.  It depends and she’d like to have her business but also to have a job, to look for a job to get ahead and have dependable salary to start buying things for herself.

Bibiana lives in the Las Peñas neighborhood that belongs to the town of El Oro and because it’s far from the center of town, that’s another obstacle she has to overcome to go out and sell.  There is transport available but it’s not abundant.  Despite circumstances, Bibiana goes out to sell anyway.

loans.use: to buy children's toys and bags to sell cotton cancy.

loans.name: Enagnon 10 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNON 10 est composé de trois personnes qui se connaissent et qui appartiennent au même groupe d’artisans. Le représentant du groupe, du nom Moligui Roger est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Moligui Roger est âgé de 49 ans et vit au Bénin. Moligui Roger est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Pauline. Le couple a sept enfants à charge dont six sont les leurs. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Moligui Roger n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Moligui Roger a appris le métier de mécanique. A côté de cette activité, Moligui Roger vend depuis vingt huit ans environs, des lubrifiants. Moligui Roger s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Moligui Roger sollicite un crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ENAGNON 10.
texts.en:
The ENAGNON 10 group is composed of three persons who know each other and who belong to the same group of tradesmen. The representative of the group, Moligui Roger, is the one who is raising his hand in the photo.  

Moligui Roger is 49 and lives in Bénin. He is married to a small-scale retailer named Pauline. The couple are raising seven children, of whom six are their biological children. Some of the children are enrolled in school. 

Moligui Roger never went to school. To support himself and his children, he learned the mechanic's trade. Along with this business, he has been selling lubricants for about 28 years. He buys his stock in a market in  Bénin. 

Wishing to satisfy the needs of his clientele and in order to grow his turnover and his income, Moligui Roger is requesting a loan, together with the other members of the group called ENAGNON 10.

loans.use: to buy lubricants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is 36 years old, married and has four children. He is from Iraq. 

Since 1989, Moussa has been the owner of a store for rental woodcutting machines and for making and selling wood (lumber) for building. He has more than twenty years of experience in this field and is well-known in his area with a good reputation. 

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to add more wood inventories. He is aiming to make higher profits to buy a new car and to get the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to add more wood inventories.

loans.name: Jelina

texts.en:
Jelina is 40 years old and lives in Embargo, Ozamiz City. She is married with one child. 

To earn a living, Jelina has a business selling foods such as rice cake, cassava cake, etc. She earns about PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work.  Jelina has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase piglets for hog fattening.

Jelina has been a member of PMPC for 6 months.  In the future, Jelina would like to be successful in her chosen business..

loans.use: to purchase piglets

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en: Elvina is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. Elvina has operated a retail shop for the past 5 years, selling rice and dried fish per kilogram. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy sacks of rice and dried fish to sell. Elvina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Chonibek

texts.ru: Чонибек проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 31 год. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Он уже четыре года предоставляет услугу. Развозит людей по маршруту Вахдат-Оби шурак. Целью получения кредита является приобретение запасных частей для автомашины.
texts.en: Chonibek lives in the Vahdat district.  He is 31 years old, married and has two children.  He has been providing a service for four years.  Chonibek transports people along the Vahdat-Obi route.  The goal of this loan is to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith se dedica  a la elaboración de prendas de vestir, ella tiene una macroempresa, porque aprovechó los cursos de modistería, compró su máquina y se arriesgó en su aventura emprendedora,  con la cual genera ingresos y en la que le ha ido muy bien. Sus líneas de trabajo son vestidos informales, prendas interiores y ropa en general para damas juvenil e infantil. La calidad de sus productos es consecuencia de sus estudios técnicos, el perfeccionamiento adquirido a través de su experiencia y su capacidad de riesgo con la que ha logrado bienestar. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y generar empleos que proporciones bienestar a la comunidad. Mientras trabaja esforzadamente maneja una rentabilidad promedia no menor de 39,8% desde la cual proyecta su crecimiento. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas, insumos para lograr aumentar su producción y ofrecer nuevos diseños de fin de año, fiestas en las cuales todos quieren estar elegantes.
texts.en: Judith makes clothes. She has a large firm as she took courses in dressmaking, bought a machine and took a chance with an entrepreneurial venture, with which she generates income and is doing very well. Her clothing lines are informal dresses, underwear and clothes in general for young women and infants. The quality of her products is a consequence of her technical studies, improvement gained through experience and her capacity to take risks with which she has achieved well-being. Her dream is to grow her business and generate jobs that will provide the community with a sense of well-being. While working hard, she manages an average return no less than 39.8% from which she projects growth. Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first funding with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy raw materials and consumables so as to increase production and offer new designs for the year-end parties at which everyone wants to be stylish.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and consumables.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 25 years old and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He currently runs a drug shop. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to open another drug shop.

Ben faces challenges such as price fluctuation, inadequate capital, and high taxes. His personal goals are diversifying his business, expanding his business into new markets, and moving his business to a more permanent location.

loans.use: to open another drug shop.

loans.name: St Monicah Group

texts.en:
Evans is the facilitator of the St Monicah group. Evans and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Evans takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Evans had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 ½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Evans was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Evans and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Evans will buy land and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of St Monicah group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Safia Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Safia Bibi is a 46-year-old woman. She is married and lives with her family: a husband and four children. Besides her one child at home, the others are getting an education.   

Safia’s days are focused on making progress with her business. She is involved in sewing works. Her work is home-based. She sews clothes with perfect measurement. In her working experience, she has never received any complaints from her customers. Her husband’s business relies on providing photocopying services to the people. He has a photocopier machine in his shop. He has been operating his business for over 13 years. 

Safia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. He intends to use the loan to purchase another photocopier machine to serve more clients at a time. This will help to generate good revenue. She hopes that her husband will grow the business more and improve the quality of services after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy another photocopier machine for photocopying business.

loans.name: Rubin

texts.en:
Rubin is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has three children. Rubin has a shop that sells coconuts for copra. He has had this business for five years. He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy coconuts for sale.

Rubin has been a member of HSPFI since 2010, and hopes to improve his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy coconuts for sale

loans.name: Aglow

texts.en:
Aglow is 25 years old and is married with one child. Aglow sells baked goods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business.    Aglow needs a loan of 1,500 talas to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Aglow joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Aglow's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose es un joven padre de familia, vive al lado de su esposa y de su pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Mala, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura y en época de verano sus playas hermosas son visitadas por muchos turistas. Jose es un noven muy trabajador y con  muchos deseos de salir adelante,  el trabaja en una granja como operario de incubadoras, el labora alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede turnarse ya sea de día o de noche para trabajar, con el fruto de su trabajo y sobre todo con mucho esfuerzo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y sobre todo sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo a que ama tanto; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es responsable y sobre todo porque está muy motivado por el regalo más grande que Dios le ha podido dar el cual es su hijo.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una moto, lo cual le permitirá movilizarse mejor para ir a su trabajo ya que queda muy lejos y gasta mucho en pasajes sobre todo cuando tiene turno en la noche, de esta manera el podrá tener más ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa construida de material noble y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
José is a young parent. He lives with his wife and their small one-year-old child. Their home is located in Mala, a city known for having a warm and inviting climate. In addition, agriculture is carried on, and in the summertime its beautiful beaches are visited by many tourists. 

José is a very hard-working young man with a great desire to succeed. He works on a farm as an incubator operator. He works around eight hours a day, and may do shift work; either day or night. With the income from his work, and especially with a lot of effort, he is able to cover his household expenses, and above all, raise their small son whom he loves so much. 

He believes his work is going well because he is responsible, and especially because he is very motivated by the greatest gift that God has been able to give him: his son.  

José is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to buy a motorcycle which will make it easier for him to go to work, as it is far away and he spends a great deal on bus fares, especially when he works the night shift. 

This way he will be able to have more income and continue striving to be able to make his greatest dream a reality: "To have a house constructed of high quality materials, and provide our son with a good education."

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: Âgée de 39 ans,Félicienne n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Félicienne est mariée à un peintre auto du nom de Gérard. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Félicienne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. Félicienne vend des tissus et des bijoux à son domicile et par la technique de distribution depuis quatorze ans et divers produits (biscuits, savons, laits etc) de façon secondaire ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Félicienne s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de Félicienne devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Félicienne sollicite une quatrième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus, des bijoux et divers produits.

loans.name: Song

texts.en: Mrs. Song is a hardworking woman, 59 years old. She has two children, all of them have a job. She needs loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve health of her family’s member and also for environment protection. Her family’s income is mainly from fishing anh husbandry so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Benilda is 55 years old and has one child in school.

Benilda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Benilda requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as, flour, spices, and other supplies needed in her business.

Benilda has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Benilda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: tobuy ingredients such as, flour, spices, and other supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en:
Nemat is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan, Lachin region Gulabirt village. He is married. He settled with family and child in Sumgait city. He has been engaged in this business for 14 years. This is not his first loan, he borrowed 500$ a year ago. With first loan he bought 6 sheep. The loans were paid back timely.
Nemat applies for a loan amount of 1000$ to buy 14 sheep.

loans.use: To buy 14 sheeps

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Ambang Beltha

texts.en:
Forty-two year old Beltha is married with one child and her husband is unemployed. She frequently faces health challenges. These problems motivated her to start a micro-finance business. Tapioca (a starchy food produced from cassava tubers) is consumed on a very large scale in her community. She started and succeeded in providing tapioca to her community on a daily basis. Her community benefited a lot from her activities as her products were always available even at home and community members didn't have to wait until market days before having tapioca.  

Beltha has gained patronage from many people within and outside her community mainly because of her quality goods and customer service. She has a desire to provide quality and quantity goods in order to keep up with the demand. Given a loan of $400, she plans to farm cassava on a large scale since it’s the main component of tapioca. Since cassava is perishable, producing tapioca with cassava from her own farm will be cheaper and more reliable than buying . Beltha plans to repay the loan during the term.

loans.use: Farming of cassava and buying of palm oil.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married, has three children - two of whom are married themselves - and lives in Apodaca in Nuevo Leon. Three years ago her husband was laid off from his job and they used his severance pay to invest in a small grocery store. Since then, they have expanded their inventory to better serve their customers and, as a result, their business has continued to grow. Her husband helps run the store in the morning and works as a blacksmith in the afternoon. Together they have forged ahead and provided a better life for their family.

Gloria is requesting a loan of US $550 to purchase additonal merchandise to meet the demand of her current customer base. She intends to repay this loan over a period of six months. Please be a part of her growing business. Gloria and her family sincerely thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria es casada, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos ya están casados, y vive en la localidad de Apodaca en Nuevo León. Hace tres años, después de que su esposo perdiera su empleo, la liquidación que recibió la utilizaron para invertir en su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, y poco a poco han ido surtiendo mejor la tienda para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y poder crecer. Ahora su esposo le ayuda por las mañanas y por las tardes hace trabajos de herrería, juntos han logrado salir adelante con su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Para poder continuar creciendo Gloria necesita un préstamo de $ 550 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía, esto le permitirá cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y conservar su preferencia, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Gloria, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente el apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa B. is twenty-nine years old, married, and has three children. She operates a small food stall in the market of Makeni, in Sierra Leone.  She sells cooking oil, onions, peppers, salt, and tomato paste, and vegetables.  Before her previous loan, Hawa could only purchase supplies in small quantities on a daily basis. She had to purchase these items mainly from other retailers and middle men.  Her previous loan increased her purchasing power.  Now Hawa is requesting a loan of $250 so she can purchase her stock directly from the wholesalers which will increase her profit.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase seasonal products for the holidays.

loans.name: Virginia Vda De

texts.es:
Virginia is a 58 years old widow, who presently lives with her two daugthers, of 18 and 22 years of age. In order to make a living for the family, she sells bread and food, having two years of experience in the business. The competition is almost nonexistent, as there are no other similar business in the area.

She will use the requested loan to renovate her house. The costs of materials vary depending on the supplier.

Her only credit history is with Agrocapital and, for the time she has been a client, she has proven to be a responsible and punctual person.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Virginia es una señora viuda de 58 años de edad, que actualmente vive con sus dos hijas de 18 y 22 años. Para mantener a su familia, se dedica a la venta de pan y comida, negocios en los que tiene dos años de experiencia. La competencia es casi nula debido a que en la zona donde vive no hay otros negocios de estas características.

El dinero de la presente solicitud lo utilizará para la refacción de su vivienda; los precios de los materiales varian de acuerdo al proveedor.

Sólo tiene antecedentes crediticios en Agrocapital y, durante el tiempo de relación con la institución, demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual.

loans.use: Home renovation.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis Ruiz is 45 years old and married to Iluminada who is forty-five years old. Together they have five children, two of whom have graduated from college, and three who are still in high school.

In order to step into the world of small businesses and support his growing children, Luis had to travel to Buenos Aires, Argentina and sell goods. After making and saving enough capital to begin his business, he soon returned to Paraguay where he could be reunited with his family. Today he is a traveling clothes salesman in Ybycuí and surrounding towns.

His hard work and dedication has allowed his two working children to continue with their profession and allowed his younger children to continue their education. Luis’s hope is that one day all of his children will be able to gain degrees and will not have to struggle to make a living.

His request for a loan is to fulfill his hope of increasing the size of his business and buy larger quantities of T-shirts, pants, and Bermuda shorts to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of T-shirts, pants, and Bermuda shorts

loans.name: Buziika Central A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Harriet N.. She is currently in the business of running a bar and is requesting a loan to boost business. Harriet is 45 years old and is a widow. She has 6 children ranging from age 18 to 32 and her children go to school. Each week, Harriet makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start a retail shop. Harriet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Harriet is joined in her small group by Aminah N., Aisha N., Joweria N., and Mary T.. Aminah N. has a business selling eggs and wants to expand her business. Aisha N. is currently operating a stationery shop business and wants a loan to add stock. Joweria N. operates a business selling milk and wants to buy more milk cans. Mary T. is currently in the business of selling foodstuff and is requesting a loan to add more capital.

loans.use: To purchase more beer and expand a bar business

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is 28 years old. Every day she divides her time between tending her small grocery store and selling prepared meals from home with the help of her beloved husband. Not long ago they had to overcome a terrible illness affecting the husband, and they have now decided to strive towards improving the quality of life for their young children. The loan requested will help increase the number of goods at the grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Catalina de 28 años de edad, divide su tiempo diario para dedicarse a la atención de su pequeña bodega y a la venta de platos preparados en su domicilio con ayuda de su querido esposo, hace poco han superado la penosa enfermedad por la que atravesaba su esposo y ahora han decidido esforzarse más para elevar el nivel de vida de sus pequeños hijos. La solicitud de un préstamo atiende a la necesidad de incrementar la cantidad de artículos de su bodega.

loans.use: More goods for the small grocery store

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
M. Francis is a dealer of electrical products. He is married and has 3 children. Business is doing very well, and he wishes to increase sales but lacks adequate funding.

He is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Teopista Namaganda's Group

texts.en:
Teopista is a leader of five members and is the second from the left. She is 44 years old and is married with 6 children. Two of them are married and the others are in school. They are 27, 25, 22, 18, 15 and 14 years old. The community she resides in is semi-urban. She goes to the villages where she collects the charcoal for both retail and wholesale. The challenges are high transport costs and a limited number of clients. This is because many people in that area can afford to buy charcoal from other areas and transport it to their homes. Competition is also quite stiff.

She managed to buy a plot of land where she built some rooms for her to live in and for renting out. These benefits are on top of securing an education for her children and improving their general standard of living.

Her intention is to construct more rooms for renting out. Teopista has successfully paid back more than 14 loans.

loans.use: To construct more rooms for renting out.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
