Juan started his business after he tried working at other jobs and couldn't make enough to support his family. For that reason, he had to start his own transport business and it's worked so far because, thanks to the business, he's been able to cover his needs and those of his family.

Juan started the business some years ago and since then he hasn't stopped working for even a day. He rented the bus at first but then came to own it because making monthly payments when he was renting didn't leave much of a margin. Now that the bus is his, he gets a little more use from it but he has to ensure that it's properly maintained to avoid having to replace parts so often.

Juan is applying for a US$975 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, so that he can buy some parts for the bus that need to be replaced and also to be have an extra reserve for gas. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Juan inició el negocio porque habia intentado trabajar en otras partes y no le alcanzaba con su sueldo para sostener los gastos de la casa, por eso tuvo que optar por arrancar su propio negocio de transporte y hasta la fecha le ha funcionado porque gracias a esto ha podido cubrir sus necesidades y las de su familia.

Comenzó hace varios años con el negocio y desde entonces no ha parado de trabajar un solo dia. En un inicio solo rentaba el microbus pero ya despues se quedo con el y pudo sacar mas ganacia porque si lo rentaba tenia que pagar cuota y no le dejaba mucho margen de ganancia, ahora que es suyo tiene un poco mas de utilidad pero de todas maneras tiene que estar dandole mantenimiento para que no tenga que cambiar las piezas tan rapidamente.

El solicita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar unas piezas que ya necesitan cambiarle al microbus y tambien para tener una reserva extra para la gasolina. Con tu ayuda esto sersa posible.

loans.use: Bus maintenance for transport business.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana is 60 years old. She studied until the fifth year of elementary school. She is a widow and she has three children, who are all married. She is a partner of Wiñay Marca Communal Bank. Since she got married, she has been selling hardwood floors, firewood, nails, etc. Since 1985, when her husband died, she has run the business by herself. She has the support of an assistant to cut the wood. Friends and neighbors formed a group of fifteen people, who had a business and needed a loan and formed the Communal Bank Wiñay Marca where they learned the woman rights, and learned how work responsibly. She tells us that they first get a small loan of $105 and if they repaid in time they can bigger loans. With her new loan of $1075, which will be repaid over a period of 4 months, she will buy wood and firewood. Also she plans to install a small candy and soda shop at home. This way she will assure a bigger income. Her vision is to keep her business and to keep on working up until she has the strength and life.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

Adriana tiene 60 años D. edad, quien estudio hasta el quinto año D. primaria, es V. y tiene tres hijos, los cuales son casados. La señora es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñay Marca, desD. que se caso se dedica a la venta D. tablas para piso, venta D. leña, clavos, etc. desD. 1985 fecha en la que falleció su esposo, ella continua con el negocio. Para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo D. un maestro y un ayudante para el corte D. madera. Amigas y vecinas formaron un grupo D. quince personas, las cuales tenían un negocio y necesitaban D. un crédito y conformaron el Banco Comunal Wiñay Marca en donD., aprendieron cuales son los derechos D. la mujer, aprendieron a trabajar organizadamente y responsablemente. Nos cuenta que el crédito que se les ofrece es en forma escalonada, según el tiempo que estén D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles a mas. Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará madera y leña, también piensa instalar una pequeña tienda D. golosinas y gaseosas en su mismo domicilio y D. esta manera asegurar un poco mas sus ingresos. Su visión es mantener su negocio y seguir trabajando hasta donD. le alcancen sus fuerzas y la vida.

loans.use: Buy wood and firewood.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 22 years old. She is a married with 1 child, aged 2. She owns a salon and is a hair dresser. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Saolme now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business.

loans.use: To improve her business by buying more salon items.

loans.name: Camilia

texts.en: Camilia is 53 years old, single, and lives in a small village near Habaya in Southern Lebanon. Camilia is an active member of the group A. Namla, which means "the ant" in Arabic. Camila's ambitions, however, are certainly not ant-like. She has requested a loan of $200 to open a new business selling clothes. This is the first time Camila has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase stock of clothes to open retail business

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi G. est revendeuse de poissons, depuis 3 ans, à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter des poissons, les faire fumer pour la revente. Ce faisant, elle pourrait contribuer à la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille
texts.en:
For the past three years, Afi G. has been a fish retailer in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is 35 years old, married and the mother of three school-aged children. With this loan, Afi hopes to buy fish to smoke for sale. Doing so means she would be able to assume responsibility for some family expenses.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.ru: Султонкулов Азимчон парень в возросте 24 года женат , имеет одного ребенка.Всё своё время он занимается откормом и продажей скота.Жена его хорошая доярка и производитель домашнего кефира и сливок.У него сейчас большая корова , которая в день даёт 8 литров молока с маленьким телёнком , который на снимке.Азимчон объяснил что хочет взяв кредит купить ещё две коровы, пока скот дешёвый на рынке.Кроме коровы он имеет ещё 20 баранов.Он благодарен инвесторам за понимание и поддержку
texts.en:
Azimjon S. is twenty-four, married, and has one child. He spends all of his time fattening and selling livestock. His wife is a good milkmaid, and she makes homemade kefir and cream. She currently has a large cow who gives eight liters of milk a day, and a small calf (seen in the photograph). Azimjon explained that he would like to take out a loan to buy two more cows while the price of cattle is relatively low. Besides the cow, he has twenty rams. He is grateful to his investors for their understanding and support.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing livestock and feed

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mrs. Vann C., 59, is widowed and has three children, two of whom are palm juice collectors, while the third one is a farmer who helps his mother in farming rice. The family lives in the Krodas Kor village in Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. Vann C.'s rice plantation is not very productive due to the low fertility of the soil. She is therefore asking for a loan to buy fertilizers to be able to increase the harvest.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for a rice field

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị N. năm nay 30 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007.Hiện nay cả hai vợ chồng chị đều tham gia kinh doanh buôn bán hàng tạp hóa, bánh kẹo và đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu của gia đình chị N. trong thời gian qua. Với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng  gia đình chị N. đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống
Vòng vốn tới chị N. mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá phục vụ nhu cầu của nhân dân địa phương trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị N., 30 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2007. Currently, both she and her husband work in their shop, selling groceries and snacks. This is the main source of income for the family. With their income of about 3,000,000 VND (183 USD) per month, Mrs. N. and her family have been able to steadily improve their standard of living. In the next lending cycle, Mrs. N. hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (550 USD) to invest in buying goods that will meet the demands of her customers during the upcoming lunar new year holiday.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery store inventory for lunar new year

loans.name: Ana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ana del Socorro Salmerón C. tiene la edad de 60 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Ana tiene 1 hijo de la edad de 20 años y actualmente estudia y colabora en el negocio con su Mama, sus propósitos son mantener su negocio activo para seguir proporcionando a su familia una fuente de ingresos ya que como toda persona ansiosa de superación  ocupa este  medio de trabajo como supervivencia para ella y su familia sus sueños son de que su hijo establezca un negocio por su propia cuenta para que el adquiera experiencia en los negocios y el día de mañana pueda hacer frente a todo tipo de problemas y esto le ayudara a madurar para la vida misma los sueños de Doña Ana son que las personas del exterior aprecien su trabajo ya que una parte del procedimiento del bordado es hecho a maquina y la otra es hecho a mano y le gustaría que sus productos sean exportados al extranjeros para considerar la calidad de su trabajo ya que todo lo que a logrado ha sido por que es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora.

Su actividad económica es la de costurera la venta de ropa y elaboración de repostería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación que es la siguiente de la iglesia San José 175 vrs al este, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 30 años, Doña Ana inicia su actividad económica, después de haber nacido su único hijo y al ser abandonada por el por su compañero de vida es así que enfrenta el reto de llevar el sustento diario a su hijo recién nacido y a ella misma, sin embargo a pesar de estos retos fue acogida por su familia y con el apoyo de ellos decide iniciar ofreciendo los servicios de costurera a diferentes familias y amigos y a pesar de que este oficio lo aprendió a temprana edad lo utilizo como herramienta de trabajo debido al poco tiempo que tenia con su trabajo decide incursionar en el aprendizaje de la repostería actividad que la volvió como otro medio de ingresos y que hasta la fecha ha logrado mantener ambos negocio por lo que para ella fue muy difícil ya que sufría una enfermedad que asota a la gran mayoría de las mujeres nicaragüenses como es el cáncer de mama y pudo superarla aferrada a su fe espiritual y el amor de ver crecer a su hijo que dependía totalmente de ella quien no podía descuidar la actividad pues era el único sustento y así es como obtiene este medio de trabajo por lo que ahora pide el financiamiento para capitalizar su negocio ya que cuando se enfermo ocupo el capital de trabajo para compra los medicamentos para su salud ya que también necesita realizar la compra de materia  prima para la elaboración de los bordados y la repostería  y gratifica la ayuda que le ha proporcionado Fundación León 2000 y las diferentes organizaciones amigas.
texts.en:
Ana del Socorro S. C. is 60 years old. She has a 20-year old son who is in school and helps her with her business. Her goal is to maintain her business so that she can continue providing her family with a source of income. Like everyone eager to get ahead, she works hard in order to help both herself and her family. Her greatest hope is that her son will establish his own business so that he can gain experience and confront the problems that he will have to face in business, something that will help him all his life. Ana's hope for herself is that people outside her country will appreciate her embroidery work, part of which is machine-made and part hand-made. She would like her products to be exported abroad so that foreigners can appreciate the quality of her work. She wants them to know that she's succeeded because she's a strong and hard-working woman. Ana makes a living as a seamstress, making and selling clothes, and as a baker, making and selling baked goods. She operates the businesses from her house near the San Jose church. She started in business 30 years ago when she was abandoned by her partner after the birth of her son and faced the everyday challenge of feeding both herself and her baby. Despite the difficulties, her family took her in and, with their help, she was able to start a business, offering her sewing skills to family and friends. She also entered into a bakery apprenticeship, work that she turned to in order to supplement her earnings from her sewing business. She's managed to maintain both businesses, something that was especially hard for her because like most Nicaraguan women she's suffered from breast cancer. Despite her illness, she had to work because her businesses were her only source of income. Her faith and her love for her son sustained her while she was ill but the medicine that she had to buy exhausted her capital. She's applying for a loan to recapitalize her business and buy the basic materials she needs for her sewing and pastry businesses. She's grateful for the help that she has received from Fundacion Leonn 2000 and other associated organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”, ubicado en el Jr. Lloque Yupanqui Mz. G Lt 21, de Km 6,200 en la Asociación Pro vivienda San Martin D. Distrito de Callería. Tiene 50 años de edad con 02 hijos, su esposo trabaja en la Municipalidad de Coronel Portillo. 

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de Trescientos Nuevos Soles (S/. 300.00), compró gaseosas, ollas y artículos de primera necesidad para poder vender menú.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1300 nuevos soles, comprará una olla arrocera,  4 ollas grandes ya que  brinda servicios de alimentos  a todo el personal  de una empresa maderera  cerca de su casa donde su hija labora. 

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por su  ayuda y confianza  que  deposita en ella.
texts.en:
Adela belongs to The Winners community bank located in San Martin, Peru. She is 50 years old and has two children. Her husband is a works in the municipality of Coronel Portillo. With the first loan Adeloa received of 300 soles, she purchased soft drinks, pots and pans, and articles of primary need to be able to sell her meals. With the current loan she is requesting of 1,300 soles, she plans to purchase a rice cooker and four big pots so she can provide food services to all the workers at a lumber business where her daughter works near her home. She thanks Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for its help and the confidence it places in her.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a rice cooker and four big pots

loans.name: Emerson Beymar

texts.es:
Emerson trabajaba en un Hotel de cocinero pero fue retirado por que se encuentra mal de la vista ahora consiguió un local donde prepara y vende comida y así cubre sus gastos de alimentación y manutención de su familia, vive con su esposa y tiene un hijo actualmente se encuentra viviendo en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la calle Exaltación, zona Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto. 


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, refresco por cantidad para poder producir los alimentos en su pensión.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Emerson used to work as a cook in a hotel, but left because of vision problems. He now has a place where he prepares and sells food, which is how he supports his family. He lives with his wife and son in his parents' house, located in Zona Exaltación in the city of El Alto. With this loan he will buy rice, sugar, oil and beverages in bulk to produce his dishes. An evaluation qualified him for this, his first loan.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries

loans.name: Nassoro

texts.en: Food shops are very common in Dar es Salaam. Nassoro S. runs a food shop business at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells a variety of crop products in his shop. He sells non-cereal and cereal products including wheat flower, maize flower, sugar, beans, groundnuts, cooking oil, cashew nuts and maize grains .He purchases the items direct from the producers and others from Kariakoo city market. He needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to boost his business

loans.use: To buy more products for his shop

loans.name: Isabela

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Isabela C. F. from Dar es Salaam. She is single and she is supporting two dependants whose parents are not able to take care of them. Isabela has been running a bead and necklace business since 2004. Beads are small rounded pieces of glass, stone or plastic which are perforated and threaded on a string with others to make a necklace or rosary.
She works at the business for 5 to 8 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by ten people. Isabela currently earns about $143 US from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional stock of beads and necklaces. For the future, she plans to to establish a new business.
Isabela thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of beads and necklaces

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells sarongs and underwear. She is a LAPO client. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. Elizabeth is 45 years old and married with five children. She says thanks to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Rahmatilla

texts.en: Rahmatilla is 27 years old and he is the father of three children. His wife is a housekeeper and she supports him in everything he does. Rahmatilla is a hard working person and he has been providing taxi services for more than 5 years. The most important thing to him is that his children finish school so that they may have a bright future. Rahmatilla wishes to keep his taxi business growing, and for this he needs to have his working tools in good working order. He needs to buy spare parts to improve their condition and that is why he is requesting a loan. Thanks to this work Rahmatilla has been able to stabilize his quality of life. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing his taxi

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda manages a village store in Tandul, which is in the municipality of Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 42 years old and is married to a farmer named Joel A.. They have a son named Mark Dexter, who is five years old. Their main source of income is farming, but Imelda’s store is a great alternative source of income that provides her family with many of their basic needs.

Imelda is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 13,000 for her store. She hopes that through the loan she will able to increase the weekly income she earns from the business.

“Share a little love whenever you can” is the quotation that Imelda uses to share blessings with others, she said.

loans.use: To obtain business capital for her store

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi A. est un jeune homme de 30 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. il est conducteur de taxi moto. kossi exerce cette activité depuis 3 ans, mais la moto qu’il conduit n’est pas de sa propriété. Il désire avec ce crédit acquérir sa propre moto afin de mieux gagner sa vie.
texts.en:
Kossi A. is a young man, 30 years old, married, and the father of one child. He is a motorbike taxi driver. He has been in this business for three years, but the motorbike he drives is not his property. He would like to use this loan to acquire his own motorbike in order to earn his living better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy his own motorbike

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es:
La señora María Fernanda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. D. Guadalupe”, Distrito D. Bellavista, Provincia D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 64 años y es madre 07 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes y con familia.

Lleva 12 años, dedicándose a la venta D. pescado fresco, queriendo aportar en su familia con los ingresos económicos, contando para esto con un capital D. S/. 600.00 que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y variedad D.  especies. Su negocio se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central, un puesto muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprará pescado fresco en kilos tanto los que produce la región como los D. la costa del país como: bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, pejerey para así mantener surtido su negocio y satisfacer el exigente gusto D. su clientela. 

María Fernanda, nos manifiesta su satisfacción por pertenecer muchos años a un grupo D. mujeres que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Fernanda belongs to the “Our Lady of Guadalupe” Community Bank in the district of Bellavista, in the province of Bellavista, in the department of San Martín. She is married, is 64 years old, and is the mother of 7 children, all of whom are now independent and have their own families. She has spent 12 years selling fresh fish. She wants to proviD. for her family with her income, including capital of 600 soles, which was invested very well. Because of this, today she continues with the same business, but now with larger quantities and varieties of fish. Her business is located in the central market, in a stand that is very well-equipped to take care of her clients. With this loan of 1000 soles, she will buy many kilos of fresh fish, which are produced in the region, including those from the country’s coast, like bocachico, pomfrets, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, and pejerey, to keep her business stocked and to satisfy the demands of her clients. María Fernanda is satisfied to have spent many years in a group of women that have helped her overcome difficulties that she went through, but was able to confront with a lot of strength.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kilos of fresh fish, including bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, and pejerey

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La señora Benita y su esposo, Enrique, viven en la  zona Valle de las Flores junto a sus dos pequeños hijos. Ella se dedica al Tejido artesanal con lana e hilo de mantas y ropa de niños. Comenzó con esta actividad hace tres años. Don Enrique es albañil y con esta catividad le ayuda a su esposa en los gastos de la casa. Solicitan el crédito para aumentar un cuarto en la casa y utilizarlo como taller para los tejidos. Ellos son muy responsables con su familia y su trabajo.
texts.en:
Benita and her husband Enrique live in the Valle de las Flores zone together with their two small children. She makes artisan cloth from wool and thread into blankets and childrens clothes. She started this business three years ago. Enrique is a bricklayer and through his work he helps his wife with the household expenses. They are asking for a loan to add a room to the house and use it as a cloth-making workshop. They are a very responsible and hardworking family.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement and clay for construction work

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Doña Ana Maria de 67 años de edad,  ha logrado  mantener su negocio de venta de ropa lo cual inicio hace doce años para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, tiene un hijo que le ayuda, a mucho esfuerzo se preparo y es ingeniero químico. Ya no tiene la ayuda de su esposo ya que falleció pero en vida ayudo junto con su hijo a poner la venta, reside en el barrio Leonel Rugama, sus planes es seguir ayudando a su hijo y salir a delante con el negocio con este crédito invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva ay variada para ofertar a sus clientes a si como la captación de nuevos clientes con esto espera incrementar las ventas como sus ganancias. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de poder seguir mejorando a cada familia Nicaragüense con sus préstamos.
texts.en:
Ana Maria, aged 67, has succeeded in maintaining her clothing business, which she opened twelve years ago to help her husband out with expenses. She has one son, who assists her. After a lot of difficult training, he is now a chemical engineer. Ana Maria's husband has passed away, so he is no longer there for her. While he was alive, though, he and her son helped her with her sales. Ana Maria lives in the Leonel Rugama neighborhood. She plans to keep helping her son get ahead with the business. She'll invest her loan in the purchase of a selection of new clothing to offer her current clients, and to attract more clientele. She hopes she can increase her sales as well as her profits. She is grateful to Afodenic for being able to continue improving each Nicaraguan family with its loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a selection of men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en:
Pelenatete L. is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Faatoia.  She is married and has 7 school-aged children.  To make a living, Pelenatete runs a bakery.  She bakes and sells a variety of confectionaries such as cookies and cakes in her local community.  Pelenatete has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 450 tala a month.

In 2008, Pelenatete joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Pelenatete has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 tala from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase baking equipment.  Pelenatete is now requesting a new loan of 1500 tala which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients.  The loan will be the 2nd loan she has taken out from SPBD.  Pelenatete plans to use the extra money she earns to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida M. lives in the village of Sitio, Cagay, Brgy. Su-ay, in the City of Himamaylan Negros Occidental. She is 47 years old and married to Rodolfo M., a Provincial Government employee. They have 12 children - the oldest is 27 years old and the youngest is only three. Most of their children are still in school. Even with such a big family to feed and raise, Leonida is contented with her life, determined to take care of her children and prepare them to face life once they're all grown up. She is indefatigable in her role as mother and wife.

To help her husband increase their income and set aside some money for their future security, Leonida set up a general store. When she started, she only had a little capital so she just carried the most basic household commodities that were in demand in her neighborhood. She decided not to sell food or candies in her store because she knew that her children would not be able to resist eating them, diminishing their income. For several years, she continued to just rollover her capital, earning a very small income. While it helped with their family expenses, her store was not expanding. She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 to gain access to additional income so that she could finally expand her business. 

As her income continued to improve, she was able to pay off her loans on time and maintain a good credit record with NWTF-Project Dungganon. Later, Leonida invested in a backyard hog-fattening project, which allowed her to involve her children in an income-generating activity by letting them take care of the pigs as part of their daily chores.  She has been operating her general store for 19 years now and she testifies that her continuing success is because she is dedicated, works hard, perseveres and is disciplined in her pursuit. This has improved the quality of life of her family. She presently earns PHP 6,000 average monthly profit from her business and it helps to pay for the family expenses, allows her to afford sending her children to school, and contributes to making their life more comfortable than before. 

Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 was used to add to her working capital. She paid all of her weekly installments on time and the loan was paid in full within its loan term. Now she is borrowing PHP 15,000 for her 16th loan cycle, again to invest in the expansion of her product offerings in her general store. She intends to use the income from this loan to do some house repair, pay for the tuition of her children and provide them with their daily allowance. 


About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional Capital for General Store and Hog-Fattening

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 36 year old businesswoman and the mother of three girls. She sells ladies shoes and slippers in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. She has been in this business for ten years and hopes to expand it into a wholesale business, that will generate a profit. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy more ladies shoes, slippers, and rubber shoes. She describes herself as hardworking and dreams of becoming a successful distributor.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward F. is 45. He wants a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones to pay school fees for his children. Edward is married to a businesswoman and they have five children. Two of the children are in secondary schools, one is in primary school and the other is not of school-going age.

loans.use: Pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
To earn a living, Oun M. owns a motor to buy fresh fish in bulk from fisherman. He sells the fish to retailers who take them to the market. Oun M. was born in 1960 and his wife, Ya Khoeun, is age 30. They live together in Pursat Province. He typically generates an income of $5 each day to contribute to his family. His wife is a cake seller. In addition, this couple also cultivates rice during the growing season. The family takes care of three school-age children. Oun M. is looking for a loan to use as capital to sustain the growth of his fish selling business. 
The two people shown in the photo are Mr. Oun M. and his wife.

loans.use: To sustain the growth of a fish sellling business

loans.name: Firdaus

texts.en:
Mrs. Firdaus A. is 23 years old and married to S. A., a businessman. They have one young child by the name of A. Hakim and they reside in Bamburi, Mombasa.

Firdaus A. will use her loan from KADET to import clothes from Saudi Arabia for her secondary business. Mrs. A. was introduced to KADET by an existing client and says that she is very happy to be associated with the institution.

In future Firdaus hopes to have a larger space for her game zone and video-showing hall so that she will be able to accommodate more customers. She also wants to diversify the import business in a big way.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Import clothes from Saudi Arabia for her secondary business

loans.name: Las Progresistas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Las Progresistas está formado por un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, teniendo todas un gran lazo de amistad, el cual les hizo unirse para juntas poder salir adelante y ofrecer a su familia todo lo que no han podido tener en la vida, viven por la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo esta la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, tiene 4 ríos los cuales bañan a esta ciudad, su centro histórico nos lleva a recordar y revivir su historia es la ciudad donde todos desean vivir.

La  Sra. María Guiñansaca, es socia del banco comunal Las Progresistas, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca por un hermoso sector como es la Av. 1 de Mayo, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera y ha procreado 6 hijos, todos son mayores de edad,  sus cuatro primeros hijos son casados y dos solteros, estos últimos si le ayudan económicamente para los gastos de su hogar, la casa en la que habitan no es de su propiedad por lo que viven  arrendando.

María se dedica al negocio de entrega de viandas (preparación de platos para el almuerzo), trabaja de lunes a sábado comenzando con la preparación de sus platos a las 7 a.m. hasta 1 p.m. terminando con la entrega de sus platos, nos comenta que si le está yendo bien y que cuando le sobra tiempo deja adelantando la preparación de la comida del día siguientes, se lleva bien con todas las socias creando un buen ambiente de trabajo y compañerismo, es su segundo ciclo en la fundación y nos dice que  los préstamos recibidos los ha invertido en su negocio, y con el nuevo préstamo que  FUNDACION ESPOIR, le entrega, va a invertirlo en la compra de ollas, cilindros de gas que le hace falta, etc. Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener su salón.

La Sra. Martha Viñansaca es otra socia del banco las progresistas  se dedica al igualque su compañera a la elaboración de viandas, lleva realizando esta actividad hace 5 años, su horario de trabajo es de 8 a.m. hasta las 12 p.m., nos comenta que si le va bien pues ya tiene su clientela fija, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, es su primer préstamo en la fundación y quien la incentivo para ser socia de este fue su madre, y con el préstamo que fundación Espoir en entregó va a invertir en ampliar su negocio, su gran sueño es hacer más grande su negocio
texts.en:
The Las Progresistas communal bank is made up of a group of enterprising women who are all friends. They united to help each other get ahead in life and to offer their families everything they haven't been able to have in life. They live in greater Cuenca, which is Ecuador's third most important city. It has four rivers that bathe the city, its historic city center takes us to remember and relive its history; it is the city where everyone would like to live. María Guiñansaca, 53, is a member of the Las Progresistas communal bank. She lives in greater Cuenca in a beautiful area known as 1 de Mayo Avenue. She is a single mother and has had 6 children, all of whom are now adults. Her oldest four sons are all married and two are single. These two do help her economically to meet household expenses. They don't own their house; they rent. Maria works preparing and delivering lunches. She works Monday through Saturday, starting her meal preparation at 7am and going until 1pm when she finishes delivering her dishes. She tells us that she is doing well and, when she has any time left over, she does some advance preparation of the next day's meals. She gets along well with all the members of the group creating a good work environment and comradery. This is her second loan cycle with the foundation and she tells us that the loans received have been invested in her business. The new funds that FUNDACION ESPOIR will provide will be used to buy pots, gas tanks, etc. Her greatest wish is to have her dining room. Martha Viñansaca, is another group member. Like her fellow member, she also prepares lunches. She has been in this line of work for 5 years. She works from 8am to noon. She tells us that she does well because she has a regular customer base. Her business is located in her home. This is her first loan with the foundation and it was her mother who encouraged her to join. With the funding from fundación Espoir she will enlarge her business; her great dream is to make her business larger.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, lunches, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 34 years old. She is divorcee with one child who has just completed senior high school and is waiting to enter the university.  She supports herself and her child through trading. She deals in cosmetics. She sells through hawking, a form of selling whereby the seller moves door to door while carrying her stock on her head. 

Grace says selling cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to support her child’s education.

loans.use: To purchase assorted cosmetics

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Mr. Chheng I., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Kunthea Sok (pictured together), 39, were married in 1993 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. They live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  

Chheng has been a construction worker for three years. He works in his village. Mrs. Kunthea Sok has been producing rice wine for 16 years. 

Chheng is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to help his wife purchase additional materials for producing rice wine and to buy piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy materials for producing rice wine and to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward B. is a proprietor of a Relaxation pub and provision store. He is married and has three kids. He is normally assisted by his wife.

The business has been in existence for about six years and they have succeeded in leasing a piece of land that is strategically located for their type of business.

Edward is also an undergraduate in one of the universities in Sierra Leone where he does part-time photography.

Edward seeks a loan to get more stock for his his pub and provision store.

He hope to use the proceeds of the loan to complete payment of the lease and pay the school fees for his kids.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is a 43-year-old married woman. A mother of 5 children, she works as a home-based tailor to help her husband with the family's income. She has been involved in this business for the past 30 years. With her long experience, she has become well known throughout the whole region. Today, Samira is requesting a loan of $1,200 to replace her old sewing machine with a new one so she can continue to work properly and always satisfy the needs of her clients.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. M. is 31 years old, married and has two children, 6 and 11 years old. Her business is located in Migadini Estate in Mombasa, Kenya, the coastal region well known for its many, many tourist attractions, including the Indian Ocean's white beaches. Mary has been selling items such as rice, flour, oil, detergents, soft drinks, etc. for the last one and half years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable. Her major challenge is the number of people in the area with the same business as hers and so customers are overwhelmed with choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business going well. Mary is using her loan of KES 40,000 to buy more general items to expand her business. She hopes to be a wholesaler in the future, to provide her children with quality education and to own a house some day. She is a very hardworking lady.

loans.use: Flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Wasantha

texts.en:
Wasantha is a 44-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children in the town of Dickwella in the Matara district of Sri Lanka.

Wasantha is in the food production business, making small treats and food products to be sold to local markets. Her husband is a day laborer, and her daughters work in a supermarket and making sweetmeats.

This is the second loan for Wasantha from BRAC; with her first loan she started this business. Now she is requesting 40,000 LKR to help further expand her business.

Wasantha has seen success because there is very low competition in the area. She also considers herself to be honest and hard-working, to which she attributes her success as well.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie R. really wants her “sari-sari” (variety) store business to grow and becomes stable in order for her to have a steady source of income to support the education of her two adopted children until they graduate from college and have their own career. With the support of her husband, Rosemarie did not have any problems paying the loan she received.  However, she had problems maintaining her business because her profit is insufficient to cover the cost of her family expenses. Therefore, she has to spend some of the money that is meant for business capital. Thus, Rosemarie is requesting a much larger loan and is excited to see her business grow by having a huge amount of capital. Furthermore, she hopes that someday their lives will improve and her business will gain more customers.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her store

loans.name: Tamborada 2 Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Tamborada 2” esta representado por la señora Patricia y conformado por 10 miembros que residen en la misma zona, es una grupo que esta empezando a trabajar con nosotros pero son gente muy trabajadora y muy unida. La señora Patricia es bastante joven y se la ve responsable con el grupo ya que ella los ha organizado en el barrio para participar en el crédito, su negocio es la venta D. carne en el barrio, tiene una hijita que ya va al colegio D. la zona ella es madre soltera y vive en la casa D. su madre ella sabe como salir adelante porque sabe que su pequeña solo depenD. D. ella, la señora patricia destinara el crédito en la adquisición D. mercadería para incrementar sus ingresos y poder construir un departamento mas cómodo para ella y su hija en el terreno D. su mama. El resto del grupo tienen distintas actividades como tienda D. barrio, venta D. golosinas, taxista, plomero, venta D. comida y atención en funeraria. El nivel competitivo en el mercado en el cual realizan sus actividades los socios es alto pero todos saben como salir adelante para obtener el ingreso diario que es el sustento D. sus familias. A pesar D. ser un grupo nuevo ellos ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
Patricia is young, and she is responsible with the group. She organized them in the neighborhood in order to participate with the loan. Her business is selling meat in the neighborhood. She has a daughter who goes to school in the area. She is a single mother, and she lives in her mother’s house. She knows how to get ahead because she knows that her little one depends solely on her. Patricia will use the loan to get merchandise in order to increase her income. She will do this to be able to build a more comfortable apartment for herself and for her daughter on her mother’s land. The rest of the group has different activities like a neighborhood store, selling sweets, taxi driver, plumber, selling food, or funeral services. The level of competition in the market in which the members work is high. But, they know how to get ahead in order to get the daily income, which supports their families. In spite of being a new group, they have experience in unified groups thanks to loans in institutions like the Fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Rhonalyn

texts.en: Rhonalyn M., 32 years old, is a rice grower who manages her farm alone and desires an abundant harvest. Her parents taught her everything about farming, and she wants to make her enterprise productive to support the needs of her only child.  Rhonalyn would like to apply a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
53-year-old Daniel is the married father of seven children aged between 20 and 34 years. Three of the children are currently attending school.

Daniel is a hardworking farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya, where he has been practicing mixed farming for twenty-five years. His main produce consists of maize, tea and vegetables which he sells to the local market. He relies solely on the income from his farming activities to cater for his family's needs. His main challenges in this business are the fluctuations in market prices, diseases, and sometimes cattle-rustling in the area.

Daniel has requested this KES 51,600 loan through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He intends to use KES 10,000 to construct a cattle shed. This loan will enable his family to acquire another productive asset that will help boost their other sources of income. He hopes to purchase two more dairy cows in the future that will increase his milk production.

Daniel says that he has been taking loans from Juhudi that they have boosted his economic activities and have enabled his children to attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M., 47, is from the village of San Rafael. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Marites has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns around 5,200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Marites is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Chen S., 50, is widowed and resides with her four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorian temples. S. sells rice for an income of 5 USD per day. Her son is a bartender at a hotel in the town, earning an income of about 4 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. S. is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a motorbike for her son to ride to work. In the future, she would like to use any leftover money to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to ride to work

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El Sr. Aníbal, de 30 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Juana  Zárate  con quien tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad.
El Sr. Aníbal se dedica a la cerrajería, elaboración de copias de llave, cambio de cerraduras, etc., esta actividad lo realiza desde hace más de 5 años. 
Posee un local alquilado en uno de los salones del club  Sportivo Iteño, además cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes y es uno de los más conocidos de la zona.
Solicita el crédito para la apertura de un  nuevo local en los alrededores del mercado Municipal de Itá, donde hay muy pocas cerrajerías y donde tiene la posibilidad de adquirir mayor cantidad de clientes ya que es una zona muy transitada por personas que vienen desde todas las compañías y ciudades cercanas.
El Sr. Aníbal es cliente recurrente de la Fundación Paraguaya ya que ha accedido en reiteradas ocasiones a los préstamos que la institución brinda cumpliendo sin ningún tipo de problemas con los pagos, es además una persona muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Mr. Anibal, 30, is married to Ms. Juana Zárate. They have a 2 year-old son together. Mr. Anibal is a locksmith, makes copies of keys, changes locks, etc. He has been doing this type of work for over 5 years. He rents a workspace in one of the halls of the Sportivo Iteño club. He has a good number of customers and is one of the most well-known people in the area. He is requesting this loan in order to open a new location in the area surrounding the Itá municipal market, where there are very few locksmiths and where he will have the opportunity to increase his number of customers. It is a zone that is well-traveled by people who come from all of the nearby businesses and cities. Mr. Anibal is a repeat client of Fundación Paraguaya. There has never been any type of problem with his repayments on the previous loans he has agreed to. He is also a very hard-working person.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: costs for the opening of a new locksmith shop

loans.name: German Abrahan

texts.es:
German de 56 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas), el vende legumbres en un triciclo recorriendo las Orquídeas. 

El fue comerciante informal en la antigua “PPG” (mercado mayorista y minorista de Guayaquil), pero como necesitaba mas dinero decidió trabajar en un triciclo vendiendo verduras por el sector donde vive, ahora trabaja desde las 04h00am hasta el atardecer.  

El quiere incrementar sus ganancias poniendo a una persona a trabajar por eso el préstamo lo quiere utilizar para comprar un triciclo y verduras, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
German is 56 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area that is named after the many orchids that existed when the place was discovered). He sells legumes out of a tricycle that he uses to move around Orquídeas.

He previously worked as an informal merchant at the old “PPG” (a wholesale and retail market in Guayaquil). However, he needed more money so he decided to work from a tricycle and sell vegetables around the area where he lives. German now works from 4am until sunset.

He wants to increase his earnings by putting another person to work. For this reason, he will use this loan to buy another tricycle and vegetables. In the future, German wants to finish the construction of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase another tricycle & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en:
Frederick V. is from Barangay Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. He is 33 years old. Frederick is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Frederick raises livestock, primarily pigs, for breeding. Frederick has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Frederick joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Frederick is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Frederick from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
El Sr. Andrés H. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotaría, negocio que opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “San Antonio”  en el cual cuenta con varios años de experiencia y es notable que durante este tiempo lo a sabido administrar, su negocio es uno de los que luce de mejor surtido en el Barrio Santa Maria en donde el reside.
El señor H. es soltero, de él dependen 2 personas de los cuales don Andrés cubre los gastos de alimentación, vestuario, salud y vivienda.      
Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio a logrado mejorar sus condiciones de vida, se puede observar el crecimiento del mismo, además el señor Andrés a logrado establecer un nuevo negocio al frente de una gasolinera.

el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Andrés H. is a merchant, and his primary activity is selling groceries. His business operates under the name of San Antonio Mini Market. He has several years of experience. It is notable that during this time he has known how to manage the business. His business is one of the better stocked in the Santa Maria neighborhood, where he lives. Mr. H. is single, and there are two people who are dependent upon him. He covers their food, clothing, health, and housing expenses. With the earnings from his business he has managed to improve his living conditions. He has been able to observe the growth for himself. Also, Andrés has managed to establish a new business is front of a gas station. He will use the loan to buy more merchandise to better stock his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, rice, sugar, condensed milk, powdered milk, soft drinks, juice, soup, pastas, salsas, pills, coffee, cookies, corn flour, wheat flour, batteries, candles, butter, oil, toilet paper, aluminum foil, sanitary napkins, sweets, chiles, vinegar, and condiments

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a young housewife and mother from Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza Strip. Dalal has two daughters, and her husband, Hazem, is a Ministry of health employee. Dalal and Hazem own a womens' clothing store in Jabalia refugee camp. Hazem works in the store and she helps him sometimes.

Dalal and Hazem opened the store two years ago, and the store is slowly prospering. Dalal came to FATEN to take a $1,000 loan in order to start fixing and decorating the store as it needs shelves and stands. Dalal also wants to buy extra clothing inventory.

Dalal's husband, Hazem, appears in the picture as she doesn't like to be photographed.

loans.use: To purchase store decorations

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 32 years old and married with three children in school. She has been operating a grocery shop for five years. She is a member of the Favour Self Help group in Faulu Kenya. She has been guaranteed her first loan by the group.  

With 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she will add stock of vegetables, tomatoes and oranges. She hopes to work hard in her business so as to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: To add stock of vegetables, tomatoes and oranges

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny D. is from the village of Sto. Domingo, Echague, Isabela. She is 40 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jenny owns and operates a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport in the local community. Jenny is just starting this business.

In 2009, Jenny joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which she has successfully repaid, this new loan of 10,000 PHP will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the fourth loan that Jenny has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. Libertad ha pasado con éxito a su segundo  ciclo, es parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la  presidenta la señora Rose Mary,  la tesorera  la señora Mirtha y la secretaria de actas la señora Doris.

La señora  Doris es una mujer de 41 años de edad, casada, con  tres hijos,  las señoras consideraron que era la persona adecuada para el cargo de secretaria de actas.

Con respecto a su negocio, ella comercia con mercadería de distinto tipo, la venta de la misma es a pagos, lo que recibe el nombre de Pasanaku, aprendió este trabajo hace doce años de su suegra.  Las ventas son realizadas de manera ambulante, en personas que se encuentran en las escuelas, en el mercado, todos los días por las tardes.  Este crédito de Bs. 2500.-, está destinado para la compra de mercadería.
Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, tenemos: mecánico, venta de repuestos, venta de dulces, repartir víveres, tejido de manta, venta de mercadería en general, venta y flete de vestidos, venta de dulces, pensión - snack.
texts.en:
The “Libertad” (Liberty) Communal Bank has successfully completed its second cycle.  It is part of the Villa Exaltación Communal Center.  It is comprised of nine members; there are eight women and one man. The board of directors is comprised of Rose Mary, the president; Mirtha, the treasurer; and Doris, the secretary.

Doris is a 41 year old woman.  She is married and has three children.  The members considered her to be the right person to be the secretary.  She sells different types of merchandise, which is paid for in payments.  Her business is called Pasanaku.  She learned this work from her mother-in-law 12 years ago.  She sells in an itinerant manner to people she encounters at schools and at the market.  She works every afternoon.  This loan, for Bs. 2500, is to buy merchandise.

The businesses of the other communal bank members are:  mechanic, selling replacement parts, selling sweets, supply distribution, weaving blankets, selling general merchandise, selling and renting dresses, and a small eatery with snacks.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis has been working in the delivery industry for over seven years. His success and business savvy have helped him form relationships with some of the best-known bakeries in the New York City area. These relationships mean that starting very early in the morning, his day continues late into the afternoon delivering everything from muffins to cakes for various restaurants and cafes in the New York area.

This is Luis’s third loan with ACCION USA. His previous loan was used to insulate his van so that his baked goods would survive better in the summer heat. Since his previous loan, he has purchased a new van and will use this loan to insulate this van in order to provide the freshest pastries to his clientele. 

Luis hopes to continue to expand his contracts beyond his current six and gain more business with the City’s best bakeries. The continued growth of his business means that he has been better able to support his family and, more importantly, place his son in good schools. 

The staff at ACCION USA is particularly excited about watching Luis’s business grow because the office is a frequent client of his service!

loans.use: To insulate a new delievry van

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a twenty-six-year-old woman, living in her family's permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Her desire is to have a big family business. She has a retail shop which is very feasible although with a challenge of limited capital due to the ever increasing demand. Nevertheless, Sarah has been able to reap profits and wants to be a wholesale trader.

She intends to invest the loan in purchasing sugar, soap, salt, and cooking oil to sell at her shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, soap, salt, and cooking oil to sell at her shop

loans.name: Querer Es Poder Group

texts.es:
EL Banco D. emprendimiento QUERER ES PODER, viene trabajando ya cinco ciclos atrás este banco se caracteriza por ser puntual en los pagos y ser muy solidarias. Las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como: cosméticos ollas en aluminio, atención en su tienda y otras a la elaboración D. mantas, macramé y tejidos,
La Sra. MARIA es una D. las socias mas antiguas, ocupa el cargo D. presidenta la Sra. se dedica a la venta D. pasankallas, Tostado D. fideo arroz que elaboran artesanalmente, venD.  en la feria D. Copacabana y con el préstamo comprara en cantidad su mercadería y tiene dos hijos y es separada no vive con su esposo, y la Sra. CONSUELO   ocupa  el cargo D. secretaria se dedica a la elaboración D. embutidos como ser chorizo, sil pancho, milanesa D. carne con el préstamo otorgado comprara mas insumos para la elaboración en cantidad y la Sra. tiene tres hijos.
Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que lograron sacar a su familia adelante y están agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The 'QUERER ES PODER' (to want is to be able) communal bank has been through five loan cycles. The bank's members are noted for their punctuality in making repayments and their solidarity.  Some of the bank's members sell products such as cosmetics and aluminum pans, another works in her store and others make blankets, macramé and weave.

Maria is one of the oldest members of the bank.  She is the group's president and her business is selling 'pasankallas' (corn puffs) and toasted noodles with rice which she makes by hand.  She sells her products in Copacabana market and she will use her loan to buy her merchandise in bulk.  Maria has two children and is separated.  She does not live with her husband.

Consuelo is the group's secretary.  She makes sausages such as chorizo, 'sil pancho' and 'milanesa D. carne' (both breaded meat dishes popular in Bolivia).  She will use her loan to buy more ingredients for making her products in large quantities.  She has three children.

All the members of the group are responsible and hard-working people who have managed to get their families ahead in life.  They are grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Doris; ella tiene 40 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de fruta, la socia tiene su stand en el mercado Virgen Asunta esto es cerca al centro de la ciudad, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja ,llevan años en este negocio. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Doris, a member of “SIEMPRE ADELANTE” (Always Ahead), a communal bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Doris is 40 years old, she lives with her partner and they have 1 child. She alternates her daily chores with her activity, buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She has her own stand in the Virgen Asunta market located in the city center. She works together with her partner, and they have been running this activity for many years.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products for her shop.

Doris is happy about the loan and she commits to comply with the repayment of her debt.

loans.use: To buy more products for her shop.

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en: Five people are forming a group loan. They are located in Chrolong village, Kandal province. This group loan selected Mr. Son S. who is 31 years old as the group leader. Each member of this group will use their money to increase their income to improve the family's living conditions. Mr. Son S. is a farmer who owns a 1.60-hectare plot of land, which he uses to cultivate different vegetables and rice for a living.  He doesn’t have a water machine to pump water to plant his crops. So he decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water machine for cultivating vegetables and rice. His wife, Mrs. Min Rattana, 29 years old, works as a seamstress in a garment factory where she receives a small salary to support her family. This couple has three children. Two of the children attend the local school and one is five years old and not in school yet.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine (pump) for cultivating vegetables and rice.

loans.name: Jose Concepcion

texts.es:
José de 32 años, reside en Usulután, ahí vive con su esposa y 5 hijos, tienen casa propia, él es vendedor de productos domésticos en un vehículo donde se transporta a los pueblos cercanos a ofrecer la mercadería, también provee para negocios de la ciudad de Usulután.
Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos con la que cuentan su esposa e hijos, con las ganancias logran cubrir los gastos mensuales; por el momento está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería  y mantener fuerte el inventario del negocio, con este préstamo podrá fortalecer y crecer con su negocio, así mismo ofrecer variedad de productos para los clientes, ya que el comercializa en su vehículo dulces de toda clase, productos de cocina como condimentos, vinagres, y materiales detergentes.
Su aspiración es mejorar los ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades prioritarias de su familia, también desea darle a sus hijos los estudios necesarios para que puedan superarse y mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old and lives in Usulután with his wife and five children.  He has his own home and sells household items out of his truck which he drives to nearby towns.  He also supplies to businesses in the city of Usulután.

This business activity is the sole income for his family, allowing them to cover monthly expenses.  He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and maintain a high inventory.  The loan will help him strengthen and grow his business and will allow him to offer a variety of products to his customers.  He sells all kinds of sweets and kitchen products such as condiments, vinager, and detergent.

He aspires to improving his income so he can meet his family's priority needs.  He also wants to give his children the necessary education so they can be successful and have a quality lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy sweets and kitchen items

loans.name: Juan Emidio

texts.es: Juan Emidio tiene 47 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 5 hijos a su cargo ellos estudian y ayudan a Juan. La actividad económica es el destace de cerdo, hace más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad tambien realiza la venta y elaboracion de nacatamales. Inicio este negocio por su familia, ya que fueron ellos quienes le enseñaron este negocio a Juan le gusta mucho ya que siempre estaba interactuando con sus clientes. El es un hombre trabajador y le gusta enseñarles a sus hijos como se gana el dinero humildemente fue con el tiempo decide hacerse cargo de manera independiente de este negocio ahora es la fuente principal de sus ingresos. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra materia prima para su negocio. El sueño de Juan es seguir adelante a pesar de todas las dificultades.
texts.en: Juan Emidio is 47 years old and married.  He has five children that are students and they help Juan.  He makes a living butchering pigs and has worked in this business for more than eight years.  He also sells and makes nacatamales.  He started this business because of his family since they were the ones that taught it to Juan.  He likes it very much because he is also interacting with his customers.  He is a hardworking man and likes teaching his children how to humbly earn a living.  He decided to independently manage the business over time and it is now his main source of income.  The money he is requesting is for working capital to purchase raw material for his business.  Juan’s dream is to continue moving forward despite all of the difficulties.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kankele Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 femmes du groupe KANKELE ont en moyenne quarante ans, cinq enfants et vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires à Ouelessebougou ville, préfecture de Kati, relevant de Koulikoro (2ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de cosmétiques, de  gingembre, d’encens, de condiments alimentaires, d’habits à l’image de KADIA K., etc.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, trente kilogrammes de gingembre et quinze  chargements de charrettes  en  bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de SIKASSO et dans les villages environnants de Ouelessebougou et  effectue sa vente au  marché de Ouelessebougou et domicile  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the group KANKELE have an average age of forty years, five children and live in nuclear families in the city of Ouelessebougou, district of  Kati, in the region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of Mali). 
This is their first collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and they are requesting a loan in order to satisfy their cutomers demand. This group of women sells cosmetics, ginger, frankincense, condiments, clothes, etc.. 
One of them is Kadia K.. With this loan she wants to buy thirty-five kilograms of ginger and fifteen loads of firewood carts. She purchases her products at the big market of Sikasso as well as in the surrounding villages of Ouelessebougou and resells them at the market of Ouelessebougou and door to door, cash and credit; her customers are both men and women. 
She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA which will be partly used to support her husband with the daily expenses and the rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of retail products

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 20 años, vive en concubinato con Elvis, con quien tiene una hijita, Yeimy. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). Hace 2 años comenzó a producir la tierra; en 2 de sus 5 hectáreas de terreno agrícola, plantó café, los cuales están creciendo sin mayores dificultades, y dentro de un año darán sus primeros granos. Pero consiente que durante todo este tiempo  tiene que generar ingresos, plantó plátanos los cuales le proporcionan frutos cada 15 días. También trabaja en la hacienda de la señora Marian, haciendo matapaleo (proceso del podado de plantas para su mejor crecimiento). Ahora ella desea adquirir un buen capital de trabajo para poder plantar café en la totalidad de su terreno agrícola. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es secretaría de su asociación, comprometida a cumplir los acuerdos que se tomen en cada reunión. Elizabeth, después de la cosecha de café, está pensando con el crédito comprar varias plantitas de café para preparar los almácigos (pequeño viveros donde crece las plantas) para la próxima temporada, asimismo herramientas para limpiar y podar sus plantas.
texts.en: 20 year old Elizabeth lives with her partner, Elvis, with whom she has a little girl, Yeimy. They live together in their own home, located in the indigenous community of Kivinake (in the central jungle of Peru). Two years ago, she began working the land. She planted coffee on 2 of her 5 hectares of agricultural land, and this is growing without significant problems and will give its first crop within a year. But, because she is aware that she needs to generate income during all this time, she planted bananas that provide fruit every 15 days. She also works on the farm run by Mrs Marian, doing pruning to improve the growth of the plants. Now she wants to secure business capital to plant coffee on all her agricultural land. She belongs to the community bank "flor de almendra", where she is secretary of the association, and this is the first loan that she has had from MFP. She promises to meet the repayment agreements at each meeting. After the coffee harvest, Elizabeth is thinking of using the loan to buy more coffee seedlings to prepare seedbeds (small nurseries where the plants grow) for the next season, and also tools to clean and prune her plants.

loans.use: To buy coffee plant seedlings and tools for pruning her plants

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to sell fabrics

loans.name: Susy

texts.es: La Sra. Susy esta renovando su crédito individual  en su primera secuencia trabajó pagando puntualmente, ella vende comida (almuerzo y desayunos)en un kiosco que queda cerca de su casa  y  donde se ubica una parada de minibús, le va  bien ahora esta solicitando para la compra de abarrotes por mayor, arroz, papa, fideo, azúcar y otros, ella tiene 3 niños en edad escolar, su esposo por motivo de trabajo aun esta en Argentina y le envía para la alimentación de la familia, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Susy is renewing her individual loan.  During her first loan cycle she repaid her loan punctually.  Susy sells meals (lunches and breakfasts) from a kiosk which is located near her home, at a minibus stop.  Her business is doing well and she is requesting this loan to buy groceries wholesale: rice, potatoes, noodles, sugar and other products.

Susy has three school-age children.  Her husband is currently in Argentina for work reasons and he sends money home to cover their family's food expenses.  Susy is a responsible and hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.
