Antonia R. se dedica a la venta de calzados, entre los cuales se encuentran zapatos, sandalias y chinelas. Empezó esta actividad hace 4 años y en este tiempo ha adquirido experiencia para poder administrar el negocio, ahora sabe distinguir los modelos que podrían venderse y los que no.

Desea incrementar el volumen de ventas y con el crédito comprará nuevos diseños de zapatos para tener una nueva oferta para sus clientes. Antonia es casada su esposo es albañil tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad y espera poder terminar de construir su humilde hogar.

loans.use: To buy a new model of sandals to sell

loans.name: Juana Marianela

texts.es:
Ms. Juana Marianela is 38 years old, single, and studied up until the third cycle of accounting; she did not finish her studies because she did not have enough money. She does not have any children and lives in the district of Trujillo in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Liberatad.

The entrepreneur started off selling cookies, soft drinks, beer and as her customers asked her to sell more products she decided to increase her capital and received an invitation from a friend to participate in the communal bank “Luz Divina.” With the first loan she received of 300 soles (US $ 100) she bought rice, oil, beer, etc. With the loan of 1400 (US $475) soles, which will be paid off in six months, she intends to buy coffee, noodles, soft drinks, candy, cookies, eggs, butter, yogurt and soap. She dreams of having a mini-market and a home of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith], Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Juana Marianela tiene 38 años, está soltera, estudió hasta III ciclo de contabilidad, no concluyó sus estudios porque no había solvencia económica, no tiene hijos, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. La empresaria empezó a vender galleta, gaseosa, cerveza, y como los clientes le pedían que venda más productos entonces decidió incrementar el capital y recibió la invitación de una amiga para participar en el Banco Comunal “LUZ DIVINA” con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 compró arroz, aceite, cerveza, etc. Con el crédito de S/. 1400.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses tiene pensado comprar café, fideos, gaseosa, golosinas, galletas, huevos, mantequilla, jabón yogurt. La socia sueña con tener un minimarket y tener una casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase of various groceries

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati S., a 48-year-old woman, is married and has five children. She runs a grocery shop in her neighborhood and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. She needs the loan to enable her to restock her shop with more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil and roasted groundnuts, etc. to scale up sales. 

She is hopeful that she would be able to raise enough income to sponsor her kids' education.  She would be thankful for that support; she is a member of the group called "Hakuri" group Trust, meaning Patience's. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, boxes of cigarettes, cartons of vegetable oil, evaporated milk etc.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Salma from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children between the ages of two and 13 years. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because her parents do not take care of her. Salma has been running a stationary business since 2007. Stationary sales is a business in which micro-entrepreneurs demonstrate their business savvy, with most sellers placing their shops, stalls, or tables strategically close to post offices, banks, schools and universities. Her business is doing well. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, five days per week and is assisted by one employee. Salma currently earns about 300 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to purchase more stationary supplies. In the future, she plans to expand her stationary business by adding books, rulers, as well a photocopy machine. Salma thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of stationary

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, ubicado en el Jr. Angamos Mz. A Lt. 40 AAHH Eduardo del Águila, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en venta de jugos. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con dos motokar como herramienta de trabajo, los cuales hace trabajar todos los días para tener otros ingresos económicos.   

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 4 llantas y 6 amortiguadores, y tapizará los asientos, cambiará los frenos, etc.  

Rosa se siente contenta porque gracias a la ayuda que recibe de Manuela Ramos ha mejorado su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the community bank "Corazon de Jesus" located at Jr. Anagamos Mz. A Lt. 40 AAHH in Eduardo del Agila, within the district of Calleria in the province of Coronel Protillo in Ucayali. She is 39 years old and she is mother of 3 children who are still minors and still depend on her. She is married and her husband is the driver of a moto-car. With her first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, amounting to S/.300, she invested the funds in juice sales. She has been with the community bank for the past 8 years.

Currently she has two moto-cars as work tools, which she runs during the days to have another source of income.

With this loan of S/. 1300, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase 4 tires and 6 shocks. She will also recover the seats and change the brakes etc.

Rosa feels very happy because the help she receives from Manuela Ramos she has improved her financial stability.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 4 tires, 6 shocks, will recover the seats and change the brakes etc.

loans.name: Sonak

texts.en:
Sonak S., 28, lives on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is married and has three children; two sons and one daughter. All of them are still young. Her mother also lives with her family.
 
Sonak has been a silk weaver for ten years, which is a skill she learned from her mother when she was thirteen years old. Her husband is a silk weaver as well. They sell their finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to resell in Phnom Penh. Sonak is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase additional silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving business.

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.en:
Abdukodir H. is a 54-year-old cattleman who is married with 6 children. Owing to his father, who was a farmer, Abdukodir has been associated with this business since he was young. He purchases the cattle in the local market and then he raises and sells them. The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort to care for them. Every day, Abdukodir gets up early in the morning in order to feed the animals. And all day, until late at night, he is busy looking after the cattle.

Abdukodir says that he works with only one aim in mind: to provide his children with a proper education. Now, Abdukodir would like to expand his business and purchase three cows. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan in the amount of 4000 Somoni ($ 1200 USD) and with your help he hopes to reach his aim.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to expand his business

loans.name: Bendiya (Fruit De L’Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bendiya de l’association Sabaly kimparana est constitué de 4 femmes qui se connaissent il y’a des années pour la pratique de la même activité. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont chacune 4 enfants au moins et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles dans la préfecture de San, région de Ségou(quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Vendeuses de condiments alimentaires, pour transformer leurs rêves en réalité ces femmes avaient besoin d’un appui financier. C’est ainsi qu’elles ont sollicité Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans maintenant. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt après le remboursement intégral des 4 précédents. Elles se procurent des marchandises au marché de kimparana en gros et revendent en détail sur place, à la maison et devant la porte de leurs maisons.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs d’oignons de piments et divers condiments avec les paysans pour les revendre.
Les membres du groupe Bendiya se propose d’avoir un bénéfice de 90 000 FCFA chacun avec ce prêt.
le bénéfice obtenu sera utilisé pour rembourser l’intérêt du prêt et faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Dans les jours à venir les membres du groupe Bendiya veulent renforcer leur partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’avoir un montant de prêt élevé et diversifier les marchandises.
texts.en:
The "Bendiya" group of the Sabaly Kimparana association is made up of four women who have known one another for many years as they have the same type of business. They average 40 years of each and each have at least four children and live in traditional families in the San Prefecture, in the region of Ségou in Mali. They sell condiments. In order to make their dreams come true, these women need financial help. This is why they have been working with Soro Yiriwaso for three years now. This is their fifth loan, having repaid all four previous loans in full. They buy their goods in bulk at the market of Kimparana and retail them in the same market, from home and in front of their homes. This current loan will be used to buy bags of onions, peppers and various condiments from farmers to resell. The "Bendiya" group members expect to make a profit of 90,000 FCFA each thanks to this loan. The profits will be used to pay back the interest on the loan and to contribute to the household expenses. In the future, the members of this group want to reinforce their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to borrow a greater amount and diversify their merchandise.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonings/condiments.

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
SOFIA, pertenece al banco comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en Jr. Marañon Nº 144 – Distrito de Callería, tiene 49 años de edad, 05 hijos, su esposo trabaja en el magisterio como personal administrativo, es socia hace 8 años en Manuela Ramos.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, con los cuales compró 01 balde de aceite, 01 saco de azúcar, 02 racimos de plátanos (para preparar sus chifles), refrescos, curiches (marcianos), para venderlo en un centro educativo muy conocido en la ciudad de Pucallpa. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compro 01 saco de aguaje, un ciento de cocona, 01 saco de azúcar, bolsas para sus chifles y sus chupetes, 5 Kg. canchita poorcorn, 3 racimos de plátanos.

Ella está muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por que es una organización que ve y apoya a todas las mujeres que desean progresar y en algún momento ser grande.
texts.en:
Sofia belongs to the “Vecinas Unidas” (“Neighbors United”) cooperative bank located in the Callería district. She is 49 years old, has five children, and her husband works as an administrator in the education department. She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for eight years. She used the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received to buy 1 bucket of cooking oil, 1 sack of sugar, 2 bunches of bananas (to make her “chifles”, or fried banana snacks), and beverages to sell in a well-known educational center in the city of Pucallpa. With this loan of 1,000.00 Peruvian soles, she bought 1 sack of palm fruit, 100 cocona fruits, 1 bag of sugar, bags for her snacks and lollipops, 5 kg. of canchita corn snacks, and 3 bundles of bananas. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos because it is an organization that supports all women who wish to get ahead and one day be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 1 sack of palm fruit, 100 cocona fruits, 1 bag of sugar, bags for her snacks and lollipops, 5 kg. of canchita corn snacks, and 3 bundles of bananas.

loans.name: Silia

texts.en: Silia O., age 58, is married and has seven children. She has two years of experience in farming. She sells to the villagers and public two days per week. She has has two previous loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 240 Tala (~$100 USD).  SPBD loans are Silia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of the loan will be use to fix their toilet to improve their living situation.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and equipment for her business

loans.name: Arowaji

texts.en: Arowaji bakes cakes and meat pies and sells shoes. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more baking items. She is 39 years old with three children. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baking items

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Hải Nguyễn Thi is a 44 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá, Vietnam.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children.  Hải owns & operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling manufactured products to local businesses and community members.  Hải has been involved in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2003, Hải joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and become involved in having a business.  Hải has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase machinery to expand the business.  Hải is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the H. from TYM Fund.  Hải plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
These people are Ramatu J., Mohamed S. T., and Mariama J.. They calle their group Believe in God. This is the first loan they are getting from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and improve their standard of living.

Ramatu (left) is the leader of this group. Ramatu was born in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown, the capital of Sierra Leone. She is forty-nine years of age, married with seven children, three of whom are still in Junior and Senior Secondary Schools. Her husband is a businessman, too. Ramatu sells cottons, second-hand clothes and cartons of eggs. She has been a businesswoman for over twenty years now. She will invest this loan in her business.

loans.use: Invest in her cotton and used-clothing business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret E. is 47 years old. She is married and mother of four children and lives with her family at Mankessim in Central Region of Ghana.

She has traded in metal and plastic materials like plates, buckets, bowls, cooking utensils etc. for the past five years. She requests a loan to augment her working capital to buy more stock of metal and plastic materials to sell. She believes the loan will enable her to raise more income to support her family.

Margaret is a member of a community group called Good Shepherd Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of metal, plastic and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Elpedio

texts.en:
Elpedio O. is from the city of Ramon Chavez, Cagayan de Oro. He is 48 years old. Elpedio is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Elpedio owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from processing and selling pork products in the local community, particularly pork longganisa and tocino. Elpedio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from this work.

In 2008, Elpedio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. He became a member in order to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Elpedio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Elpedio is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make his food products for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Elpedio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for his food-selling business

location.town: Ramon Chavez, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente S., a 56-year-old native from Norala, South Cotabato, values education so much. He is very determined to work harder to earn more to support the schooling of their four children. He wants to expand his present farming business in order to elevate their financial capacity to send their children to college. He wants to at least acquire an additional hectare (2.5 acres) of land and sustain his business needs for more seeds and other farming materials. He is currently applying for Php 10,000 loan from the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) as additional capital for the business.

Vicente is very satisfied with the services he gets from CEVI especially his chance to mingle with other people and be able to hear fresh biblical revelations in their monthly meetings.

loans.use: To buy seeds and other farming necessities

loans.name: Calvin

texts.en:
Calvin J. is from the town of Sapang Dalaga. He is 59 years old, married, with 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Calvin owns and operates a business venture in the service sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from the revenue of using a van for transportation services. Calvin has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from his business.

In 2006, Calvin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Calvin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Calvin is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used for renewal of the registration for his van and franchise expenses. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Calvin from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for renewal of registration for van.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary D. is divorced and has 5 dependents. She has received no formal education. Mary sells fish at Nyayeye near Elmina, which she has done since 2004. Mary uses her income to pay bills. Mary will use the loan to buy more fish to increase sales and expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more fish to increase sales and expand her business

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni tiene 25 años, es una joven muy trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Su negocio de venta de ropa ha sido una actividad que le ha ayudado a obtener los ingresos necesarios para sostenerse por sí sola. A los 18 años decidió independizarse y salir de la casa de sus padres, y hoy es una de las vendedoras de ropa más solicitadas del mercado Tupac Amaru (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca). Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, ya que hace mucho frió, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender con más comodidad su mercadería. Este es el primer préstamo de Marleni con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa, para así incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en stock.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Chorn S. is a 39-year-old farmer and married woman. She currently lives in her own small home located in the rural area of Kompong Tom Province. She has been living with other members and managing the farming business since 1979. Chorn S. is married with three single children who are dependent on her income. Her husband helps sustain the family by working as an ox-trader. He always buys cows at reasonable prices from people who live far away, and he sells those cows to bring in income.

Chorn S. thinks that her husband’s trade is a very profitable one for her family and she hopes to improve it with assistance from Kiva’s partner HKL. She will use this loan to purchase many cows to sell.

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is thirty – seven years old. She is divorced and has give birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Elizabeth is a trader. She trades in pastries. She supplies to retailers and snack bar operators in her community. Elizabeth also hawks to sell in her community. She buys her goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for over twelve years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Acheter des intrants et d’augmenter sa surface cultivable

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza E. is 42 years old. She is married with 6 children, all of whom attend school. Her husband works as a business man.

Eliza is currently in the business of selling bread and charcoal, and she is requesting a loan in order to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.


About BRAC

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Chann Sim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty one people who are all living in Troeuy Troeng village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. They will each use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Chann S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. Chann S. is farmer who owns a 2-hectare (5-acre) field on which she cultivates rice. On this plantation she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan.

Her husband, Mr. S. Sal, is a fisherman. This couple has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is an electrician and the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed for her rice field

loans.name: C 4560 Korankore B Group

texts.en:
Marie Claire is 42 years old and is married with four children aged between 7 and 20 years. An upstanding member in her community, Claire has been the president of a group called Korankore B since 2005. This group wholesales organic, tree-based charcoal. This is a competitive business that Korankore B has made a name for itself in and benefits from that reputation. The hours of the business are from early in the morning up to 5 p.m. every day except Sunday.

The members of this group are requesting their first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders for the purpose of expanding their business through purchasing more charcoal wholesale at better prices. With this loan, they hope that their life will change progressively as they can make more money through their efforts and set aside some savings for their respective futures.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and supplies wholesale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia MARIA es una humilde madre que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

La socia tiene 65 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene seis hijos; tres son varones y tres son mujeres.  Ella vive en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de víveres. Ella compra comestibles de los mayoristas y después los vende a sus vecinos. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital de la tienda de abarrotes comprando más azúcar, arroz, cerveza y gaseosos.
  
 La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria is a humble mother who is a member of the village bank "Virgen de Chapi" She is 65 years old and lives with her partner and has 6 children, three boys and three girls. She lives in the Santiago district in the Cusco province. She has a small business selling food supplies. She buys them from bulk sellers and later sells them to her neighbors. She has worked for several years in this business and its going well thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. Our partner is a hardworking, enterprising mom who has moved her family forward. She would like a loan to increase the capital for her store and buy more sugar, rice, beer and soda. She feels very thanksful for the opportunity to have this loan and at the same time has promised to complete her payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, beer and soda

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen  M.  R., nació y habita en el barrio Barlovento de Barranquilla, antiguo comunidad de invasión, altamente vulnerable y caracterizado por la actividad de reciclaje. Desde pequeña estuvo vinculada con la actividad de elaboración de alimentos, porque que sus padres  ejercían este oficio a las afueras de la antigua intendencia fluvial, que funcionaba en el sector, por su cercanía con un brazo del rio mas largo de Colombia “El Magdalena”.
Hija  mayor de cuatro hermanos vivió con su madre el  abandono de su padre, fue asi como se vio en la necesidad de ayudar en los quehaceres domésticos y en los propios del negocio cuando apenas contaba con 10 años de edad, para poder sacar a delante a sus hermanos menores, esto impidió que estudiara, pues la lectura y escritura  no era su necesidad práctica y no era importante en la concepcion familiar  de esa época. 
Replicando la historia de sus padres, María del Carmen después de comprometerse tuvo hijos gemelos y al principio su cónyuge suplía las necesidades básicas de su familia,   pero en corto tiempo los abandonó, teniendo que trabajar fuertemente para sacar adelantea su familia; sin estudios y con el conocimiento del oficio aprendido desde niña,  comenzó a vender  arepas de huevo, empanadas, caribañola  y comida rápida en los pueblos cercanos donde se realizaran las  fiestas patronales. De la mano de una segunda relación, que por su muerte duró muy poco, construyó su casa, educó a sus hijos hasta llevarlos a realizar una carreta técnica y  con el correr del tiempo adquirió el restaurante que su madre dejó al fallecer  el que hoy funciona en su vivienda y en él trabajan su  hija y  su hermana.
Apoyada financieramente por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con dos créditos reembolsados exitosamente, ha logrado adecuar la infraestructura de su negocio haciendo mejoras locativas.  Con su  tercer crédito, Maria comprará sillas, utensilios,  pues ha aumentado su clientela y cuando llegan deben esperar a que se desocupen los espacios donde almorzar y en ese momento todo se vuelve un caos;  igualmente  invertirá en la compra arroz,costillas de cerdo,tocino, pollo vinagre,aceite, verduras y alcaparras que son los ingredientes para elaborar pasteles, hayacas o comidas especiales,armadas con hojas de bijao, que es una de sus especialidades y asi aprovecharà  la costumbre de consumos que tiene la clientela en estas épocas del año, para aumentar sus ventas.
María De la mano de su hija  que la apoya en la lecto escritura, participa en proceso formativos empresariales   y juntas aplican lo aprendido en beneficio del restaurante.  En ella,  resaltamos su alegria, tenacidad, su labor de amor, entrega, sacrificio y trabajo constante,   pues se ha sobrepuesto a la adversidad  para bridarle a su familia un mejor bienestar;  su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos puedan continuar con el negocio, tecnificado y perpetuándolo atreves de las nuevas generaciones, su mayor preocupación es la inestabilidad laboral  que reina y pone en riesgo la cartera, por ellos dirige sus esfuerzos a conservar sus mejores clientes y a conseguir mayor numero de aquellos que compren de contado para minimizar el riesgo
texts.en:
María del Carmen M. R. was born in and lives in the Barlovento neighborhood of Barranquilla. It is an ancient community, which was invaded. It is extremely vulnerable. It is characterized by the activity of recycling. Since she was little she was involved in making food because her parents did. They did this on the outskirts of the ancient town river. They worked in this area because of its proximity to a branch of the largest river in Colombia, El Magdalena. She is the oldest of four siblings. She lived with her mother and the abandonment of her father. That is why she saw the need to help with the household chores and with the business when she was barely ten years old. She helped in order to get her younger siblings ahead. This prevented her from going to school. Reading and writing were not a practical necessity, and they were not important to the families of that era. Repeating her parents’ history, María del Carmen had twins after becoming engaged. At first, her spouse supplied the basic family necessities. But, after a short amount of time he abandoned them. She had to work very hard to get her family ahead. Without an education, and with the knowledge of the work she learned as a child, she started to sell “arepas de huevo” (egg-filled savory corn cakes), empanadas, “caribañola” (small pie made with dough or puree of yucca that is filled with stew like ingredients and then fried), and fast food in the towns that are close to where the festivities for the national holidays are held. As a result of her second relationship, which lasted a short amount of time because he died, she built a house and educated her children until they had a technical career. As time went by, she acquired the restaurant that her mother left her when she died. The restaurant is now in her house, and her daughter and her sister work there. Financially helped with two loans, which she successfully repaid, from the Mario Santo Domino Foundation, she has been able to make on-site improvements to the infrastructure. With her third loan, María will buy chairs and utensils. Her customers have increased, and when they arrive they have to wait for empty spaces to eat. Everything then turns into chaos. She will also buy rice, pork ribs, bacon, chicken, vinegar, oil, vegetables, and capers; which are the ingredients for making pies, “hayacas” (cornmeal, meat and vegetables wrapped in banana leaves) or special foods; which are made from bijao leaves. This is one of her specialties. This way she takes advantage of the consumer habits that the customers have this time of year, and she will increase her sales. María’s daughter helps her with reading and writing to participate in the business trainings. Together they apply what they have learned to benefit the restaurant. Her happiness, tenacity, love of work, deliverance, sacrifice and constant work stand out to us. She has overcome adversity to give her family an improved well being. Her greatest goal is that her children be able to continue with the business. The business will be technically updated and perpetuated through the new generations. Her greatest worry is the labor instability that reigns and puts the economy at risk. Therefore, they direct their efforts towards keeping their best customers and getting a greater number of customers to buy with cash to minimize the risk.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chairs, utensils, and ingredients to make food and her specialties

loans.name: Torng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Torng D. is the group leader of four people in Kampao Village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who earns a small income from the 1-hectare field which she owns where she cultivates rice. She now has a problem in her farming because she does not have enough money to buy seed rice to cultivate rice.

She therefore decided to ask for a loan to buy seed rice, using the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to support the field. Her husband, Mr. Nil Khim, helps her with the farming. Mrs. Torng D. is the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another two are students in the local school and the other one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy seed rice to cultivate rice and to buy fertilizers to support the field

loans.name: Candida Del Rosario

texts.es: Candida Rosa tiene 73 años, este no es el primer financiamiento que ha solicitado pues todos le han sido de mucha ayuda en su negocio. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de cafetín. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio, este negocio inicio con la intención de buscar mayores ingresos económicos y así poder darle a su familia lo necesario por lo que el servicio que ella brinda a sus clientes es el mejor. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como es jugos, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, pan, galletas y agua embotellada. Su deseo es seguir viviendo.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa is 73 years old. This is not the first loan that she has asked for and all of the loans have been very helpful in her business. She works in providing the services of a coffee bar. She has been working in this humble business for more than ten years. This business began with her intention of looking for a better income to therefore be able to give her family the necessities for life, and for that, the service that she provides to her customers is the best. She is asking for this loan to purchase raw materials such as juice, soda, natural drinks, bread, cookies, and bottled water. Her desire is to continue living.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en: Bahaa has owned a beauty salon for women in his town since 2008 and has 11 years of experience in this occupation. He decided to be independent and works on his own after having his first child. He bought a new shop and makes the necessary décor and started receiving clients. He’s very convinced by this new step in his life. Today, Bahaa is requesting to borrow $1,200 to add new decor to his salon and buy more equipment and tools needed in order to complete the preparation of his salon and be in the requisition of his customers.

loans.use: add new decor to his salon and buy more equipment and tools

loans.name: Thikay Maya

texts.en:
Mrs. Thikay Maya D. is a farmer in the village of Chapagaun. She owns a piece of land where she grows green vegetables. She sells her vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening daily. This business helps her contribute something to improve the living standard of her family. Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers for her agricultural farming.

Mrs. D. lives with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Ram Bhai D., is also a farmer. She has one daughter and one son. Her daughter is studying in grade nine and her son is studying in grade four.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Being a member of Kiva's first field partner in the Philippines, ASHI, Estrella L. had been receiving loans since 1996. Loans she received then have enabled her to have several businesses managed by her husband, her children and herself. Fishing gear she purchased for her husband’s fishing business has increased the volume of fish she sells, while the motorcycle she bought for a transportation business has been one of her son’s regular means of income. 

Estrella’s four children have not gone to college. They all live with her because they don’t have their own families for now. Her eldest is 4o years old and is working as a part time construction worker, the same as her 30-year-old son. Her youngest and only girl works as a domestic helper in Manila.

Despite being poor and frustrated because of her failure to graduate her children from college, Estrella is still determined to provide them with a better kind of life through the loans she can access through ASHI and Kiva. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase another motorcycle to be managed by one of her sons. Through this loan, his income will be regularized to support his own needs. Estrella also wishes to purchase more fishing gear for her husband so that they can increase their profits and will be able to purchase appliances for their small house. This is because she wants her children to experience a more comfortable kind of living.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and fishing gear.

loans.name: Norith

texts.en:
Mr. Norith P., 36 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Savoeun You, 35 years old (pictured together), live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1996 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school.

Norith has been farming for three years, growing lotus and melon on his farmland in the village. His wife has been running a grocery store since 2006.

Norith is asking for his first loan of $600 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his lotus and melon farm and he will also use a part of the loan to help fund his wife’s business.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide and to purchase groceries for his wife's business

loans.name: Noé

texts.es: Noé R. R. de 50 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa la cual le ayuda en el negocio, cociendo ropa, y así mismo junto a sus cinco hijos de 16, 14, 11, 6 y 4 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Noé es un señor muy trabajador y responsable, el cual se dedica a trabajar en su propio taller de costura, en el cual se encarga de elaborar ropa para niños, hombres y mujeres, las cual comercializa de forma ambulante o en su propia casa, lugar en el cual esta ubicado su negocio. Su esposa le ayuda con el taller, elaborando también prendas de vestir, de manera que puedan cubrir los pedidos a la medida del menor tiempo posible, ya que esto habla muy bien de su negocio y les permite obtener nuevos clientes. Noé solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de tela en diferentes colores y estampados, hilos, agujas botones y todo lo necesario para la elaboración de la ropa. Para Noé es muy importante poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este le permite poder sostener a sus cinco hijos y de esta manera brindarles todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Noé R. R. is 50 years old and lives in Lourdes Colón, located in La Libertad department. He lives with his wife, who helps him with his business, which is sewing clothing. He also lives with his five children, who are 16, 14, 11, 6, and 4 years old and are all in school. Noé is a very hardworking and responsible person. He works in his own sewing workshop where he makes clothing for children, men, and women. He sells them as a traveling vendor, or from his own home, which is where his business is located. His wife helps him in the workshop by also sewing clothing. In this way they can fill orders as requested in the least amount of time possible. This speaks well for their business and allows them to obtain new clients. Noé is requesting a loan with which he will buy a larger quantity of fabrics in different colors and patterns, threads, needles, buttons, and everything necessary for making clothing. It is very important to Noé to improve his business because this will allow him to provide for his five children and give them everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothing--fabric, threads, needles, buttons, etc.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy sells groceries and also makes beads to sell in her shop: she has been in this business for the past 14 years. She is 45 years old, married with four children. She lives in Lagos state. 

Mercy is very focused and hardworking. Her greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more groceries and beads to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and beads to sell

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie T. is from the village of Bitibut Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Jessie is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie owns & operates a retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as some food for snacks, eggs, sugar, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Jessie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Jessie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Muong

texts.en: Muong I. is an older woman, 69 years old, and a resident of the rural area of Phnom Penh, where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a widow and the good mother of eight children. Two are single and six are married and live away from home. To help meet her family's expenses, one of her daughter's is working in the garment factory. Muong I. will be using her first loan to buy more tools for her farming operations.

loans.use: To buy more tools for her farming operations.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo E., 51 years old, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is married and has 5 school-aged children. Reynaldo owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for more than 20 years.

Reynaldo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynaldo has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Reynaldo from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sip

texts.en: Mrs. Sip T. has been in the cultivating business for years. She plants rice and vegetable crops to earn a living. Her husband operates his own small business, fishing in and around the river. This couple has been married for many years and has six children. Four of the children are married and three are teenagers going either to school or work. Fishing is the significant source of income for this family and it has provided them with a steady profit. This season is good for fishing. However, Sip T.’s husband doesn’t have enough equipment for his fishing activities. So, Sip T. is requesting a loan to use towards purchasing fishing equipment.

loans.use: To use towards purchasing fishing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase zinc, sand, blocks, and other materials for making improvements to his home

loans.name: Musana Kwebisaho, Ntungamo Group

texts.en: K. Mariat, who leads this loan group, is a hard-working and optimistic 52-year-old mother with eight children who range in age from 11 to 25. She operates a  business in the Kyangara Trading Centre, where she buys and sells coffee beans. She has been in this line of work for 20 years, and in that time has managed to significantly improve her family's living standards and pay to educate her children. By all appearances, her business is in good shape, and produces revenues of almost 500,000 Ugandan shillings a month. The prospects for growth also seem strong, which is why she is applying for a loan to buy more items to sell in her shop. By increasing her income, this loan will allow her to continue paying for her children's education, expand her business, and develop a small plot of land she owns into a profitable farm.

loans.use: To expand several small businesses

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida L. is currently in the business of selling both fresh and dried fish at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes, onions and jerrycans of cooking to sell.  

Saida is 24 years old and married to a driver. She has two children, one of whom goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes, onions and jerrycans of cooking to sell

loans.name: Akakpo Adjovi

texts.fr: D.  est mère de famille, elle a 3 enfants et vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de bè souza. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de mercerie. elle fait ce commerce depuis 2006 et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. elle demande de WAGES un crédit pour augmenter son stock et gagner plus d'argent surtout en ce début de rentrée scolaire où la demande est très élevée
texts.en:
D. is the mother of three children. She lives with her family in the neighborhood of Bè Souza. She makes a living selling haberdashery items. She has been doing this since 2006, and she gets her supplies at the big market of Lomé. She is seeking a loan from WAGES to increase her stocks and boost her income, especially with the start of the school year where demand is very high.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various haberdashery items

loans.name: Marites' Group

texts.en:
Marites S. is from the village of Bayo, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 39 years old. Marites is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marites is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from tending a canteen near the school. Marites is just starting this business.

In 2010, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita M. is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 52 years old,  married, and has nine adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Unico Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario Único está integrado por tres socias, las cuales realizan diferentes actividades económicas en la comunidad. La coordinadora del grupo es la sra. Nolvia del Carmen Munguía, ella tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene seis hijos, y junto a su familia reside en el Barrio Solares Nuevos en el municipio de La Unión, Olancho.  Nolvia es una mujer luchadora que desde muy temprana edad inició a trabajar para ganarse la vida, en la actualidad tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación que atiende ella y su esposo  y como su negocio es muy visitado por sus vecinos tienen un horario de atención de 6:00 am a 9:00 pm. La sra. Nolvia por los momentos no enfrenta ningún problema de salud pero en algunas temporadas las ventas bajan y sus ganancias también.  Su meta es ampliar el negocio y de esta forma aumentar sus ganancias para que su estilo de vida mejore. Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar azúcar, arroz, refrescos, manteca, carnes, pollo, embutidos, pan, galletas, churros, dulces, condimentos, pastas, etc. Con el apoyo del préstamo tendrá más y mejor surtido su negocio y sus clientes podrán encontrar todo lo que necesitan. Ella tiene varios ciclos en FAMA y está  muy agradecida con el apoyo que ha recibido y es una persona muy responsable en sus pagos.  Las otras integrantes del grupo son: Vilia Oneida L. Z., ella solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en su pulpería y Carmen María T. para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos que vende de forma ambulante en la comunidad.
texts.en:
The "Solidario Único" group is made up of 3 members, who each has her own economic activity in the local community. The group's co-ordinator is Señora Nolvia del Carmen Munguía. She is 49 years old, married with 6 children, and lives with her family in the Solares Nuevos neighbourhood, in the town of La Unión, Olancho. 

Nolvia is a determined woman who began working for a living at a very young age. She now has a small grocery store in her home, which she and her husband run. The store is well-used by their neighbours, with opening hours from 6am to 9pm. For the moment, Señora Nolvia has no health problems, but there are seasons when sales drop and so do her earnings. Her goal is to grow the business and in this way increase her earnings to improve her quality of life. She is seeking the loan to buy sugar, rice, soft drinks, butter, meat, chicken, canned foods, bread, cookies, churros, sweets, sauces, pasta, etc. With the help of the loan, she will have more and better stock in her store, and her customers will be able to buy everything they need. She has worked with [field partner] FAMA before and is very grateful for the support she has received. She is very reliable in making her repayments. 

The other members of the group are: Vilia Oneida L. Z., who is seeking the loan to invest in her grocery store, and Carmen María T., who will invest in buying cosmetics that she will sell door-to-door in her community.

loans.use: To buy groceries generally

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora de 45 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 12 años, se dedica a la venta de bisutería, así como en la confección  y venta de rosarios y denarios para las iglesias y demás tiendas comerciales del mercado central. En sus inicios, tejía cadenas, armaba collar de perlas en fantaseo y dijes de rosarios, pues le resultaba muy tedioso y a veces no se abastecía, con los pedidos que le pedían. Desde entonces manda a tejer las cadenas y perlas a sus vecinas y amigas y desde entonces le va muy bien; ahora cumple con todos los pedidos que le solicitan. Es por ello que se siente muy feliz  con el trabajo que realiza y para mejorar la modalidad de sus ventas, todos los modelos los plasmó en un catálogo, desde ahí ofrece los modelos de rosarios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que le es muy rentable, permitiéndole pagar a sus 4 tejedoras y para el futuro, planea ampliar su mercado, de esa manera poder ganar más y terminar de construir su casa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas oportunamente. Con este crédito que solicita, comprará cruces y alambres por kilos, de ese modo pueda abastecer todos los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Martha, age 45, is a hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children. For the past twelve years, she has been selling trinkets. She also makes and sells rosaries and crucifix charms to sell to churches and at commercial stores in the central market. In the beginning Martha produced her own woven chains, pearl necklaces, and rosary charms. However, the work was tedious and she sometimes did not have enough supplies to complete her orders. Then she contracted the work of producing chains and pearl necklaces to her friends and neighbors and has done very well since then. Now she is able to complete all of the orders that are submitted to her. For this reason, Martha is very pleased with the work she has accomplished and wants to improve her sales methods. All of her products are contained in a catalog from which she offers every type of rosary. What she enjoys most about her job is that it is profitable and allows her to pay her four workers. In the future, Martha has plans to expand her market so that she can earn more and finish the construction of her house.

This is her first loan with MFP. Martha knows that this loan will be beneficial to increase her operating capital, so she promises to submit all of her payments on time. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy crucifixes and craft wire by the kilo so that she can complete all of her orders.

loans.use: Purchase crucifixes and craft wire for making rosaries

loans.name: Lokumu Plus Group

texts.en:
Jeanine M. is the manager of the group “Lokumu Plus,” made up of ten members. They are firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Jeanine runs a general store and sells second-hand clothing in her area. She has been a micro entrepreneur for years. She has good relationships with her customers. She likes her business and is working hard to achieve her goal of ordering bundles of second-hand clothing from abroad. She is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC, who has already received five different loans and has repaid them properly. 

She intends to use the next loan to buy two bundles of used clothing to resell to increase her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $50. Jeanine is 40 years old, married and the mother of two children who are 23 and 24 years old. Both are students.

loans.use: To purchase two bundles of used clothing and resell them at a profit

loans.name: Gladys Angelica

texts.es: Gladys Angelica Z. de 33 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Marcos, en donde vive junto a su esposo y junto a dos hijos de 12 y 11 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Gladys posee su propia panadería, en la cual se encarga de elaborar el pan y posteriormente comercializar tanto en su casa, lugar en el cual esta ubicada la panadería, como a sus clientes, a los cuales debe ir a repartir el pan. Cuenta con el beneficio de poseer muchos clientes los que hacen pedido en grandes cantidades y que son fieles a su negocio. Gladys solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina por mayor para poder obtenerla más barata, así como también manteca, azúcar, levadura y otros productos más los cuales son muy importantes para la realización del pan. A pesar que salir adelante con su negocio ha sido bastante difícil, ella ha sabido mantenerse firme con el deseo de crecer como micro empresaria y así brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gladys Angelica Z. is 33 years old.  She lives in the town of San Marcos together with her husband and two children aged 12 and 11 who are in school.

Gladys owns her own bakery where she makes bread.  She sells the bread from her home, which is where her bakery is located, and she also delivers it to her customers.  Gladys has many customers who make large orders and who are loyal to her business.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy flour wholesale so that she can obtain it more cheaply.  She will also buy butter, sugar, yeast and other products which are important for making bread.  In spite of the fact that getting ahead in her business has been quite difficult, Gladys has known how to stick to her desire to grow as a small businesswoman and thereby provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making bread

location.town: San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
La Sra. Avelina de 64 años de edad, casada con el señor Antonio Valdez hace 47 años, quien a su vez trabaja en la  venta de artículos de  bijouterí y lentes de sol en forma ambulante.
Es oriunda de Pedro Juan Caballero, y  había venido a Asunción hace ya 36años atrás, ya estaba casada y ya tenía  6 hijos, como nos había manifestado  al principio trabajaba en casa de familia como doméstica para poder ayudar junto con su esposo la manutención del hogar, vivió en alquiler mucho tiempo, hasta que pudo ahorrar y comprarse para su terreno en donde también al comienzo construyó para su casa de madera.  Además estudió Corte y confección para poder salir del trabajo de doméstica.
Más adelante cuando algunos de sus  hijos empezaron  a trabajar le ayudó económicamente y le compró una máquina para realizar trabajos de costura, que hasta la fecha lo hace con la clientela que ya había formado.
Dice  que se siente realizada porque todos sus hijos son personas de bien y que siempre les ayudan por más que hayan formado sus propias familias.
Con el crédito ella consigue mejores precios y variedad en cuanto a los  materiales que debe  utilizar para la confección de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Avelina, 64, has been married to Mr. Antonio Valdez for 47 years.  He works as a street vendor selling notions and sunglasses.

She is originally from Pedro Juan Caballero and moved to Asunción 36 years ago already married and with six children.  As she stated, at the beginning she worked as a domestic employee in private homes to help her husband support the household.  She lived as a renter for a long time until she was able to save up and buy a lot where she was able to build a wooden house at first.  She also took dressmaking courses in order to get out of domestic service.

Later on when some of her children started working and helping her economically she bought a sewing machine to do sewing jobs which she continues to do to this day with a well established customer base.

She says she feels fulfilled because all her children are upstanding citizens and they always help her even after forming their own families.

The loan helps her buy the things she needs to sew her items in greater variety and at better prices.

loans.use: To buy accessories and notions, fabrics, zippers, buttons, thread.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia R. de 57 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo y un nieto a quien se dedica a cuidar, ella reside junto a su familia en el departamento de San Miguel al oriente del país. Ana es una persona muy responsable, la cual trabaja muy duro para poder salir adelante, ella posee una pupusería, en la cual se dedica a elaborar y vender pupusas, y así mismo a vender bebidas frías y calientes, este es un negocio de mucha importancia para ella debido a que es el que le permita contar con todo lo necesario, por lo que solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo de comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima como: maíz, queso, chicharrón y frijoles, y así también para comprar bebidas de manera que pueda atender a más clientes y contar con más ganancias.
texts.en: Ana Julia R., 57, lives with her son and a grandson whom she takes care of, living with her family in the San Miguel Department in the eastern part of the country.  Ana is a very responsible person, working very hard in order to get ahead.  She has a shop where she makes and sells pupusas, a typical food of the region, selling as well hot and cold drinks.  This business is very important for her because is provides her with what she needs.  She is requesting a loan from Integral in order to purchase greater quantities of raw materials such as corn, cheese, chicharrón, and beans, plus beverages, so that she can take care of additional clients and count on greater profits.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make pupusas

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Yadira de 32 años de edad, habita en colonia la union en el Municipio de nueva Guinea, en su finca que le heredo su papa, de 36 mzs con buenas condiciones tecnicas para el manejo del hato ganadero, es una persona muy querida en su comunidad hay buenas referencias personales de ella; es trajabadora, respondable y honesta; doña Yadira realiza las actividades Ganaderas, y cultivos de tuberculos; siendo la unidad de trabajo la principal fuente de ingresos de igual forma recibe ingresos de la venta de productos lacteos.  

Solicita el apoyo de Kiva en su primer  crédito para compra de ternero de desarrollo, con el objetivo de aumentar su inventario ganadero.  

Sueña con darle una mejor presentacion y explotar mas su unidad de trabajo de esta forma obtener mayor ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs Yadira, age 32, lives in the La Union development in the Nueva Guinea municipality, on the farm that she inherited from her father. It is 36 mzs [manzanas- approximately 62.64 acres] and has good conditions for maintaining a herd of livestock. Yadira is a very well-liked person and her community has provided good personal references for her. She is hard-working, responsible and honest. Yadira works with livestock and grows tubers. This is her main source of income, but she also makes an income from the sale of dairy products.

She is requesting Kiva's support with her first loan which for the purchase of a calf to raise, with the goal of increasing her livestock inventory.

She dreams of having better stock and making more income, thus improving her living conditions.

loans.use: the purchase of a calf to raise

loans.name: Sergio Anibal

texts.es:
Don Sergio Anibal H. G. es trabajado de una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillado desempeñando el cargo de Supervisor Catastral, desde hace 6 años.

Es casado de 41 años de edad, tiene tres personas a su cargo, de las cuales dos son menores en edad escolar. Vive en el Departamento de Managua, en el Municipio de Ticuantepe, desde hace 8 años.

Este es el primer crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL, y lo necesita para cubrir gastos médicos de su esposa. El está agradecido con CEPRODEL por darle este crédito y poder ayudarle a su esposa a mejorar su salud.
texts.en:
Sergio Anibal H. G. has been an employee of a company that provides water and sewer services, in the position of Property Supervisor, for the past six years. 

He is married and 41 years old, and he has three people in his care, two of whom are school-aged children. He has lived in the Department of Managua, in the Municipality of Ticuantepe, for 8 years. 

This is the first loan he has requested from CEPRODEL, and he needs it to pay his wife's medical expenses. He is grateful to CEPRODEL for giving him this loan, so that he can help his wife improve her health.

loans.use: Medical expenses for his wife

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Lucy T., who is in her late thirties, is married with 5 children. She has had a cosmetics business for one year. She works from 3:00pm (afternoon) to 6:00pm, for just three hours, and is able to make a small monthly profit. She sells her products from door to door.

This will be Lucy's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy more cosmetics and has successfully paid back the loan.  She wants a loan to increase her stock.  Her dream is to buy iron sheets to build her mother a house.

Lucy will share this loan with her loan group, Ebenezer, which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the picture, Lucy is holding a small baby in the front row.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Pictured here is Hassan S.. The 45-year-old was born in the village of Matoko; he has 5 children and his wife is a trader. His children are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. 

Hassan has been a businessman since 1994. He sells rice, powdered milk, butter, sugar, mayonnaise, etc. He is seeking a loan of SLL 3,000,000 for the first time from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to further expand his business. With this loan, he will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to his existing stock.

loans.use: Buy rice, powdered milk, butter, sugar, mayonnaise, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina de 21 años de edad, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de ropa en un local del mercado municipal de Jucuapa, el horario de atención es de 7:00am a 4:00pm, lo atiende todos los días de la semana desde hace 3 años.
La familia de Reina son su madre y dos hermanos de 19 y 12 años de edad, por el momento Reina está al frente del negocio y de este ayuda a su madre con los gastos del hogar, Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería específicamente Blusas, Faldas, pantalones y ropa interior, este financiamiento le ayudar a mejorar con el negocio y a tener diversidad de mercadería a disposición de los clientes.
La intención es crecer en el comercio, atender mejor a los clientes y prosperar económicamente junto a su familia.
texts.en:
21 year-old Reina lives in Jucuapa, in Usulután department.  She sells clothes in Jucuapa town market.  She works from 7.00am to 4.00pm every day of the week and has been doing so for three years.

Reina's family consists of her mother and her two siblings aged 19 and 12.  Right now, Reina is in charge of the business and it allows her to help her mother with their household expenses.

Reina is requesting a loan to buy merchandise; specifically blouses, skirts, pants and underwear.  This loan will help her to improve her business and have a range of merchandise available for her customers.  Reina's goals are to grow in her business, to better serve her customers and to prosper financially alongside her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants and underwear

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 40 years old and has five children. One of her children is in school.  Lourdes is married.

Lourdes is in the agricultural business of seaweed culture in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase seaweed and materials for the culture of seaweed (bamboo, nylon etc).

Lourdes has been in this business for 15 years. Lourdes also earns additional income from buying and selling sea cucumber.

In the future, Lourdes would like to own a fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed to be cultured

loans.name: Gulbibi

texts.ru: Уринова Гулбиби проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 53 года. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Её муж находится в России. Сама она имеет среднее образование. Она уже 13 как занимается растениеводством. При доме у нее имеется участок земли, где она сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит просит для закупа семян, чтобы посеять и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Gulbibi U. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 53 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is in Russia. She has a secondary education. She has been working in agriculture for thirteen years.  At her home, she has a plot of land where she sows wheat and grows vegetables for sale. She is taking out a loan to buy seeds to sow so that she will reap a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo Díaz E., tiene la edad de 55 años, está casado  y vive con sus 4  hijos y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El con el préstamo comprara los insumos necesarios para el buen mantenimiento de sus cafetales. El cuenta con la experiencia de varios años en el cultivo y también tiene la plantación ya cosechando, lo que pretende es mejorar sus cosechas y aumentar la próxima producción. Otra meta que él quiere lograr es generar las ganancias necesarias para el sustento de su hogar y poder darles el estudio a sus hijos y puedan llegar a ser profesionales en el futuro 
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Eduardo Díaz E. is 55 years old, married, and lives with his wife and four children who are his highest priorities. With this loan, he will buy the necessary supplies so that he can maintain his coffee plants. Eduardo has several years of experience cultivating, planting, and harvesting coffee. He plans to improve his crops and increase production for the next harvest. Another goal he wants to accomplish is to generate the necessary income to maintain his household and provide his children an education so that they can become professionals in the future.

This is the first loan Eduardo has received from FUDECOSUR. He has had no previous loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for maintaining his coffee plants.

loans.name: El Lirio Group

texts.es:
La señora María Irene  es casada con el señor Rodolfo, con quien procreo tres hijos quienes están a su responsabilidad y son: Carlos Alejandro de dieciseis años de edad en segundo semestre de preparatoria, José Ignacio de catorce años en tercero de secundaria y Víctor de Jesús de dos años  de edad.

    Ella solicito  el préstamo para invertir en la compra de alimentos de pollos de rancho para posteriormente vénderlo en la misma localidad, en esta actividad lleva  dos años y un mes y comenta que le va bien ya que con ellos está logrando tener ingresos en su hogar.

    Ella inicio con esta actividad ya que desea dar lo mejor a sus hijos y para ello tenía que tener una actividad que le diera ingresos, así su esposo y ella trabajan y pueden tener mejor calidad de vida.

     Su más grande deseo es que con el préstamo y su actividad pueda tener sus ahorros para trabajar y seguir apoyando a sus hijos a que estudien y con el tiempo tengan una profesión si ellos así lo desean.
